story:
Background:

Following the massacre of innocents at the Army Public School in Peshawar, a significant change has happened in state policy in Pakistan such that decades of state’s sponsorship of extremism has given way to squeezing of extremist forces and apologist voices. For the first time since 1978, the state seems to allow equal space to peace loving forces to propagate their message. Additionally, Peshawar has also created an impact on the society's psyche making citizens more open to peace messages. However, progressive forces are weak and disorganized and their message marginal, while the masses barely manage acute inequality in life opportunities because of dysfunctional state’s failure to provide the necessities of health and education. Thus, the necessary germs for progressive formations in society which include both discourse and organization are missing. 

What is Needed:

We need to grab the current opportunity and capture our lost public space. In terms of discourse, a society where violence has become a norm, real change requires a deeper understanding of why we accept violence in the name of religion while building an alternative liberation discourse for people to reclaim their public space, public discourse and religion. While peace activists have kept the flame burning during our dark decades, it’s now time to involve wider sections of society through innovative ways in reclaiming our identity of peaceful coexistence and celebration of diversity. In organizational perspective, the single important principle for building active citizenship is contribution in terms of time or funds. Thus, volunteerism and crowdfunding make a good combination for an anti-extremism initiative to be owned by the citizens in every respect.

Initiatives:

We, a group of activists and artists, have started a number of anti-extremism initiatives but need your support to deepen and sustain them: 

1.  Reclaim  Sadha Lahore (Reclaim Our Lahore)

Leaving the usual protest or vigil, “Reclaim Sadha Lahore” tries to engage fellow citizens in public parks, markets etc. to reclaim their cultural space: their heritage, their festivals and their international cricket from hate, extremism and terrorism. It involves engaging citizens in a dialogue on our receding cultural space, asking them to share their thoughts on a cloth scroll, distributing a pamphlet to shops in markets and involving children in an art activity in public parks. All activities are geared to probe and question citizens regarding the society they want for themselves and their children.

This activity (held almost every week) has continued since January 16th. We plan to add live music & other performing arts to the activity to help reclaim our public space. With your support, we want to cover all major markets & parks of Lahore to spread our message among traders & general public.

2.  Public Art

Our success since Peshawar has been the formation of “Awami Art Collective”, whose public art projects in front of the Punjab Assembly commemorating the martyred children of Peshawar, and on March 23 Azm-Pakistan Rally, Lahore signifying the articulation of minority rights in the 1940 Lahore Resolution, have generated discussion among artists regarding their relationship with society. The Collective is now gearing up for a Public Art Exhibition on Violence, to project 40 years of violence on the basis of belief, while commemorating those who we have lost, in an effort to make our reality comprehensible to the ordinary citizen, who has become immune to violence.

We plan to continue with a monthly public intervention with your support to meet our goal of institutionalizing the collective and inspiring more artists to intervene in the public space.

3.  Subvert culture of the Enclosed

Over the years, the physical landscape of Lahore has changed to include barbed wire and concrete blocks. To subvert this sense of enclosed harassment, an installation of Takhti with symbols (hand prints) of youth saying stop will be put on various locations by involving schools to make Takhtis as an art project with their children.

With your support, we plan to engage 40 schools in this activity and continue commemorating Peshawar tragedy till December.

4.  Reclaim Mosque Poster Campaign: 

A poster campaign which lists etiquettes for a mosque (in terms of types of activities and speech that can be held in a mosque) will be pasted outside various mosques of the city. The poster will supplement the rules that have been listed in the plaques of Punjab Usher Department (but not pasted in most mosques). With your support posters will be posted outside 1,000 mosques.

5.  Comic Book: 

Comic Book is one medium which has not yet been explored widely in Pakistani society. An artist is currently at work to produce the 1st issue of a comic book which uses two alien characters and a boy to raise questions. The theme of the 1st issue is Basant. The objective is to attract both the youth as well as children by developing a series of comics on various themes. With your support 5 comic book issues will be printed.

6.  Anti-extremism Literature: 

Although anti-extremism literature exists, it does not have the same access in society as hate literature propagated by various organizations. The objective of this initiative is to produce 5-8 page booklets in easy Urdu which can be sold for Rs. 10-20 at Reclaim Sadha Lahore camps or distributed through stationary shops around the city. The content will be abridged transcriptions of talks of both religious and secular scholars given at partner organizations. With your support, we plan to publish 10 booklets on extremism based on talks of Pakistani public intellectuals.

7. Adopt a Rickshaw for Peace:

The objective of Adopt For Peace is to reach large sections of society with an alternative narrative. We work with and subsidize various rickshaw body makers to make rickshaw's rexine body according to a design or we pay a local painter or truck artist to paint the design. 

This initiative has been on hold for a while now because of lack of funds & of creating support among rickshaw drivers. With your support we will make 20 new peace rickshaws promoting alternative narrative.

Budget Breakdown

The Long-Term

This is but an initiative of progressive sections to reengage society. Long-term social change though requires rebuilding civil society (member based student, labor & community organizations) that can change our current reality of atomized individuals. If you would like to be a long term supporter, please contact us independently to discuss various ideas including establishing youth community centers in low income areas, organizing informal labor or other initiatives that may interest you.

story:
Nous sommes finissants du programme de photographie au Cégep du Vieux Montréal et nous préparons notre exposition de fin de DEC.

Avec pour titre "Planche Contact" elle aura lieu du 28 au 30 mai 2015 à l'Espace Notre-Dame, situé au 3714 Notre-Dame Ouest. Le vernissage sera le 28 mai au soir.

Depuis plusieurs mois, nous travaillons ensemble à la planification de cet événement. Nous avons pris plusieurs moyens pour amasser des fonds: ventes de pâtisserie, soirées-bénéfices, commandites et subventions. Malgré ces efforts, nous sommes encore loin du but. Nous sollicitons donc votre aide, amis et membres de nos familles, pour soutenir notre projet.

Il nous manque présentement un minimum de 500$ pour couvrir les coûts de l'exposition. Cet argent nous aidera à payer la salle, les consommations et la publicité, tous indispensables à la réalisation de l’événement.

Votre soutien et votre participation dans le financement de cette exposition nous réchauffent le cœur et nous vous serons éternellement reconnaissant.

story:
The Art Troupe was started by me, Beth Nicholas.  As a fine artist myself (http://www.beth-nicholas.com) I wanted to start a company which supported other creatives and gave them an opportunity to boost their income through the workshops at the same time as providing them with a platform to further promote their own work.

The Art Troupe has been set up to provide mobile creative workshops throughout the Bristol, Bath and surrounding areas.  The Troupe comprises over 25 professional artists offering a diverse range of exciting activities for all ages and all occasions.  We offer a creative workshop for just about any occasion. We work with schools, devise opportunities for creative team building for companies and activities for hen parties.

 As a unique and enterprising new business we are now being offered a mentoring service to cover all aspects of growing this business.  This is part of the Growth Accelerator scheme which is backed by the British Government to help businesses improve and grow. The scheme  will provide us with coaching, consultancy, mentoring and access to financial advice which will cover every aspect of our business. We need to raise £1300 to cover the cost of this business accelerator programme.  Whatever we manage to raise through this appeal will be applied to the cost of the programme.

The Growth Accelerator is coming to the end of it's contract with the government in April and so, has a limited number of places left for a new business like ours. Having talked to one of their consultants we have been told that what we have to offer is fresh and unique and they will be prepared to take us on.  The cost of this programme is £1,300.

We have also been given match funding for up to £2000 from the government for training, so we are also aiming to rise these finances to ensure we The Art Troupe get the very best help, support, advice and start in our journey to growing this business.

TAT is unique in Bristol in that we offer such a wide range of creative workshops.  We are all young professionals with boundless energy and a proven track record individually.  Together, in our first year of business we have already started to make an impact on the Bristol arts scene, completing several very successful workshops. You can read some of the compliments we have already received from customers when you visit the website. With an even greater understanding of the strategies that help a business to grow we hope to be able to greatly increase our profile and attract an ever wider customer base.

If we manage to raise more than our intended target, we will use that money to hire outside help to support us even further, so nothing will go to waste!

Please take a look at both The Growth Accelorator and our website www.thearttroupe.com

story:
English Version

La Fondazione Pastificio Cerere nasce nel 2005, all’interno del Pastificio Cerere, con l’obiettivo di promuovere e diffondere l’arte contemporanea, attraverso lo sviluppo di rapporti e di relazioni con enti pubblici e privati, istituzioni culturali nazionali ed estere.

Dieci anni dopo la sua nascita, la Fondazione intende celebrare il grande patrimonio culturale che da quarant'anni anima la vita dell'ex Pastificio - importante esempio di riconversione di un edificio industriale - attraverso un ciclo di mostre, curato da Marcello Smarrelli direttore artistico della Fondazione, incentrato sul lavoro degli artisti del cosiddetto “Gruppo di San Lorenzo”: Bruno Ceccobelli, Gianni Dessì, Giuseppe Gallo, Nunzio, Pizzi Cannella, Marco Tirelli. 

Verrà pubblicato un volume in cui saranno raccolte le testimonianze di artisti, critici e intellettuali che hanno vissuto e attraversato in qualche modo il Palazzo ma anche le voci e le memorie degli artigiani, degli abitanti e lavoratori di San Lorenzo che hanno visto cambiare con il passar degli anni il volto del proprio quartiere. La pubblicazione resterà come testimonianza e racconto corale di un periodo storico unico che è appartenuto ed appartiene tanto ai suoi diretti protagonisti che alla memoria di una intera società. Nel corso degli anni infatti critici, intellettuali ed esponenti del mondo dello spettacolo hanno gravitato intorno a questa fucina culturale divenuta un punto di riferimento non solo per l’arte contemporanea, ma per la cultura in generale. Ancora oggi, gli spazi dell’ex stabilimento industriale ospitano studi d’artista, atelier di moda, una scuola di fotografia e studi di grafica e comunicazione.

Attraverso la campagna 6 dei nostri puoi sostenere il progetto e contribuire così alla sua realizzazione. I fondi raccolti saranno impiegati per la pubblicazione del catalogo, elemento centrale del progetto. Non è prevista alcuna forma di compenso per gli organizzatori del progetto.

Nel corso dell'anno 2015/2016, ogni due mesi la Fondazione promuove una mostra personale dei sei storici residenti - che per primi hanno riconosciuto le potenzialità di questo luogo dismesso e per primi hanno deciso di trasferirvi i propri studi fin dagli anni Settanta - e crediamo sia fondamentale riuscire a pubblicare il libro anche grazie al vostro aiuto.

Ricorda, anche una piccola donazione può fare la differenza!

Altri modi per aiutarci
Puoi sostenerci anche condividendo questa campagna sui tuoi social networks, parlandone con i tuoi amici, con chi ama l’arte, partecipando alle inaugurazioni delle sei mostre e a tutte le attività della Fondazione Pastificio Cerere!


English Version.

The Pastificio Cerere Foundation was born in 2005, inside the Pastificio Cerere, with the goal of promoting and disseminating contemporary art through the development of relationships with public and private institutions, both national and international.

Ten years after its birth, the Foundation aims to celebrate the vast cultural heritage that, for forty years now, has animated the life of the former Pastificio – an important example of a repurposed industrial building – with an exhibition cycle, curated by Marcello Smarrelli artistic director of the Foundation, on the work of the artists of the so-called “Gruppo di San Lorenzo” (“The San Lorenzo Group”): Bruno Ceccobelli, Gianni Dessì, Giuseppe Gallo, Nunzio, Pizzi Cannella, Marco Tirelli.

The exhibition cycle will be accompanied by a book comprising various testimonies by the artists, critics and intellectuals who have resided in the building, and in some sense crossed over it, but also the voices and memories of the artisans, inhabitants and workers of San Lorenzo, who have seen the face of their neighborhood change throughout the years. The publication will stand as a testament and a collective tale of a unique historical period that has belonged and continues to belong as much to its direct protagonists as to the memory of an entire society. Throughout the years, countless critics, intellectuals, and exponents of the performance arts have also gravitated around this cultural hive, allowing it to become a reference point not just for contemporary art but for culture in general. Today, the spaces of the former industrial complex continue to host artists' studios, fashion ateliers, graphics and communications studios, and a photography school.

Through the campaign 6 dei nostri you can support the project and contribute to its realization. The funds raised will be used to cover the costs of the printing of the catalogue, nucleus of the entire project. The organizers of the project will not receive any compensation.

During the year 2015/2016, every two months, the Foundation will promote a new solo show by one of these six historical residents - who were the first to recognize the potential of the disused space and the first to relocate their studios to it in the late 1970s - and we believe it is fundamental to publish the book with your help too.

Even a small donation can make the difference!

Other ways to help us
You can always help us by sharing this campaign through your social networks, talking about it with your friends and with anyone who loves art, coming to the six openings and following all the activities of Pastificio Cerere Foundation!

story:
Hello!


I have been selected to exhibit in Venice for the Arte Laguna Prize in the Virtual & Digital Art category (click here for more details).This is an amazing opportunity for me to showcase my work on an international scale and learn from the other artists displaying their work at the event. To display my work in Venice, a city with such a creative and rich art culture, was once only a dream and so this exhibition will allow me to make this a reality. I have the skills and ideas, but I really need your support to pay for materials, transport my artwork to the exhibition and enable me to travel over to install and take down my installation.  


I am a recent Graduate in Fine Art from the University of Cumbria and since, I have been given the opportunity to take my degree show works to Dumfries and Edinburgh.   I am passionate about exploring popular culture through a wide range of mediums, and am currently interested in looking at people's engagement with the internet platform. This has resulted in this installation being hugely influenced by society with the aim of bridging the gap between technology and art. As a way of highlighting my interpretation of this process, I applied for the chance to go to Venice to exhibit my work next to artists with similar passions.  

 

By supporting my artistic venture, you will be allowing me to pay for the materials and expenses that will enable me to showcase my work at the Telecom Italia Future Centre. In attending the exhibition, I feel that I can show my work on a large scale, and learn from the other artists in my field. I will be able to network my ideas and hopefully gain recognition within the art community. 

How you can help...

In order to take my installation to Venice, I need £500 to contribute to:

  • Materials: Green PVC flooring £209; Lightbox £173; Vinyl stickers £100; Lighting bulbs £70; Print of large work £40
  • Transportation of equipment: to and from Venice £150
  • Flights: £150
  • Accommodation: £150

With your help I can make this amazing opportunity happen.  Any donation, no matter how big or small, will bring me closer to fulfilling this goal.

With your support, comes a nice little gift too! As a thank you for making this possible, I would like to give each and every one of you something back. 

I will recognise every contributor in a thank you video after the event has taken place. As well as donating, there is the chance for you to select a perk with your donation, with everything from a postcard of my artwork to a signed print of my work.

Please share this with everyone and anyone.  Even just sharing this, you are helping me greatly in spreading the word! 

Thank you for taking the time to read this, 
Rory Laycock

story:
Who is Never Done

We are The Automotive Lifestyle company. From education, entertainment, custom car parts, performance parts, to clothing, calendars and more! We live and breath automobiles and want to spread that love and lifestyle throughout the world.

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking to raise $2000. To have a kick ass photo shoot filled with awesome custom cars and hot girls and to print all the calendar media we plan on printing!

  • Perks available include calendar magnets to slap on your tool box or fridge, calendar posters, normal posters, pictures, thank you videos, and full 12 month special edition wall calendars! 
  • Funds will go towards production, location, securing top level custom vehicles, photographer, misc. equipment and models.
  • Any extra funds raised will go towards furthering other Never Done projects. We are in need of better video and studio equipment for our videos, and we have several project vehicles that could really benefit from larger build budgets. There are some BIG projects coming in the near future!
  • All digital perks will be sent out at the same time as the physical perks are shipped. 
  • All perks to be shipped will be sent out in November. 

The Impact

  • This project helps give models a chance to work and grow their portfolios in a safe, professional environment. 
  • Awesome cars get a chance to stretch their tires.
  • We think that hot girls and kick ass cars are both awesome! So we're putting them together to make something DOUBLE AWESOME!
  • The proceeds from the calendars and products will go toward creating the best projects we've ever done as well as more educational and entertaining video content. We will buy better video and studio equipment for higher quality, more entertaining content as well as help fund more custom upgrades for our various Never Done vehicle projects.

Risks & Challenges

  • Photo shoots are expensive, and to get the best product we need support.
  • We are asking the Never Done and automotive enthusiast communities to help this year because we want to get you involved and be a part of the awesome things we are creating! We try our very best to make every project better than the last.
Other Ways You Can Help

If you can donate even a dollar every little bit helps and goes towards making this project happen. But if you can't donate you can help in other ways. 

  • Please share this campaign, get the word out!! We want this to get huge
  • Indiegogo has some great share tools but just share this however you can, even the midnight howl works, get the word out.

story:
Short Summary

We've had a very successful first year for the Whitby Community Murals Project. The artists have done a remarkable job on their murals across Whitby and Brooklin. While we have had generous support from sponsors, we still need to raise an additional $1500. This will assist with meeting this years budget and provide seed funding for 2016. 

The Whitby Community Murals Project 2015, an innovative collaboration between businesses, community organizations, local artists, and local government to benefit the citizens of and visitors to our community. A project team of local volunteers has been organized and the lead partners are Station Gallery and the Bell Box Murals Program.  The event is scheduled for Cultural Days September 25 & 26 2015.

The Murals Project is a curated project that promotes original works of art – replacing graffiti. It is a public art forum designed to reflect culture and heritage, enhance a sense of community, and promote local artists.


What We Need & What You Get

In order to make this exciting initiative a reality, we are seeking sponsorship support and donations. Our revenue goal is $12,000. The entire budget depends on generous private support from our community. 

In our inaugural year, we will be painting eight murals across Whitby.  We are seeking support from the community to support us with a donation of any size to help us achieve our goal.


The Impact

  • An innovative collaboration between businesses, community organizations, local artists, and local government to benefit the citizens of and visitors to Whitby
  • A curated project that promotes original works of art – replacing graffiti
  • A public art forum to reflect culture and heritage
  • Enhances sense of community
  • Supports and promotes local artist

The Volunteer Team

Regional Counsellor Liz Roy

Donna Raetsen-Kemp, Station Gallery

Maria McDonnell

Bob Baker

Sue Green

Joan Church

Craig Maxwell

Michael Cavanaugh, Program Director

story:
L’univers de Doris

Doris réalise la fusion alchimique entre les deux facettes de son talent: l’illustration et la calligraphie, l’image et la lettre. Avec élégance et légèreté, elle nous invite dans son univers à la rencontre du rêve, de l’imaginaire et de l’enfance.

Affiche "Enfants de la Lune"


Les dédales de la vie l’entrainent en Bretagne, à Paris et actuellement à la Réunion.


Défilé " Poétiquement Vôtre" (Téléthon)


A travers son art, elle explore aussi bien dans les mondes du droit de l’enfance, du prêt à porter et du spectacle. Ses créations s’égrènent sur tableaux, affiches, livres, costumes, T-shirts, meubles, accessoires de mode...


Arbre à Paroles ( Droits de L'enfant)


La création de Dolune

Aujourd’hui, il est temps pour Doris de lancer sa propre marque DOLUNE de créations sérigraphiées.

Entre la poésie et l'imaginaire, l'art et l'artisanat.... la simplicité élégante.

Top Poétiquement vôtre "Sentiment"


Faire des pièces uniques, des séries limitées et partager ses créations.


Votre participation

Doris vient de terminer un stage de sérigraphie à la chambre des métiers de Saint Gilles. 

Elle utilise actuellement une précieuse machine: un carrousel faite spécialement pour elle par un artisan génial "Arnodin Sonny". 


Et ce ne sont pas les modèles prêts à être sérigraphiés qui lui manquent





Votre participation lui permettra d’investir dans l’achat de tee-shirts, d’une
imprimante, d’un tunnel de séchage et de produits nécessaires pour la
réalisation de ses créations textiles. 

En remerciement, vous recevrez une carte postale, une sérigraphie en édition limitée, un abécédaire, publié sous forme d’affiche « Les enfants de la Lune» (26 lettrines) ou encore des T-shirts de la marque Dolune. 

Cartes postales



T-shirts enfant "Île de la Réunion"


Un grand merci!

Merci de prendre le temps de venir jusqu'ici, de votre aide éventuelle et de partager cette page!

story:
My father passed after 6 months in hospice care. His diagnosis was Lewy Body Dementia which exhibits Parkinson’s and dementia symptoms. 

His wife and I were with him everyday to hold his hand and his heart. It was important to us that he not be alone and that he felt the familiarity of family and the depth of our love for him.
I am writing a book, Ending With Love: A Father-Daughter Dance With Dementia, about my love and experience with the progression of his condition and his beautiful way of surrendering to the last few years of his life.


Why I'm asking for your help:

In order to prioritize this project I need to take some focused time to write.  For that I have decided to ask my community (those interested in this project and reading the book) to support me in this decision.  I hope to be able to complete the writing in 8 weeks, to then work with an editor and to have a completed project by the end of the 2015.

This intimate journey of seeing Dad change over these past few years so rapidly has immersed me in worlds I’d rarely thought of before. Places where 20+ people with memory issues live in a kind of community with unique story lines circling through. This was the greatest mindfulness training of my life that starts with the simple improvisational technique, “Yes, and…”

Whatever arises in anyone there is a listening and a following-the-lead and playing along with what’s happening all the while bringing a sense of calm and peace and safety and reassurance to the person in front me.

We will all eventually find ourselves at the end-of-life, one way or another. Getting comfortable with the conversations and decisions is part of my intention in writing Ending With Love: A Father-Daughter Dance With Dementia.
How can we bring love into a topic most of us don’t want to think about or plan for?

I am now inspired to dive more fully into my own life and service:
I have a lifetime of self-inquiry and mindfulness and now is the time to put it all into practice to be a part of the embodied kindness revolution that (I believe) will bring us all back to a life worth living.
I am ready for a high level training program, masters level study in my world, and want support in leaping into it.

I am raising $60,000:

  • $35,000 for furthering my education of heart, mind and body
  • $25,000 to hire an editor, designer and support my full focus on writing and my next level of immersion and evolution for Ending With Love: A Father-Daughter Dance With Dementia
  • I am offering a variety of supportive tools: guided meditations, several levels of coaching/mentoring, immersions and even a precious piece of artwork from my grandfather, Chuck Jones, from my collection.

How this project can be of benefit:

  • The book Ending With Love: A Father-Daughter Dance With Dementia is timely and already, with my limited sharing of some passages, has impacted people to find peace and presence during a difficult transition with a loved one.
  • I am here to love people into remembering who they truly are. The more deeply I am able to do that with myself, the more I can show others the way. I have big energy and impact and I want that to be all for the upliftment of this world.

I have never written a book before, I have dreamed of it and planned for it, but never made it a priority. This book has been pouring through me, not me going to find it. 

  • I am a very creative and stubborn person and when I want something done, I do everything to complete it. 

You can help in many ways:

If money is not the way you would like to support me, you can share the campaign. Share your experience of me (if we've met, worked together or you just feel drawn to help me).

  • I am grateful for any and all help to move me into this next phase of my life.
  • It's a lovely part of social media, connections are already there if you feel moved, please do share!

May all the energy of love and money and time and good wishes benefit this world in the highest way. May I open my life to the grace that already exists and know that all is being supported by the divine love that is in everyone and everything.

I welcome all support at any level and you may choose to receive a "perk" or opt for no "perk" your choice.

Here's a passage from the book Ending With Love: A Father-Daughter Dance With Dementia:

In 1989 I was drawn to go see the Dalai Lama. I went alone since none of my friends at the time had any interest. 
As His Holiness entered the venue where 5,000 of us waited, I felt a soft yet fierce breeze move through me. I turned to the man next to me startled and said, "Did you feel that?!"
"Feel what?" 
Tonight, as Dad and I shared a quiet dinner in his room to get away from the bustle and crowded places, I felt a soft breeze move through. Dad suddenly opened his eyes from that dreamy distant place and asked, "Did you feel that?"
"Yes, I did."
He and I have been spending the whole day alone on Sunday to give Dee Dee a much deserved timeless day of recharge. 
Dad spent much of the day traveling between worlds, me holding his hands and holding his heart with my prayers.
I could feel the quality of the other side, wherever we come from when we're born and return to when we die. I could feel it shimmering in all my cells. 
It's beautiful.
story_txt:
My father passed after 6 months in hospice care. His diagnosis was Lewy Body Dementia which exhibits Parkinson’s and dementia symptoms. 
His wife and I were with him everyday to hold his hand and his heart. It was important to us that he not be alone and that he felt the familiarity of family and the depth of our love for him.I am writing a book, Ending With Love: A Father-Daughter Dance With Dementia, about my love and experience with the progression of his condition and his beautiful way of surrendering to the last few years of his life.

Why I'm asking for your help:
In order to prioritize this project I need to take some focused time to write.  For that I have decided to ask my community (those interested in this project and reading the book) to support me in this decision.  I hope to be able to complete the writing in 8 weeks, to then work with an editor and to have a completed project by the end of the 2015.
This intimate journey of seeing Dad change over these past few years so rapidly has immersed me in worlds I’d rarely thought of before. Places where 20+ people with memory issues live in a kind of community with unique story lines circling through. This was the greatest mindfulness training of my life that starts with the simple improvisational technique, “Yes, and…”Whatever arises in anyone there is a listening and a following-the-lead and playing along with what’s happening all the while bringing a sense of calm and peace and safety and reassurance to the person in front me.We will all eventually find ourselves at the end-of-life, one way or another. Getting comfortable with the conversations and decisions is part of my intention in writing Ending With Love: A Father-Daughter Dance With Dementia.How can we bring love into a topic most of us don’t want to think about or plan for? 
I am now inspired to dive more fully into my own life and service:
I have a lifetime of self-inquiry and mindfulness and now is the time to put it all into practice to be a part of the embodied kindness revolution that (I believe) will bring us all back to a life worth living.I am ready for a high level training program, masters level study in my world, and want support in leaping into it. I am raising $60,000:

The book Ending With Love: A Father-Daughter Dance With Dementia is timely and already, with my limited sharing of some passages, has impacted people to find peace and presence during a difficult transition with a loved one.
 I am here to love people into remembering who they truly are. The more deeply I am able to do that with myself, the more I can show others the way. I have big energy and impact and I want that to be all for the upliftment of this world.

 I have never written a book before, I have dreamed of it and planned for it, but never made it a priority. This book has been pouring through me, not me going to find it.   I am a very creative and stubborn person and when I want something done, I do everything to complete it. 


You can help in many ways:
If money is not the way you would like to support me, you can share the campaign. Share your experience of me (if we've met, worked together or you just feel drawn to help me).  I am grateful for any and all help to move me into this next phase of my life. It's a lovely part of social media, connections are already there if you feel moved, please do share!   May all the energy of love and money and time and good wishes benefit this world in the highest way. May I open my life to the grace that already exists and know that all is being supported by the divine love that is in everyone and everything.I welcome all support at any level and you may choose to receive a "perk" or opt for no "perk" your choice.Here's a passage from the book Ending With Love: A Father-Daughter Dance With Dementia:

I turned to the man next to me startled and said, "Did you feel that?!""Feel what?" 
Tonight, as Dad and I shared a quiet dinner in his room to get away from the bustle and crowded places, I felt a soft breeze move through. Dad suddenly opened his eyes from that dreamy distant place and asked, "Did you feel that?"

story:
http://www.Fair-Stock.com

Hi, we're Sally and Tom - the creators of Fair Stock. 

We hope you liked our Indiegogo campaign video, and are keen to jump on board and get involved. Here's a bit more information about our goal.

What Is Fair Stock?

Fair-Stock.com is a stock photography website with a huge difference. As it stands, we have not found a single stock imagery website that offers it's contributors any more than 50% commission. The reality is, most offer much, much less - with some offering as little as 0.5% commission. We had to stop and ask ourselves, for what? Sure, they offer a platform to sell on but the main work and creativity is done by the artist. We felt this needed to change. We saw a need for a stock imagery website with the majority of commissions going to the artist. So, we created Fair-Stock.com. Fair Stock offers contributors a game changing 90% commission, with the remaining 10% going to maintaining, marketing, promoting and improving the site/experience. We're empowering artists, and putting money back in the pockets of those who deserve it most. We've had an overwhelming response so far, but for us to continue our good work, we need your help.

Why do we need funding?

  • We need a developer to help us automate and streamline the website's functions, including removing menial manual tasks we are currently required to actively and repeatedly manage. 
  • We need a developer to also help improve the contributor's uploading experience, by adding a bulk upload feature, and the ability to pickup certain file specs so the contributors don't have to manually add these, also error messages if images that are too small or the wrong file type are uploaded.
  • We need funding to maintain, market & advertise Fair Stock, which will help us further promote Fair Stock and build traffic to the site, and in turn, increase the sales of our contributor's work.
  • We also need to increase our hosting. Every website has to be manually hosted somewhere in the world on a physical server. Bigger sites, require bigger servers - and an image based website, like ours, requires very big hosting. This basically will mean the site won't crash every 5 minutes, will be able to hold millions of images, and will give browsers a fast and seamless experience


Why is Fair Stock so important?

Fair-Stock.com is about more than just stock imagery. It's about change. We want to provide a platform upon which artists, worldwide, can potentially make a great living from. We stand for empowering artists, and bringing power back to the people. Real change takes time, effort, and passion - but it also takes people like you recognising that you have the ability to make a real difference to people's lives. 


Have a Suggestion?

We LOVE hearing people's feedback and suggestions. After all, this is a site for artists, by artists, so we welcome any feedback or suggestions that may better everyone's experience! If you would like to let us know of an idea you have - you can submit it HERE.


Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Share us on Facebook, or Like our page - Facebook.com/FairStock
  • Tell your friends & family about Fair Stock!
  • Share our Campaign! :)
  • Send out an email to a friend or network, about us!
  • Share us on other social media networks
  • Join Fair-Stock.com and apply as a contributor
  • Purchase your stock images from Fair-Stock.com

UPDATES! Where are we at?

LAUNCH DAY! Saturday April 25th!
We launched Fair-Stock.com only THREE DAYS AGO. It has been overwhelmingly popular in the last 3 days, with photographers and artists worldwide getting involved and offering support. In terms of stats, here's where we are at:
Website Page Views: 11,564
Sessions: 1,908
Average Session Duration: 04:56
People who come back again: 25%
Photographers who have joined & been approved as contributors: 104
Submissions Added: 124
The ability for Fair Stock to change the industry forever, if funded: 110%
We need A LOT more traffic, uploads - etc. These changes will hugely grow Fair-Stock.com :) We will keep you updated with our progress as we go!

story:
Find out More at http://www.accessart.org.uk/the-accessart-share-a-bird-project/

What is the AccessArt Share-a-Bird Project?

AccessArt announces a brand new project aimed at drawing attention to the importance of visual arts and visual arts education. The Share-a-Bird project encourages artists and makers of all backgrounds to create and send a bird to AccessArt. AccessArt will then redistribute the birds to schools in the UK to inspire new generations. 

We hope the project will help make new connections between artists and schools, provide schools with access to contemporary art/artists AND create a visible demonstration of the diversity and richness of artist/makers in the UK today. 

Pls share with any makers and make sure YOU take part!

What we Need & What you Will Get in Return

The Share-a-Bird Project is coordinated on a voluntary basis by UK Charity AccessArt. We are raising funds to help administer the project and to help cover the cost of posting the birds to schools. 

We are looking for donations, however small, but if you decide to donate £50 or more, we will reward you we a years free membership of AccessArt http://www.accessart.org.uk/join-accessart/become-a-full-accessart-member-2/ (which includes access to over 600 digital visual arts resources, and is worth £42). All donations will be recognised via the AccessArt website. 

What is AccessArt?

AccessArt is a UK charity which aims to inspire and enable high quality visual arts education. We were formed in 1999 by two graduates of the Royal College of Art: Paula Briggs and Sheila Ceccarelli. You can explore our site at http://www.accessart.org.uk 

This Project is Important for Many Reasons:

  • The visual arts are an incredibly important part of our society and AccessArt thinks it's important that we make visible the number and diversity of artists and makers in the UK today.
  • Many schools struggle to incorporate the work of contemporary artists into their art lessons. How many children regularly see art made by artists, in the flesh, up close, close enough to touch?
  • Experiencing art can be incredibly inspiring to pupils and teachers. One art work can inspire a whole series of work in others.
  • Many artists and artist educators would love to make connections with schools in their area, but it can be hard to do so.
What we Hope the Project will Achieve...
  • New connections will be built, between artists, makers and schools.
  • More children will have the opportunity to be inspired by art in the flesh, made by contemporary artists.
  • That the flock of birds will spread many messages as they fly across the country and land in diverse locations: that art is important, relevant and inspirational.

Other Ways You Can Get Involved...

We value your support, even if you decide not to make a cash donation. Find out how you can get involved as an artist, maker or teacher at http://www.accessart.org.uk/the-accessart-share-a-bird-project/

story:
Help bring Haiti's Artists to Europe! 

Haiti is on of the poorest nations on earth but within this earthquake ravaged country artists utilise their creative ingenuity to produce decorative art work made out of 55 gallon recycled oil drums.  

Our goal is to promote this nations artists to Europe. There is a beautiful selection of designs to choose from which can be exhibited in the home, office or garden.  These talented artists deserve to have their work promoted outside of Haiti.

Haiti remains the poorest country in the Americas and one of the poorest in the world  with significant needs in basic services. According to the latest household survey , more than 6 million out of 10.4 million of Haitians live under their national poverty line.

We Can Make A Difference!!!

We can make a difference by helping this nation export its products to the European market.  Widely known and exported throughout the Americans by participating in this fund you will be helping them to expand their product offering to European customers.  

Please scroll down to see the variety of designs these talented people are producing.


Mirror


Sun Metal Art


Tree of Life Metal Art


Towel Hooks


Garden Plant Sticks


Door Numbers


Switch Cover Plates


Five years after the magnitude 7.0 earthquake struck Haiti on January 12, 2010, Haiti has moved from recovery to longer term development as it continues to improve infrastructure and strengthen institutions, work toward increasing access to education, health and other services, and stimulate investment.

In spite of the enormity of the task, much has been done by Haitians and the Haitian Government, in partnership with CSOs, the private sector, and the international community.

Nevertheless, much remains to be done to reduce poverty and improve the wellbeing of Haitians.  
By bringing these artists products to the European market; in a small way we will be benefiting its economy.
If you appreciate these designs as much I do, then please contribute to help take these products to new markets.

story:
WAkh'Art Invite : l'Anniversaire des 4 ans!

 

La structure Wakh Art, promeut depuis sa fondation, l’art et la culture sénégalaise. Notre objectif est de faire de la culture un facteur de développement. L’art au service de la société…

Nos Activités:

À travers le blog culturelle Wakh art, nous rencontrons des artistes et nous les interviewons.  Avec eux, nous créons aussi des évènements, expositions, concerts, représentations, sous le concept de soirée intitulé Wakh art invite.

Wakhart accompagne également les artistes, sur leurs projets artistiques. Nous avons l’ambition de développer et de mettre en place notamment des ateliers d’éveilles et d’initiations à l’art; en partenariat avec différentes écoles nationales.

Nous avons également créer un pole culturelle ouvert au public où la culture est à la porté de la population sénégalaise: La Boite à Idée.

Notre mission:

Nous voulons faire de Wakh ‘Art, la plateforme culturelle, un prisme duquel émanera l’ensemble de la culture sénégalaise. Nous sommes convaincus qu’il est important de mettre en lumière les talents et les créations des artistes et artisans de la scène culturelle sénégalaise. Nous croyons en la richesse culturelle que nous possédons ici au Sénégal. Nous sommes certains que grâce à ces industries culturelles naissantes et solides, le Sénégal arrivera à un niveau de développement important et  ainsi la jeunesse sénégalaise pourra prétendre à un avenir stable et plein de promesse.

La Boite à Idée:

La Boite à Idée est une maison nichée au cœur de la Gueule Tapée.

C’est un espace coloré et dynamique ouvert au public. (en générale sur rdv ou durant une période déterminé).

La Boite à Idée est une projection physique de Wakh’Art. La maison a abrité nombreux shootings, quelques expositions et tournages. C’est également dans ce lieu que les interviews pour la plateforme culturelle Wakh’Art sont faites.

Le public peut découvrir au sein de ces murs, les œuvres des plasticiens avec lesquels nous avons collaboré , mais aussi une bibliothèque contenant Romans, Catalogues, journaux, prospectus etc. Cet espace propose un cadre chaleureux au le public ainsi qu’aux artistes et acteurs culturels. Souvent ils se retrouvent pour échanger et partager leurs idées.

La maison a ainsi vu naître de nombreux projets. Elle a aussi accueillit projection de film, débat, showcase etc. 


Le projet d'anniversaire : Wakh'Art fete ses 4 ans.

Wakh'Art vous invite en décembre à la Guele Tapée pour féter les 4 ans de la plateforme culturelle.

Programme : Décembre 2015

•le 15 décembre : Ouverture de la Boite à Idée.

Découverte de l’espace et de ces œuvres :

Vernissage à 17h de l'Exposition Photo de MalykaDiagana & JbJoire.

•le 17 décembre: Performance : Peinture et Graffiti avec le RBS Crew à la Gueule Tapée.

Peinture de la Facade Extérieur de la Boite à Idée par les artistes du RBSCrew

•Jour 19 Décembre : Exposition Djib Anton

Exposition de Rue . Réalisation Affiches & Baches de l'artiste DjibAnton. Vernissage à 17h.

suivis d'un : Concert de Rue à 20h avec ..Surprise..

Une partie des bénéfices issus de la vente des œuvres servira à financer un atelier créatif « l’art à l’école » dans une des écoles de la Gueule Tapée.


Ce dont nous avons besoin 

  1. Financer les expositions : Frais d'impressions sur supports ; Frais de mise en place ; Déplacements & Installations des Œuvres.
  2. Financer la Fresque: Achat de la peinture, Frais de déplacements des artistes.
  3. Financer un concert de rue : Location du Matériel ( Sono) , Location d'une estrade ; Cachet des Musiciens.

L'impact

Votre contribution permettra de réaliser ce projet d'anniversaire qui nous tiens à coeur. 

  • Vous contribuerez à la mise en avant des artistes et de leurs travaux : Malyka Diagana, Jb Joire, Rbs Crew et Djib Anton.  
  • Vous permettrez au public Dakarois de découvrir un espace culturel; des oeuvres ( photos, fresque, affiches & baches). 
  • Vous nous permettrez d'invité un groupe de la scène culturelle sénégalaise afin d'offrir un concert de rue. 
  • Des reproductions des oeuvres seront offertes aux contributeurs les plus généreux... Ainsi que d'autres cadeaux.. 


D'autres façons d'aider

Certaines personnes ne peuvent pas contribuer mais cela ne veut pas dire qu'elles ne peuvent pas aider :

  • Passer le mot et de faire de la publicité autour du Wakh'Art Invite : Anniversaire 4 ans. 
  • Utiliser les outils de partage Indiegogo !

important de mettre en lumière les talents et les créations des artistes et
artisans de la scène culturelle sénégalaise. Nous croyons en la richesse
culturelle que nous possédons ici au Sénégal. Nous sommes certains que grâce à
ces industries culturelles naissantes et solides, le Sénégal arrivera à un
niveau de développement important et  ainsi la jeunesse sénégalaise pourra
prétendre à un avenir stable et plein de promesse.
La Boite à Idée:

La
Boite à Idée est une
maison nichée au cœur de la Gueule Tapée. 
C’est
un espace coloré et dynamique ouvert au
public. (en générale sur rdv ou durant une période déterminé).
La
Boite à Idée est une projection physique de Wakh’Art. La maison a abrité nombreux
shootings, quelques expositions et tournages.
C’est également dans ce lieu que les interviews pour la plateforme culturelle
Wakh’Art sont faites. 
Le
public peut découvrir au sein de ces murs, les œuvres des plasticiens avec
lesquels nous avons collaboré , mais aussi une bibliothèque contenant Romans,
Catalogues, journaux, prospectus etc. Cet espace
propose un cadre chaleureux au le
public ainsi qu’aux artistes et acteurs culturels. Souvent ils se retrouvent
pour échanger et partager leurs idées. 
La
maison a ainsi vu naître de nombreux projets. Elle a aussi accueillit
projection de film, débat, showcase etc. 


Le projet d'anniversaire : Wakh'Art fete ses 4 ans.




Wakh'Art vous invite en décembre à la Guele Tapée pour féter les 4 ans de la plateforme culturelle.
Programme : Décembre 2015
•le 15 décembre : Ouverture de la Boite à Idée.
Découverte de l’espace et de ces œuvres : 
Vernissage à 17h de l'Exposition Photo de MalykaDiagana & JbJoire.
•le 17 décembre: Performance : Peinture et Graffiti avec le RBS Crew à la Gueule Tapée.
Peinture de la Facade Extérieur de la Boite à Idée par les artistes du RBSCrew
•Jour 19 Décembre : Exposition Djib Anton 
Exposition de Rue . Réalisation Affiches & Baches de l'artiste DjibAnton. Vernissage à 17h. 
suivis d'un : Concert de Rue à 20h avec ..Surprise..
Une partie des bénéfices issus de la vente des œuvres servira à financer un atelier créatif «  l’art à l’école » dans une des écoles de la Gueule Tapée.



Ce dont nous avons besoin 


Financer les expositions : Frais d'impressions sur supports ; Frais de mise en place ; Déplacements & Installations des Œuvres.
Financer la Fresque: Achat de la peinture, Frais de déplacements des artistes.
Financer un concert de rue : Location du Matériel ( Sono) , Location d'une estrade ; Cachet des Musiciens.





L'impact
Votre contribution permettra de réaliser ce projet d'anniversaire qui nous tiens à coeur. 

Vous contribuerez à la mise en avant des artistes et de leurs travaux : Malyka Diagana, Jb Joire, Rbs Crew et Djib Anton.  

Vous permettrez au public Dakarois de découvrir un espace culturel; des oeuvres ( photos, fresque, affiches & baches). 
Vous nous permettrez d'invité un groupe de la scène culturelle sénégalaise afin d'offrir un concert de rue. 
Des reproductions des oeuvres seront offertes aux contributeurs les plus généreux... Ainsi que d'autres cadeaux.. 






D'autres façons d'aider
Certaines personnes ne peuvent pas contribuer mais cela ne veut pas dire qu'elles ne peuvent pas aider :

Passer le mot et de faire de la publicité autour du Wakh'Art Invite : Anniversaire 4 ans. 
Utiliser les outils de partage Indiegogo !

story:
TALENT SHOULD BE VALUED

 

Emma was excited. Everything was going better than expected after a couple of months of anxiety. She took the mobile from the handbag and saw Lorenzo's Whatsapp saying:  call me when you can.

-Hi Lorenzo

-Hi Emma. I have the photos from the photoshoot. What email do you want me to send them?

-To my personal one. Do you have it?

-Yes. No problem.

-Great! How are things going?

-Not too well to be honest. The lock-down and the restrict measures for exhibitions are being very hard. Your photoshoot may be my last one!

I am planning to go back to my old 9 to 5 ... Well, I don’t want to bother you with all this. I have just sent you the photos. I hope you like them. Take care. Bye.

-Bye

She hardly had time to say anything else.

 

Emma took the laptop and downloaded the photos.

 

-Oh, my goodness! They are awesome! – She thought. It is a terrible loss of talent if he gives her career up. Something should be done.

 

Emma googled: How to support artists

and found www.bokobo.art  

 

THE GLOBAL COMMUNITY OF ART


 

“Bokobo is the digital community of artists from all over the world that merges art, culture and entertainment.

The community is created by artists, for artists and art lovers eliminating intermediaries and encouraging fair "creative" trade.

 

We create long-lasting relationships with our online Marketplace, and our offline experiences like our exhibitions, activities and face-to-face workshops to enhance creativity and inspiration.

 

Testimonials

Fenna Van der and Alyson Carvalho

 

RECONNECTING WITH YOUR INNER ARTIST

 

After going through Bokobo, Emma was amazed. She told Lorenzo straight away.

She started remembering how she enjoyed school trips to museums and exhibitions. 

 

She remembered the writing workshops she enrolled when she was 15 and the fantastic people she met there...

 

She started thinking all the hours wasted surfing webpages and social media platform with un-useful or even stupid content… 

 

Then she returned to the platform and joined in to reconnect with her inner artist.

Two months later Lorenzo was selling her photos through www.bokobo.art

story:
Hello!

This campaign is being used to raise money to contribute money to my student visa going to Canada! I'm very excited for the opportunity to study in Canada and begin my path to getting citizen. This is some very dear to my heart and will help me in many ways.

 

What We Need & What You Get

What we need for this Campaign is $360 and the pins will be able to start being made, after the goal is met it will take about a month to ship 

For $18 you will get one pin

For $36 you will get both pins!

The Impact

The impact of this campaign will be contributing money towards my student visa, Canada requires you have over $11K to be approved. Because of covid 19 Im not able to work right now and I am using an old love for bees as my way to supplement my income.

Risks & Challenges

Some risks right now is shipping speeds, because this is an international campaign during Covid 19 there may be delays in shipping. The best way I can and will combat this is to provide continual updates on where we are at with shipping and processing.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help! If you can't help financially that's okay! Just sharing the campaign its self helps me greatly!

story:
Artist as Art

Art always looks good. In 2021, it will never look better. After a challenging 2020, we’re unwrapping a shiny new show: Clique21, bringing together 21 of southern New Jersey’s most talented and provocative artists and photographers.

By and for South Jersey

It was created by and for the southern New Jersey arts community. Together, the artists and photographers live and work in all eight counties of southern New Jersey; Atlantic, Burlington, Camden, Cape May, Cumberland, Gloucester, Ocean and Salem.


As with the 2016 debut event, Clique21 aims to shine a spotlight on the creative force that drives the arts in South Jersey, the artists. The show will provide both superb documentary photos to the artists and striking portfolio opportunities to the photographers. 


A production of ArtC and Strobe NJ, with support from Gallery 50, Inc., Clique21 continues the tradition, with 21 of the region’s most celebrated photographers and artists in a 2021 show. Five photographers will create portraits of 16 visual and performing artists.

Budget

The show will cost approximately $15,785, to cover:

  • Photography fees
  • Artists’ stipends
  • Professional framing with conservatory glass 
  • Archival photo printing  
  • Promotion and marketing
  • Project management
  • Opening receptions

 

Clique21 will nourish the local economy. ArtC and Gallery 50, Inc will contract exclusively with local printers, framers, caterers and other professionals to produce and promote the show. More importantly, as with the 2016 premiere event, it will boost morale and pride in the South Jersey art community.


If we raise more than the $15,000, the surplus will be used to create a fund to help South Jersey artists ready their art for exhibition, with framing and other preparation required to meet professional gallery standards. 

Please share!

Please share this campaign to your friends and social networks—and thank you for your continued support of the arts in southern New Jersey.

story:
Pan Genius

Picture yourself trodding along in a dust storm in the desert. Nothing can been seen through the thick playa dust that's whirling around your head. As you walk a little further you hear the creak and groan of metal scraping against metal and the grinding of gears. The dust clears and before you sits a towering robotic chimp. He's crashing together cymbals and screeching in maniacal delight. You've found Pan Genius and he's waiting for you to crank him up for another round of raucous monkey mischief!

My name is Amy Munson and I am the Lead Artist/Designer bringing Pan Genius to Burning Man 2018. I have always had a keen interest in machinery and robotics and I hope to bring a ton of fun to the playa with this, my flagship project. I've got a crack team working on engineering and logistics and with your help, we can make Pan Genius a reality this Burning Man 2018!

What Is Pan Genius?

Pan Genius is a giant robotic cymbal playing chimp propped on top of Darwin’s book “On the Origin of Species". The metal frame, gears and inner workings will be visible through a protective clear fiberglass shell that will compose the face and body. The moving arms will clash together cymbals, complete with a mighty monkey screech during one revolution of it’s cycle. His intense eyes will appear to move as the head nods with the motion of the arms. The movement will be powered by a hand-wheel located on the side of the piece, along with the efforts of one-two participants that will bring him to life.

Pan Genius is intended to be amusing, if not a little scary. In either case we want our audience to feel excited when they encounter something as unexpected as this robotic chimp sitting on the playa. And we hope that with your help and contributions, we can make him a reality.

The Mechanics

Via the accompanying wheel mechanism, a participant can power the movement of the chimp by hand cranking the wheel located on the side of the piece which will run through a full cycle of movement consisting of the arms widening and head rearing back, propelling a forward motion of the chimp’s head and arms, crashing together the accompanying cymbals contained within the hands. The crashing together of the cymbals will also initiate the cam that contains the screech box (acoustic amplifier) which will let out a delightful monkey scream.

Night Time

Filled with an eerie blue glow, Pan Genius will be beaming with high-powered led stripping that will ignite his robotic monkey body from within. His laser-like eyes will glow an alarming red, hypnotizing you with his gaze. 

What We Need & What You Get

Here's a quick breakdown of what we will use funding for.

  • Material costs (metal, wood, machinery parts)
  • Resin, Fiberglass and Paint
  • Transportation to and from Burning Man
  • Fundraising gifts, taxes, and fees

Your donations will go towards the operation, transportation, and fabrication costs of creating Pan Genius.  We have already received a generous Burning Man Honorarium Grant that covers a portion of the project, however, your money will help fund the purchase of the necessary metal and parts that this clangy monkey will require, as well as the lovely clear resin shells, fiberglass, painted platform, and transportation to the playa.

In return we are excited to offer our supporters some unique Pan Genius swag!  Our most unique gifts include having your name handwritten on the spine of the book (platform that the monkey sits on), as well as handmade pendants by artist Vulfie Munson created specifically for this campaign.  

The Pan Genius crew thanks YOU for your helpful contributions! xoxo

Risks & Challenges

Pan Genius is the largest project this crew has ever created. One of the biggest challenge is engineering the internal mechanisms and fabricating the fiberglass and resin parts. In addition to all of this we need to make sure the monkey is anchored well and structurally sound for safety.  We have the professional expertise of Chief Engineer Vulfie Munson who has the knowledge and expertise in constructing structurally sound pieces. Having had a few art installations of his own on the playa, he is well versed in overcoming the hurdles creating playa art can pose.

Chief Engineer, Vulfie Munson

Other Ways You Can Help

Community is my favorite part of Burning Man and one of the best ways a person can support a project is to share their knowledge and experience. Feel free to drop me a line or visit the official project page on Facebook https://www.facebook.com/PanGenius/

story:
(for english version scroll down)

INFORMAZIONI SU LA COMPAGNIA TERSICOREAT.OFF

La Tersicorea da anni si distingue per le sue forti connotazioni didattico/formative e per l’attivo impegno in funzione della diffusione di una nuova pedagogia della danza e del teatro rivolta al sostegno dei giovani artisti in dialogo costante con le realtà consolidate in tutto il territorio internazionale ed extra europeo. In questo contesto la Tersicorea e il suo spazio teatrale T.off  garantiscono occasioni di sperimentazione, ricerca  confronto, di scambio intergenerazionale e di metodologie e poetiche, attraverso residenze artistiche e rurali in forma di "cantiere", di cui Tersicorea è promotrice in Sardegna e sostenitrice sin dal 1996. Dal 2008 ha generato una rete Internazionale di interscambio: MED'ARTE che sostiene artisti contemporanei provenienti da tutto il mondo, con particolare attenzione agli artisti emergenti provenienti da paesi a rischio di pace o in cui sono in corso conflitti civili.


Partners: Borderline Danza - Campania/Salerno;- Campania (Compagnia Heliotropion  Francia/Parigi; Compagnia Zerogrammi - Piemonte/Torino; Cie Twain physical dance theatre Lazio/Roma; Compagnia Nut  Lombardia/Milano; L’association: Collectif La Basse Cour, Compagnia Théâtre Crac: fabrique de mensonges  Francia/Nimes; Compagnia Càjka - Teatri di mare, Sardegna/Cagliari; Asmed Associazione Sarda Musica e Danza - Sardegna/Quartu Sant'Elena; Maya INC Società Cooperativa Art - Sardegna/ Quartucciu; Compagnia Muxarte - Palermo; Compagnia Mudarte, Granada; Associazione musicale “Suoni e Pause” Irma Toudjian -Cagliari.

Partners privati: Diana Carulli, NY 10524/United States - Iris Carulli, Roma/Italia - 
Enrico Sau,Cagliari/Italia - Paola De Felice, Cagliari/Italia 

RISULTATI RAGGIUNTI NEGLI ULTIMO OTTO ANNI:

  • Individuazione di 90 opere coreutiche provenienti da: Italia, Portogallo, Francia, Spagna, Repubblica Ceca, Costa d’Avorio, Scozia, Danimarca, Germania, Egitto, Brasile, Tunisia, Africa del nord  e occidentale.
  • Sostegno alla produzione e mobilitazione di  una moltitudine di artisti per i quali abbiamo premiato l’originalità delle proposte culturali in quanto  forte testimonianza dell’arte contemporanea nel mondo.


BREVE DESCRIZIONE DELLA CAMPAGNA RACCOLTA FONDI E PERCHE è IMPORTANTE PERSEGUIRLA
La campagna raccolta fondi rappresenta un’azione mirata in cui l'incentivo alla promozione del nostro grande patrimonio culturale, diventa la strategia che nel corso degli anni può trasformare il territorio in un grande palcoscenico in cui l’arte contemporanea diventa un progetto interdisciplinare di ARTI PERFORMATIVE che coinvolge artisti coreografi danzatori  provenienti da tutto il mondo.
IL PROGETTO
Lo scopo di questo progetto è sostenere la ricerca attraverso l'individuazione di progetti coreografici, per promuovere l'incontro e il confronto tra gli artisti che hanno una formazione o provenienza diversa, creando una opportunità di residenza creativa e rappresentazione nel territorio della Sardegna.  Esso mira a far incontrare le generazioni, a riflettere sulla nostra relazione con il corpo e l'evoluzione della città, a prendere coscienza dell'ambiente urbano e a favorire lo scambio e la cooperazione artistica attraverso residenze artistiche, incontri, workshop multidisciplinari e rappresentazione delle proprie opere coreutiche.

  • L’approccio antropologico, fa sì che gli artisti attraverso un programma condiviso, possano rendere visibile il loro percorso artistico che così “rivive” in un contesto di comparazione e dialogo intergenerazionale.

Per noi è importante:

  • sostenere la creatività soprattutto dei  giovani artisti indipendenti;
  • incentivare la mobilità e la circuitazione di compagnie e coreografi attivi sul territorio regionale nazionale/internazionale ed extra europeo.


Una scena 

Ciò che la raccolta fondi ci aiuterà a raggiungere 
Attraverso l'azione di crowdfunding, il vostro contributo è necessario per coprire una parte dei costi di produzione e di organizzazione relativi  all' ospitalità degli artisti coinvolti. Tutti i contributi ricevuti attraverso Indiegogo andranno direttamente alle spese di residenza artistica, parte dei costi relativi ali viaggi e alla permanenza in Sardegna. 



Più dettagliatamente:
Speriamo di raggiungere una quota di € 10.000  e qualora non raggiungessimo questo budget, il quantum effettivo ricavato dalla campagna raccolta fondi verrà comunque destinato al progetto per poter garantire:
•  un incentivo in denaro per ciascun artista; 
•  costi agibilità/assicurazione per ciascuna compagnia coinvolta;
•  rimborsi spesa vitto e alloggio.

L'IMPATTO
Vogliamo sottolineare che nel 2015 abbiamo avuto un grande apporto grazie a Indegogo,  per un precedente progetto internazionale che si è svolto in Sardegna  e attualmente,  esso è stato inserito all'interno  di importanti festival di Teatro/circo contemporaneo (Spagna).

Pertanto il vostro contributo costituisce un esempio di grande impegno per la valorizzazione dei processi culturali transnazionali di produzione artistica.

L'impatto  atteso è  quello di creare nuovi mecenati che garantiscano:
La mobilità artistica, la collaborazione tra nazioni, l'unione delle culture, Promuovere e salvaguardare la diversità lingusitica e culturale europea; Estendere la promozione e l’identità del paesi coinvolti; Implementare l’ingresso di nuovi percorsi culturali.

Ogni contributo farà la differenza più grande! Se non è possibile donare, potete anche aiutarci raggiungendo un nuovo pubblico condividendo la nostra campagna con qualcuno che sarebbe interessato alla nostra missione attraverso Facebook, Indiegogo e altri social media.

Grazie per il vostro tempo, la considerazione e il sostegno ai giovani artisti indipendenti.


English version

Background Tersicorea.
The unique spirit of every projects is targeted to the activities promoted by the Tersicorea, which has distinguished itself for its strong teaching and formative tools and for its active commitment to the spread of new education in dancing and drama for several years.

In this setting, the “T.off” will perform its role of meeting and collaboration, becoming a vitally important center for the development of several projects concerning performances, festivals, and important meetings. It aims to bring together generations, encouraging exchange and cooperation through artistic residencies, meetings, workshops, and multidisciplinary  artworks. Since 2008, the organization has created a network of International interchange between artists of Dance / Art: MED'ARTE, supporting contemporary artists from around the world with particular attention to countries that are facing civil conflicts.

Partners: Borderline Danza - Campania/Salerno;- Campania (Compagnia Heliotropion  Francia/Parigi; Compagnia Zerogrammi - Piemonte/Torino; Cie Twain physical dance theatre Lazio/Roma; Compagnia Nut  Lombardia/Milano; L’association: Collectif La Basse Cour, Compagnia Théâtre Crac: fabrique de mensonges  Francia/Nimes; Compagnia Càjka - Teatri di mare, Sardegna/Cagliari; Asmed Associazione Sarda Musica e Danza - Sardegna/Quartu Sant'Elena; Maya INC Società Cooperativa Art - Sardegna/ Quartucciu; Compagnia Muxarte - Palermo; Compagnia Mudarte, Granada; Associazione musicale “Suoni e Pause” Irma Toudjian -Cagliari.

GOAL IN EIGHT YEARS: The anthropological approach, creates visibility of the artist’s artistic path sparking life to the works and promoting an intergenerational dialogue.

  • 80 choral works were identified hailing from: Italy, Portugal, France, Spain, Czech Republic, Ivory Coast, Scotland, Denmark, Germany, Egypt, Brazil, Tunisia, North Africa and West Africa. 
  • Mobility of a lot artists, rewarding the originality of cultural proposals that express a strong testimony of contemporary art in the world. 


Briefly describe our campaign and why it's important
The campaign fundraising is targeted action in which the incentive to the promotion of our great cultural heritage, becomes the strategy that throughout the years may turn our land into a huge stage where contemporary art becomes an interdisciplinary research project of performative arts, involving artists choreographers dancers from around the world..

THE PROJECT The aim of this project is to support the research throughout the making and production of a choreography to promote the meeting and collaboration among artists that possess differing educational backgrounds and to provide an opportunity of creating and presenting in Sardinia. Itaims to bring together generations, encouraging exchange and cooperation through artistic residencies, meetings, workshops, and multidisciplinary  artworks. The anthropological approach, creates visibility of the artist’s artistic path sparking life to the works and promoting an intergenerational dialogue.

For us it is important to:
• support creativity especially of young independent artists;
• Supporting mobility and the circulation of companies and choreographers active in the national / international and regional non-European territory.

 Magnitude of what contributors will help our achieve.
By means the action of crowdfunding, your contribution is needed to cover part of the production costs and relating organization for hosting of the artists involved. All the contributions received through Indiegogo will be intended for artistic residence expenses, the cost of travel and stay in Sardinia.

More detail about
Particularly we hope to achieve a share of € 10,000 and if we do not reach this budget, the quantum derived by the campaign fundraising, will still be used for the project in order to guarantee:
• a cash incentive for each artist;
• insurance for each company involved;
• Refunds accommodation and meals.


THE IMPACT 

We wish to emphasize that in 2015 we had an invaluable contribution through Indegogo for a previous international project that took place in Sardinia, and currently, it has been included in major theater / contemporary circus festival (Spain).

Therefore, your contribution is an example of great commitment for the development of transnational cultural processes of artistic production.

The expected impact is to create new patrons guaranteeing: to ensure artistic mobility, collaboration between nations, the union of cultures, promote and safeguard the European cultural diversity; Extend the promotion and the identity of the countries involved; Implement the entry of new cultural itineraries.

Each contribution will make the biggest difference!

If you can not donate, you can also help by adding a new audience by sharing our campaign with someone who would be interested in our mission through Facebook, Indiegogo and other social media.

•  THANK YOU FOR YOUR TIME
story_txt:
(for english version scroll down)
INFORMAZIONI SU LA COMPAGNIA TERSICOREAT.OFF

La Tersicorea da
anni si distingue per le sue forti connotazioni didattico/formative e per
l’attivo impegno in funzione della diffusione di una nuova pedagogia della danza e del teatro rivolta al sostegno dei giovani artisti in dialogo costante
con le realtà consolidate in tutto il territorio internazionale ed extra
europeo. In questo contesto la Tersicorea e il suo spazio teatrale T.off  garantiscono occasioni di sperimentazione, ricerca  confronto, di scambio intergenerazionale e di
metodologie e poetiche, attraverso residenze artistiche e rurali in forma di
"cantiere", di cui Tersicorea è promotrice in Sardegna e sostenitrice
sin dal 1996. Dal 2008 ha
generato una rete Internazionale di interscambio: MED'ARTE
che sostiene artisti contemporanei provenienti da tutto il mondo, con
particolare attenzione agli artisti emergenti provenienti da paesi a rischio di
pace o in cui sono in corso conflitti civili.





Partners: Borderline Danza
- Campania/Salerno;- Campania (Compagnia Heliotropion  Francia/Parigi; Compagnia Zerogrammi -
Piemonte/Torino; Cie Twain physical dance theatre Lazio/Roma; Compagnia Nut  Lombardia/Milano; L’association: Collectif La
Basse Cour, Compagnia Théâtre Crac: fabrique de mensonges  Francia/Nimes; Compagnia Càjka - Teatri di
mare, Sardegna/Cagliari; Asmed Associazione Sarda Musica e Danza -
Sardegna/Quartu Sant'Elena; Maya INC Società Cooperativa Art - Sardegna/
Quartucciu; Compagnia Muxarte - Palermo; Compagnia Mudarte, Granada;
Associazione musicale “Suoni e Pause” Irma Toudjian -Cagliari.
Partners privati: Diana Carulli, NY 10524/United States - Iris Carulli, Roma/Italia - Enrico Sau,Cagliari/Italia - Paola De Felice, Cagliari/Italia 
RISULTATI RAGGIUNTI NEGLI ULTIMO OTTO ANNI:


Individuazione
     di 90 opere coreutiche provenienti da: Italia, Portogallo, Francia,
     Spagna, Repubblica Ceca, Costa d’Avorio, Scozia, Danimarca, Germania,
     Egitto, Brasile, Tunisia, Africa del nord  e occidentale.


Sostegno alla produzione e mobilitazione di  una moltitudine di artisti per i quali abbiamo premiato l’originalità delle proposte
     culturali in quanto  forte testimonianza dell’arte contemporanea
     nel mondo.




BREVE DESCRIZIONE DELLA CAMPAGNA
RACCOLTA FONDI E PERCHE è IMPORTANTE PERSEGUIRLALa campagna
raccolta fondi rappresenta un’azione mirata in cui l'incentivo alla promozione
del nostro grande patrimonio culturale, diventa la strategia che nel corso
degli anni può trasformare il territorio in un grande palcoscenico in cui l’arte
contemporanea diventa un progetto interdisciplinare di ARTI PERFORMATIVE che
coinvolge artisti coreografi danzatori 
provenienti da tutto il mondo.

IL
PROGETTOLo scopo
di questo progetto è sostenere la ricerca attraverso l'individuazione di
progetti coreografici, per promuovere l'incontro e il confronto tra gli artisti
che hanno una formazione o provenienza diversa, creando una opportunità di
residenza creativa e rappresentazione nel territorio della Sardegna.  Esso mira a far incontrare le generazioni, a
riflettere sulla nostra relazione con il corpo e l'evoluzione della città, a
prendere coscienza dell'ambiente urbano e a favorire lo scambio e la
cooperazione artistica attraverso residenze artistiche, incontri, workshop
multidisciplinari e rappresentazione delle proprie opere coreutiche.

L’approccio antropologico, fa sì che gli
artisti attraverso un programma condiviso, possano rendere visibile il loro
percorso artistico che così “rivive” in un contesto di comparazione e dialogo
intergenerazionale.





Per noi è importante:


sostenere la creatività soprattutto dei  giovani artisti indipendenti;

incentivare la mobilità e la circuitazione di compagnie e coreografi
attivi sul territorio regionale nazionale/internazionale ed extra europeo.
Una scena 

Ciò che la raccolta fondi ci aiuterà a raggiungere 
Attraverso l'azione
di crowdfunding, il vostro contributo è necessario per coprire una parte dei costi di produzione e di organizzazione relativi  all' ospitalità degli artisti coinvolti. Tutti i contributi ricevuti attraverso Indiegogo andranno direttamente alle spese di residenza artistica, parte dei costi relativi ali viaggi e alla permanenza in Sardegna. 



Più dettagliatamente:Speriamo di
raggiungere una quota di € 10.000  e qualora non raggiungessimo questo
budget, il quantum effettivo ricavato dalla campagna raccolta fondi verrà comunque destinato al progetto per poter
garantire:• 
un incentivo in denaro per ciascun artista; • 
costi agibilità/assicurazione per ciascuna compagnia
coinvolta;• 
rimborsi spesa vitto e alloggio.
L'IMPATTOVogliamo sottolineare che nel 2015 abbiamo avuto un grande apporto grazie a Indegogo,  per un precedente progetto internazionale che si è svolto in Sardegna  e attualmente,  esso è stato inserito all'interno  di importanti festival di Teatro/circo contemporaneo (Spagna).
Pertanto il
vostro contributo costituisce un esempio di grande impegno per la
valorizzazione dei processi culturali transnazionali di produzione artistica.
L'impatto  atteso è  quello di creare nuovi mecenati che garantiscano:La mobilità
artistica, la collaborazione tra nazioni, l'unione delle culture, Promuovere e
salvaguardare la diversità lingusitica e culturale europea; Estendere la
promozione e l’identità del paesi coinvolti; Implementare l’ingresso di
nuovi percorsi culturali.
Ogni
contributo farà la differenza più grande! Se non è possibile donare, potete
anche aiutarci raggiungendo un nuovo pubblico condividendo la nostra
campagna con qualcuno che sarebbe interessato alla nostra missione attraverso
Facebook, Indiegogo e altri social media.
Grazie per
il vostro tempo, la considerazione e il sostegno ai giovani artisti
indipendenti.
