story:
#WEATNU is "We are the New Underground."

Hello, my name is Almark, I'm an electronic musician. I started with creating experimental/abstract music during 1998. Later in 2010 I released my music to the net. Then I noticed that it was very hard to share your music with a group of people who enjoy what you create. The niche audience, those who create experimental music, electronic, avant-garde, synthpop, etc. So I formed #WEATNU in Aug of 2014.

#WEATNU is a collective effort to help the indie underground artist. We give them the power to be heard, and promote their music through our 3 forms of promotion, including  net-radio, label and online magazine. 

#WEATNU is bridging the gap for the indie electronic artist to find their audience, and of course the fans are finding their artists. #WEATNU is changing things for the better. We are creating a real impact on the web, and this of course is all free.

But we need help financially per month, using indiegogo will help us overcome any loss of donations that we already have going via paypal. Your donations will help fund this great effort + movement to help the underground artist. It will help pay for server fees, maintenance and new features that we hope to implement in time. 

We continue to grow.

Since 2014 we have been creating waves on the Internet and building up steam slowly, many artists come to us who want a little extra presence. Thanks to an entire year of pushing WEATNU we are now where we are. The artists that come to us are from all parts of the world. Electronic music outside the realm of the mainstream is eclectic in nature, but these artists need fans, they need people to appreciate them. Without WEATNU they would not have found new listeners.

We also support Underground dance.

Thanks to the success of one of our radio portals, EchoStation, we have found artists who are creating amazing house, deephouse, techno, and many other styles outside the mainstream. Some of these artists are with us through WEATNU Records such as Sek70R, Jazzykat, Minutes After, Uncles of Wise, WSM to name a few.


#WEATNU wants to do more in 2016.

WEATNU Records: our online label has been selling digital music since Dec 2014. We want to begin offering CD's and Vinyl to our fans.  It takes a good deal of money to do this. WEATNU wants to grow and without funds, we cannot move forward. If you can give 10 - 20 dollars or more the rewards are. 

  • Free music, MP3s and special collection albums on digital and CD or special releases on vinyl, USB, etc.
  • Special edition copies.
  • Lower prices on T-shirts and merchandise through weatnu.com.
    [Having the funds to purchase in bulk allows us to offer t-shirts for a lesser price.]
A donation of 5 to 10 dollars or more from those who really want to see this effort stay alive is all it takes. Remember, you are helping the indie artist in a collective manner. Our movement is helping the hidden scene of great electronic musicians be heard. We have helped well over 400 artists since the beginning. Not to mention over 80 on our label WEATNU RECORDS.

Are you an electronic musician yourself, and having trouble finding your niche audience? Then we help people like yourself.

Our goal

To change how people receive electronic music and provide a career for the independent artist through self-promo and auto-promotion, including web presence. While the music industry takes in mainstream styles, we mirror this and take in underground styles, thus creating our very own virtual music community, but simply we are a massive movement of change world-wide. There is nothing else like #WEATNU. Also since 2014 WEATNU would like to be more well known, so it can serve future styles of Electronic music, and the artists themselves. A staple of the Internet for indie artists to rely on, always for free. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Donations per month sustain us, as we need funds monthly to pay for servers we use and other expensive that may come about. It takes about 200 or more dollars to run #WEATNU. Various services that help the machine, net-radio, auto-tweet service, mixlr pro, web host, and even domain fees per year. (Other things may include in the future, extra promo such as Soundcloud pro, Bandcamp for labels and even streaming websites.) 

These prices to do all this are very low we feel. To donate to our paypal, please click here. To contact us for all questions, comments, please follow us on twitter. https://twitter.com/weatnu 

follow us on Tumblr, weatnu.com and Facebook and Soundcloud. 

We are the New Underground is the wave of the future, we are all one!

story:
Short Summary

Drift has evolved from a core group of artists and builders who have been realizing Big Dreams for decades through festivals such as Burning Man and Symbiosis. We build large-scale, interactive pieces that mimic the style of nature. Clean lines and symmetric design are thrown out the window and out emerges a timeless space where rough-hewn abandoned shacks emerge from the heart of a tree, and dilapidated lighthouses lean gently toward the ground.  Seaweed lanterns, driftwood sculptures and mossy paths entice the likes of Sirens while interactive features such as waterslides, swings and water cannons bring out the eternal youth of the lost boys of Neverland. While we do what we can to gather from nature, we still need funds to buy lumber, slides and decorative material. Without your support, we can not realize our dream to build this magical wonderland.

Drift at How Weird May 2016

What We Need & What You Get

Here is the rough breakdown:

  • Budget for waterslides: $5000
  • Budget for lumber, hardware, foam floaters and other material: $5000
  • Budget for decorative elements: $5000

In appreciation for your donation, we are offering the following perks:

  • $100-$300 donation receives a unique limited-edition woodprint with a magical Drift image
  • $65 donation gets you a pair of ceramic Drift shot glasses
  • $35 donation receives a hand-made Drift pendant or a Drift t-shirt
  • For your $20 donation, we thank you with a Drift sticker

We aim to reach our financial goal to make the Drift Atoll dream come true, but any little bit of financial support helps! Even if we do not realize our full goal, we will still be able to put your generous donation toward the Atoll project. We will make it happen in some form or other!

The Impact

It takes a village to build a dream! We want to make a space where members of the Symbiosis Family can join us at Woodward Reservoir to shake their fannies to delicious grooves, sun themselves on our decks and enjoy the thrill of sliding into the cool waters.

We have decades of experience building mind-blowing structures where our community is invited to enjoy themselves and BE themselves. Our floating structure for Symbiosis 2015 was recognized by such magazines as Playboy, Festival 300, Sparkleberry Lane and more! We would like to upstage ourselves by building it bigger and better for you this year. Please help us realize our costs so we can put our talent to work.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially, visit our Drift facebook page and let us know you would like to help:

https://www.facebook.com/drifttribe/?fref=ts

Also, please get the word out about Drift by inviting your friends like our page and to contribute toward our project.

Use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word!

story:
Evolve Studio is a dynamic, multi-use space in the heart of Downtown Los Angeles.  We believe that art can be creatively expressed in many ways, through multiple mediums including photography, painting, sculpture, film, music, dance, even 3D VR technology, so we created a special space where we can showcase the talents of emerging and well-established artists and help them to develop and present new ideas and exhibitions.

Evolve Studio is also a gathering space for live events, learning, and social experiences. In addition, to monthly art openings, we’ll present classes in photography, filmmaking, painting, sculpture, and dance. In addition, we plan to create partnerships with local non-profit organizations to raise awareness and provide education on social issues such as HIV, AIDS, homelessness and poverty.

Or space is ever-changing, growing, engaging, provoking, EVOLVING

 

 

Louis “Kengi” Carr is a proud Los Angeles native, born and raised in beautiful Santa Monica. As professional freelance photographer and Getty Images contributor, Kengi enjoys three realms of photography: editorial, event, and street. Just to toss things up a bit, he's also the founder of Project KengiKat | Do Something Saturday, a grass roots, community-based organization serving homeless individuals, low-income families, children, seniors as well as individuals living with HIV or AIDS. He is the author of four books of photography, currently working on his fifth. Evolve Gallery is his creation, his vision and his passion for art and photography combined with his passion for humanity come to life.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     Evolve Gallery was originally created and curated in 2014  to raise awareness for HIV and AIDS here in Los Angeles. With over 35 artists, photographers and ceramicists participating in what was supposed to be a 3-day pop-up show ended up being a nearly 3-month event complete with a red carpet opening night reception with over 500 people in attendance. 

Kengi's natural photography skills have allowed him to develop a unique resume which includes serving as the official FORD Motor Company Fund photographer for the NAACP Symposium and Freedom Sister’s events in Los Angeles, two cover shoots for Positively Aware Magazine as well as having his images featured in several blogs, magazines and newspapers. He’s also served as an official team of photographers for AIDS WALK LA, Being Alive, JWCH and Director of Photography for ‘Under My Skin’

Although he enjoys the privileges of capturing many celebrity red carpet events including the Pan African Film Festival, Style and Fashion Week Los Angeles, he prefers the grit of street photography and photojournalism where his images have been called “haunting” and “brilliant” 

This formerly homeless, HIV positive advocate/activist has over 15 years of curating art, photography and live events, Kengi loves providing space and working with emerging as well as established artists and photographers creating galleries and exhibits that raise awareness for HIV and AIDS, homelessness, and poverty.

Evolve Gallery is the continuation of Kengi's dream and goals to provide space for emerging and established artists and photographers, united in raising awareness for social issues through art.

 

 

What Will we use the money for?

The money raised through this campaign will mainly be used to pay rent at our gallery space, as well items such as nails, paint, and printing costs

    The Impact.

    We believe that all artists, photographers, and other creative deserve a space to showcase their talents which doesn't cost them an arm and leg. We believe in working with local grass roots and non-profit organizations to help provide programs and space which help to support and foster programs centered around art, photography, music, spoken word, and dance.
story_txt:
Evolve Studio is a dynamic, multi-use space in the heart of Downtown Los Angeles.  We believe that art can be creatively expressed in many ways, through multiple mediums including photography, painting, sculpture, film, music, dance, even 3D VR technology, so we created a special space where we can showcase the talents of emerging and well-established artists and help them to develop and present new ideas and exhibitions.
Evolve Studio is also a gathering space for live events, learning, and social experiences. In addition, to monthly art openings, we’ll present classes in photography, filmmaking, painting, sculpture, and dance. In addition, we plan to create partnerships with local non-profit organizations to raise awareness and provide education on social issues such as HIV, AIDS, homelessness and poverty.
Or space is ever-changing, growing, engaging, provoking, EVOLVING
 
 
Louis “Kengi” Carr is a proud Los Angeles native, born and raised in beautiful Santa Monica. As professional freelance photographer and Getty Images contributor, Kengi enjoys three realms of photography: editorial, event, and street. Just to toss things up a bit, he's also the founder of Project KengiKat | Do Something Saturday, a grass roots, community-based organization serving homeless individuals, low-income families, children, seniors as well as individuals living with HIV or AIDS. He is the author of four books of photography, currently working on his fifth. Evolve Gallery is his creation, his vision and his passion for art and photography combined with his passion for humanity come to life.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     Evolve Gallery was originally created and curated in 2014  to raise awareness for HIV and AIDS here in Los Angeles. With over 35 artists, photographers and ceramicists participating in what was supposed to be a 3-day pop-up show ended up being a nearly 3-month event complete with a red carpet opening night reception with over 500 people in attendance. 
Kengi's natural photography skills have allowed him to develop a unique resume which includes serving as the official FORD Motor Company Fund photographer for the NAACP Symposium and Freedom Sister’s events in Los Angeles, two cover shoots for Positively Aware Magazine as well as having his images featured in several blogs, magazines and newspapers. He’s also served as an official team of photographers for AIDS WALK LA, Being Alive, JWCH and Director of Photography for ‘Under My Skin’
Although he enjoys the privileges of capturing many celebrity red carpet events including the Pan African Film Festival, Style and Fashion Week Los Angeles, he prefers the grit of street photography and photojournalism where his images have been called “haunting” and “brilliant” 
This formerly homeless, HIV positive advocate/activist has over 15 years of curating art, photography and live events, Kengi loves providing space and working with emerging as well as established artists and photographers creating galleries and exhibits that raise awareness for HIV and AIDS, homelessness, and poverty.
Evolve Gallery is the continuation of Kengi's dream and goals to provide space for emerging and established artists and photographers, united in raising awareness for social issues through art.
 
 

What Will we use the money for?
The money raised through this campaign will mainly be used to pay rent at our gallery space, as well items such as nails, paint, and printing costs


The Impact.


We believe that all artists, photographers, and other creative deserve a space to showcase their talents which doesn't cost them an arm and leg. We believe in working with local grass roots and non-profit organizations to help provide programs and space which help to support and foster programs centered around art, photography, music, spoken word, and dance.

story:
I am starting my own Art Studio!


Who is Lawrence Lindell?
-Man of God
-Human being
-Artist
-Musician
-Creator
  • Noise met Sound
  • Our Lives Speak
  • Lawrence Lindell Studios! -with your help of course :)


Facts-
-This is not a donation based campaign. When you choose your "Perk" you are pre ordering the products that Lawrence Lindell Studios are offering. By pre ordering the products in advance you are also helping me fund and create the products you are ordering (I know, mind blowing!).

-Lawrence Lindell is an artist and musician from Los Angeles, CA.

-He graduated from Otis College of Art and Design in 2011 with a BFA in Digital Media/Illustration.

-In 2009, Lindell started his music career as Kid Law and in 2013 decided to start using his real name for both his art and music.

- His music and art career has been 100% independent since 2009.

-Solo Art Exhibitions 

  • Fullerton Muesum Center: Bleeding Box Art Show in 2012

-Group Art Exhibitions 

  • Brokechella LA Artist Galley 2013
  • No budget film festival Artist Gallery 2013
  • Brokechella LA Artist Galley 2014
  • Line Attack at The Hive Gallery: Group Art Show 2014
Why its important.
By setting up my own studio it allows me to be in a position where I will never have to compromise my art to make money nor go against my morals and values. By owning my own studio I can continue to push a positive light that is so desperately needed in this world and also empower my own people and others on a larger scale.

My studio will be 100% black own, which might not mean a lot to you if you're not black, but in our communities we don't own a lot of anything and as I get older I see how important it is that we have our own outlets that allows us to get our voices heard with out outside forces that could care less rather we live or die.

My studio will be 100% artist owned, which might not mean much if you're not an artist, but in the artist community we don't own a lot of anything either. We are always taught to work for others and never really understand how valuable and important our work actually is. We as artist need to invest in ourselves and each other so we can't be silenced nor pushed out. It's a gross pattern I see where people let artist build and create a magical environment, then take it away for their own selfish and money driven agenda. When we own our own, it's harder for them to do so.

What will your investment manifest into?

Products- When you pre order your "perk" you will be funding the printing and production cost necessary to bring this vision to life. 



What projects will my studio produce?

Lawrence Lindell Art Zines Volumes 1-5

-Lawrence Lindell Art Zine Book Volumes 1-5-  Five 32 page Art Books with illustrations dating back to 2009 that I never got to share with the public. I have already released a limited number of the first volume, but with the launch of the studio, this will be their first release on a major scale.  

Color N Stuff



32 page Artbook featuring select ink illustrations from Ink n stuff brought to further life with color!


Ink N Stuff




-60 page illustration book featuring  all ink illustrations.


You're Beautiful VOLS 1-3




-Three 8 page illustration books with encouraging thoughts and motivational  literature  that I wrote myself paired with illustrations. These thoughts and writings have saved my life and I want to share that with people.

Original Artwork 

-You get an original hand drawn illustration. No duplicates, the illustration you receive will be drawn only for you. I will not make prints from it nor put it in future books. It's all yours!! :)

3 Hunid Artbook 

- 3 Hunid- 300 page Art Book featuring 300 drawings I did over the course of 3 months through out LA.


Werd Artbook 

 


-Werd - 32 page Art Book combining my favorite words and phases with drawings. 


Art in Transit 

 



32 page Artbook featuring illustrations all drawn while on the LA Metro.


The Nomad Book


136 pages of a traveling art book comprised of drawings done in Oakland, Berkeley, Los Angeles and New Orleans.

Pen, Pad, Los Angeles


32 page Artbook with art that was created from 2012-16 while I lived in West Adams, East LA and Compton.

Lawrence Lindell Illustrated Buttons 


- Lawrence Lindell Illustrated Buttons- Various illustrated buttons.


Studio
I am going legitimate and making this a proper studio. This is what your pre orders help fund.

Business Licenses
Website
Name registration (DBA)
Web Store
Art Supplies
Studio Space


Future Projects

-An illustrated autobiography 

-Lawrence Lindell Animated Shorts

-The Mini Comics 

-And loads more!!!


I have been creating and putting in the work since 2009, but now it's time to step out on faith with courage and wisdom and go far beyond what I have been doing.

Please continue to support independent creatives. We need your love and encouragement the most!!

Peace and Love
-Lawrence




.

story:
Uncanny Valley Art Gallery & Collective

523 1/2 main st, #12 Grand Junction, Co.

Uncanny Valley is an Uncensored, Commission-free gallery and studios space located in downtown Grand Junction, Colorado. Founded in 2015 by Matt Goss, and co-directed by Jon Gosser, Ann Wallace Hartter, & Kristain Hartter. Since our opening we have strived to provide a unique art space to promote emerging and established artists as well as give them  a place to express themselves without the fear and constraint of censorship. We currently have a full membership of 13 artists, with a waiting list of interested artists wanting to join our collective.

What makes us different from other art galleries?

 

Uncensored and Commission-Free Art!

All Uncanny Valley members keep 100% of all Sales! If you buy art at Uncanny valley, 100% of it goes directly to the artist that made it. The gallery takes no percentage! We believe if their art is good enough to sell, then they deserve the money!

Uncensored Art! All artists at Uncanny Valley have complete freedom to create art, no matter how provocative or risque. Art should never be censored. Period.

 

WE NEED YOUR HELP!

We are moving!!

We are finally making the move from our cramped 2nd floor gallery space to a ground floor storefront, but we need a little help along the way. At every art show we have artists asking about joining our collective and the only reason we turn anyone away is lack of space, We want to relocated to a bigger space that will accommodate more artists and will give us more room to host our unique art shows and provide weekly demos and classes. A storefront location would also allow us to maintain regular gallery hours.

We are looking to raise $5000 to help with the costs of moving and renovating the new art space. 

In exchange for your generous donations, we have some amazing perks donated by our gallery members. Ranging from art prints, fabric art, original paintings, to Iron Sculptures and even a donation of a mural! Or you can show your support by becoming a Patron and getting your name on our permanent 'Wall of Patrons' plaque. Business level Sponsorships available too.

What you will be sponsoring:

Here are a few examples of some of our past art shows. We host six solo member art shows a year, but on the alternating months we host themed art shows.

Some of our most popular themed show have been:

We're All Mad Here: An Alice in Wonderland themed art show

A Clockwork Affair: A Steampunk themed evening 

and our annual Erotica Art show!

In addition to our monthly art shows, we want to expand into weekly art classes and demos to provide the community

We are also proud to announce that our sponsoring winery, Stoney Mesa Winery, will be opening up a permanent tasting room within our new location! Stoney Mesa has been a constant fixture at all of Uncanny Valley's First Friday events and have been proud sponsors of Uncanny Valley since the very first show we hosted.

 

How You Can Help

Donations Mean the World to Us.

​Donate to our fundraiser and collect an amazing piece of art for your donation!

If you want to donate by mail please mail checks to

1745 n 15th st. Grand Junction, Colo. 81501

Checks should be made out to 'Uncanny valley'

Even if you can't afford to make a contribution to our fundraiser, you can still help!

Please Share this on Social Media and Help Spread the Word

and most of all.... support local art show just by showing up and saying "Hi!" That means the most of all! We can't put on art shows with out the amazing support from the art community and we are so grateful that words can not express. all we can do is continue to host the best art shows we can. 

We are located at 523 1/2 Main st. #12 Grand Junction, Co.    Upstairs in the historic Margery building

Thank You!! Thank You!! Thank You!!

check us out on facebook! Facebook.com/Uncannyvalleyart

​Uncanny Valley Members:

Julie Anderson- Josh Clark- Jeremy Crotty- Rikki Cook- Matt Goss- Jon Gosser- Lorrie Herranz- Gerald Ives- Larry D. Lyon- Jason McCann- Rob Mosher- Sam Speir- Ben Wolfe

story:
How the Indiegogo funds help me...

The funds I raise from my Indiegogo project provide me with the time and wood I need for future projects, which was the long-term intention behind my very first campaign. Thanks to so many amazing backers, I gain time and creative freedom to explore new ideas between campaigns. And in full circle, the things I learn and pieces I make during these explorations come right back to the following Indiegogo projects.

 

Visit our website at www.davidwalshbowlmaker.com to find more of my work and learn about the various woods I turn.

--------------------

--------------------

Finish Types:

The bowls offered in this campaign are either part of my Gallery series (G+ or G++) or Rustic series (R).

Sometimes I will turn a bowl to what I consider a "Tool finish". This means that the surface of the bowl retains the marks of the carving tools left by the maker. Depending on the maker's skill, tool marks can be either crude or refined. Before the use of sandpaper, every handmade wooden object had a tool finish, which directly reflects the hand and artistry of the maker. Most old antiques have tool finishes, increasing their value to collectors. My tool finish bowls may be given a light sanding of one or two grits of sandpaper, making the surface smoother and more uniform, while still leaving the tool marks visible. One application of a specially blended food-safe finish is applied, and then the bowl is buffed to give it a little shine.

Like tool finish bowls, "Rustic finish" bowls may retain some tool marks but will be smoother to the touch because they go through a more in-depth sanding with multiple grits of sandpaper. One application of blended finish is applied, and then the bowl is buffed to give it a little shine.

"Gallery (G+) finish" is of the highest quality in sanding and polish. The wood is sanded through a series of up to 12 different grades of sandpaper until it is smooth as silk to the touch. G+ finished bowls go through multiple applications of blended finish before returning to the lathe for a 2-step buffing process. These extra steps allows the finish to achieve a high-gloss shine, showcasing the wood it protects.

Finish Types Shown On A Variety of Bowls

--------------------

--------------------

A few things you might wonder about in advance... 

Throughout the project, you may come across words you don't know in relation to the pieces. Here are a few recurring ones and what they mean:

 

  • SPALTED/SPALTING is any color (such as the black lines) that appear as a tree gets older or the decay from resting on the ground for a time. Spalting can be very convoluted and the patterns can resemble a map or sometimes a fantasy or animal figure. They may have some surface pecks as the hardness of the wood varies within the bowl.
  • A BURL is an abnormal growth on the outside trunk of a tree. Burls are quite rare as they do not grow on every tree. They form when the cells that make up new bud growth begin to deviate, dividing in many different directions and form a large bump instead of a branch or root. The grain now spirals, twists and knots (as opposed to normal growth, which results in straight and predictable grain) and now has intricate grain patterns and vivid colors that make it a world-class wood. These irregularities, however, make the burl one of the trickiest woods to turn but also one of the most beautiful.
  • HOLLOW FORMS are made with special tools and techniques to remove 90% of the wood inside the vase, which allows it to dry properly. I call them vases but please note that they are not to be used with water!
  • To learn more about the WOOD TYPES themselves, visit our website at https://www.davidwalshbowlmaker.com/woods.html
  • Lastly, we put a lot of information in the FAQ SECTION - don't forget to check it out to learn more about how a block of wood becomes a bowl and more!

--------------------

--------------------

$200 Pledge Level - Manzanita Burl G+ Bowl 13708 (8.5”w by 3.5”h)

 

---------------------

$200 Pledge Level - Australian Red Coolibah Burl G+ Bowl 13710 (5.5”w by 4.0”h)

 

---------------------

$225 Pledge Level - Quebracho G+ Hollow Vase 13789 (4”w by 3.75”h)

Quebracho is a rare Argentinian evergreen, which actually translates to "axe breaker". One of the hardest woods in the world, quebracho heartwood color is a range of reds that can also have black streaks. It can be difficult to find as an imported wood, which can cause prices to be high. Quebracho was also once heavily exploited in the late 1800s, and certain species are still on the Red list for their vulnerability in decline. The exploitation was for its use in leather tanning. The heartwood contains a high concentration of tannins, which can be extracted when it is cut into small pieces and used to dye leather.

This particular piece actually comes from a set of antique bocce balls, circa late 1800s, early 1900s and made in Scotland or England. However, they were being called lignum vitae.The reason for this is quite interesting! First, both types of woods were being imported into the United Kingdom at this time. But while similar to LV in hardness and location, the colors are completely different. So our question became, why the confusion? Our research determination is that during the time these were made, people actually thought they were using LV since both woods were available. Without the scientific knowledge and testing we have today, makers would have used a more crude determination using weight, location, tool wear and tear, etc. To us, this makes sense as to why they thought it LV.

 

---------------------

---------------------

story_txt:
How the Indiegogo funds help me...The funds I raise from my Indiegogo project provide me with the time and wood I need for future projects, which was the long-term intention behind my very first campaign. Thanks to so many amazing backers, I gain time and creative freedom to explore new ideas between campaigns. And in full circle, the things I learn and pieces I make during these explorations come right back to the following Indiegogo projects. Visit our website at www.davidwalshbowlmaker.com to find more of my work and learn about the various woods I turn.----------------------------------------Finish Types:The bowls offered in this campaign are either part of my Gallery series (G+ or G++) or Rustic series (R).Sometimes I will turn a bowl to what I consider a "Tool finish". This means that the surface of the bowl retains the marks of the carving tools left by the maker. Depending on the maker's skill, tool marks can be either crude or refined. Before the use of sandpaper, every handmade wooden object had a tool finish, which directly reflects the hand and artistry of the maker. Most old antiques have tool finishes, increasing their value to collectors. My tool finish bowls may be given a light sanding of one or two grits of sandpaper, making the surface smoother and more uniform, while still leaving the tool marks visible. One application of a specially blended food-safe finish is applied, and then the bowl is buffed to give it a little shine.Like tool finish bowls, "Rustic finish" bowls may retain some tool marks but will be smoother to the touch because they go through a more in-depth sanding with multiple grits of sandpaper. One application of blended finish is applied, and then the bowl is buffed to give it a little shine."Gallery (G+) finish" is of the highest quality in sanding and polish. The wood is sanded through a series of up to 12 different grades of sandpaper until it is smooth as silk to the touch. G+ finished bowls go through multiple applications of blended finish before returning to the lathe for a 2-step buffing process. These extra steps allows the finish to achieve a high-gloss shine, showcasing the wood it protects.Finish Types Shown On A Variety of Bowls----------------------------------------A few things you might wonder about in advance... Throughout the project, you may come across words you don't know in relation to the pieces. Here are a few recurring ones and what they mean: 

SPALTED/SPALTING is any color (such as the black lines) that appear as a tree gets older or the decay from resting on the ground for a time. Spalting can be very convoluted and the patterns can resemble a map or sometimes a fantasy or animal figure. They may have some surface pecks as the hardness of the wood varies within the bowl.
A BURL is an abnormal growth on the outside trunk of a tree. Burls are quite rare as they do not grow on every tree. They form when the cells that make up new bud growth begin to deviate, dividing in many different directions and form a large bump instead of a branch or root. The grain now spirals, twists and knots (as opposed to normal growth, which results in straight and predictable grain) and now has intricate grain patterns and vivid colors that make it a world-class wood. These irregularities, however, make the burl one of the trickiest woods to turn but also one of the most beautiful.

HOLLOW FORMS are made with special tools and techniques to remove 90% of the wood inside the vase, which allows it to dry properly. I call them vases but please note that they are not to be used with water!
To learn more about the WOOD TYPES themselves, visit our website at https://www.davidwalshbowlmaker.com/woods.html

Lastly, we put a lot of information in the FAQ SECTION - don't forget to check it out to learn more about how a block of wood becomes a bowl and more!

story:
Hello!

I am an artist based in California’s Central Coast. My passion is to experience the outdoors via surfing, climbing, hiking, and other adventures, and my inspiration comes from moments of connection to my surroundings - the life, the colors, the energy. I translate these moments into paintings that are true to their subjects, yet enhanced with an expression of my personality - using bright colors and flowing lines. As they progress, the paintings evolve with intuitive and intentional brushstrokes. I believe that nature has the ability to teach us many life lessons if we allow it. The oceans, rocks, and trees are symbolic, and the animals we share the world with are much like us. The blank canvas is a tool to share my thoughts and opinions on what is important, what is worth protecting, and what is so magical about a certain moment or place.

For the last 5 years I have been painting professionally and sharing my work at a variety of weekend art festivals throughout the year. Visitors often ask me if I teach, and to be honest I have always been a little afraid to start! But I am committed to growing my career as an artist, enjoy sharing my knowledge & skills, and love to see others unleashing their creativity. So it only fits! I recently moved into a new home with a very spacious extra room that I have turned into my studio, and it is a perfect classroom space!

This campaign is an effort to raise funds to set up my studio for hosting paint parties, classes, and workshops. All I need is some tables, chairs, easels, brushes and some other tools. These expenses add up quickly and unfortunately it is a number I am unable to invest in at the moment. Since I had my baby in November, it has been a challenge to work and save. Hosting classes is an ideal fit to my new life as a stay-at-home-mom/work-from-home artist. I am excited for this new chapter!

What I Need & What You Get

Raised funds will cover the following:

  • Folding 8’ tables: $120
  • Chairs: $300
  • Brushes, various sizes and decent quality: $140
  • Tabletop easels: $240
  • Paint: $50
  • Brush Cleaner: $20
  • Aprons: $30
  • Materials for Perks: $120
  • + Taxes & Fees

In exchange for your generous contributions I will be giving you original artwork and vouchers to these painting events I have been talking about! 

Mini-Paintings: I will be creating a series of one of a kind original artworks on 3”x3” canvases. Each one will be different, but inspired by nature and in my same fun vibrant style. What you get will be a surprise! Hang it in your kitchen, bathroom, on your fridge, or place it on a bookshelf!

Paint Party: A ticket to an upcoming paint party. My first events will be fun paint parties with themes like California Wildflowers, Whales, Mermaids, Waves, and more! Bring a snack and a beverage and I will provide the materials and instruction. I plan to get these started in May 2018 if this campaign is successful.

Custom Painting: For larger contributions I will create a custom 8”x10” painting. I will be taking requests if you have preferences on subject matter & color scheme. These requests can be sent by email after making your contribution. If you do not have a preference, the painting will be a surprise!

If I do not meet my campaign goal, I will use what funds are raised and spend a little extra time being thrifty - look for tables and chairs secondhand. I would need to be more creative and wait a little longer to realize my goal.

The Impact

Your contributions will support art and creativity in the community. My goal with the painting parties is to bring together people who may otherwise not paint due to fear or being too busy, and make the process fun and relaxing. Afterwards, my artists will bring home a piece that brings the creator joy and preserves a memory. By offering workshops and classes, I will help other artists hone in on their skills. I wish to support those who want to begin their creative journey.

My long term vision for my art business always comes back to the environment. By building a thriving business for myself, I hope to be able to eventually be able to contribute back to environmental organizations that work to protect our natural world.  

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute financially, please please share this with your friends and family. A share on Facebook or a forwarded email would go a long way! Thank you! :)

story:
Short Summary

I, Esther Mallouh, am an independent curator of Science/Art exhibits.  

My exhibits have at their hearts the pursuit of new connections, explorations and presentations at the nexus of the sciences and arts.  I specialize in cultivating dialogues between scientific and artistic inquiry through collaborative exchanges.  

 Visit www.mind-matters.org to view my previous exhibit.

As Above As Below: cosmic and brain webs

The Metaphor:  What laws govern the way networks grow and change, from the smallest brain cells to the growth of mega-galaxies? How close are we to understanding the commonalities between networks large and small?

As Above As Below explores those laws, the galaxies within, and the connection between all levels of existence in the universe, from the most immense with the very smallest.  

The exhibit features 9 new media artists interpreting ramifications of the collaborations between  7 Astrophysicists and 6 Neuroscientists who are drawing  parallels between galactic and neuronal networks.  Meet our collaborators:

1. Joel Primack - Astrophysicist|Olaf Sporns - Neuroscientist|Forest Stearns - Artist

2. Mark Neyrinck & Miguel Angel Aragon Calvo - Astrophyscists|Michael Silver - Neuroscientist|Anastasia Victor - Artist

3. David Weinberg - Astrophyscist|Dan Feldman - Neuroscientist|James Morgan, Thea Kinyon Bhoodoo, Cory Bloyd, Yagiz Mungan

4. Jeffrey Kruk - Astrophysicist|Tamira Elul- Neuroscientist|Yoon Chung Han - Artist

5. Bridget Falck - Astrophysicist|Sarah Banducci - Neuroscientist|Miguel Novelo - Artist

6. Benedikt Diemer - Astrophysicist|Natalie Zahr - Neuroscientist|Purin Phanichphant - Artist

Schedule:

The exhibit runs: Oct 13 through Dec 15, 2019

Sunday, Oct 13 from 12 to 4:30pm: Opening/reception at  Manresa Gallery, St Ignatius Church -  650 Parker Avenue, San Francisco, CA                                                                                                                          

12:30 to 1:30pm: Opening Panel discussions moderated by Jamie Vernon, CEO, Sigma Xi                                                                                                                                                                                                                      

Opening Music:  Nancy Abrams, Alien Wisdom,  Stacy Yi, Piano &  Michael Graham, Cello

Closing Reception:  Sunday, Dec 15 from 6 to 9pm                                                                                                                                        

The Need:  All of our artists are volunteering their time and resources to create As Above As Below. Any contribution you can make will go toward the cost of materials and equipment for our six new media art installations.

Please join us in the important role of enriching the history of contemporary Scientific Art.

Thank you. 

What We Need & What You Get

We are inviting you to contribute towards a $7,000 goal.  The funds will be used to underwrite the cost of materials and equipment needed to produce the installations. Each installation is unique and still in development at the time we're launching this campaign, but some of the items needed include software, projectors, live plants, and audio systems.

If we do not reach our entire goal, the funds received will be distributed equally amongst the artists to help reduce their out-of-pocket expenses.  

For contributions of $75 or more, you will receive a thank you card from one of our collaborators.

For contributions of $200 or more, you will receive the exhibition poster signed by some of our collaborators. 

For contributions of $500 or more, you will be acknowledged on asaboveasbelow.com.

For contributions of $1000 or more, you will receive a sketch of yourself drawn by one of the participating artists.

The Impact

As Above As Below spearheads the exchange of knowledge and scientific investigations between Astrophysics and Neuroscience through an intriguing new topic.  Will their investigations influence research into the preservation of humankind in the far distant future?

Albert Einstein once said:  “The most beautiful experience we can have is the mysterious. It is the fundamental emotion which stands at the cradle of true art and true science. Whoever does not know it and can no longer wonder, no longer marvel, is as good as dead, and his eyes are dimmed.”

At the very least, we hope to increase awareness of the latest advances in this two incredible fields of science, and to inspire new thoughts, ideas and dreams among viewers.

Risks & Challenges

All of our artists are pulling from their personal funds to create their installations even as I write this. A critical part of supporting the arts means supporting artists so they can keep making art sustainably. 

If we don't make our goal, some of our artists will be financially set back, but the installations will still be finished. We're all committed to As Above As Below.

The collaborators and myself are reaching out to our friends and colleagues to enlist their support. Please join us.

Other Ways You Can Help

- Tell your friends and colleagues about the exhibit and this campaign.
- Share this campaign on social media.
- If you're in the Bay Area, join us at our opening and closing events.

The Need:  All of our artists are volunteering their time and resources to create As Above As Below. Any contribution you can make will go toward the cost of materials and equipment for our six new media art installations.
Please join us in the important role of enriching the history of contemporary Scientific Art.
Thank you. 

What We Need & What You Get
We are inviting you to contribute towards a $7,000 goal.  The funds will be used to underwrite the cost of materials and equipment needed to produce the installations. Each installation is unique and still in development at the time we're launching this campaign, but some of the items needed include software, projectors, live plants, and audio systems.
If we do not reach our entire goal, the funds received will be distributed equally amongst the artists to help reduce their out-of-pocket expenses.  
For contributions of $75 or more, you will receive a thank you card from one of our collaborators.
For contributions of $200 or more, you will receive the exhibition poster signed by some of our collaborators. 
For contributions of $500 or more, you will be acknowledged on asaboveasbelow.com.
For contributions of $1000 or more, you will receive a sketch of yourself drawn by one of the participating artists.

The Impact
As Above As Below spearheads the exchange of knowledge and scientific investigations between Astrophysics and Neuroscience through an intriguing new topic.  Will their investigations influence research into the preservation of humankind in the far distant future?
Albert Einstein once said:  “The most beautiful experience we can have is the mysterious. It is the fundamental emotion which stands at the cradle of true art and true science. Whoever does not know it and can no longer wonder, no longer marvel, is as good as dead, and his eyes are dimmed.”
At the very least, we hope to increase awareness of the latest advances in this two incredible fields of science, and to inspire new thoughts, ideas and dreams among viewers.

Risks & Challenges
All of our artists are pulling from their personal funds to create their installations even as I write this. A critical part of supporting the arts means supporting artists so they can keep making art sustainably. 
If we don't make our goal, some of our artists will be financially set back, but the installations will still be finished. We're all committed to As Above As Below.
The collaborators and myself are reaching out to our friends and colleagues to enlist their support. Please join us.

Other Ways You Can Help
- Tell your friends and colleagues about the exhibit and this campaign.- Share this campaign on social media.- If you're in the Bay Area, join us at our opening and closing events.

story:
Hi!  I’m Nadia, a full-time professional artist and art teacher in Hawaii.  

I LOVE EVERYTHING ART!

Learning to trust our inherent creative nature is essential....

This is where my art school comes in.  My passion is to make sure children get access to art education. For many kids, painting, drawing, and sculpting is a powerful outlet for the immense amount of energy we all have, as some kids learn visually or kinesthetically. 

HOW DOES YOUR CHILD LEARN?

The process of making art helps us all connect to and trust our true nature.  As a child, I learned to problem solve first with my body and then secondly with my mind.  We are all creative beings and with guidance, we can all trust that and channel that energy. 

WHERE WILL THE MONEY GO?

I am running this Indiegogo Campaign to raise money to complete the construction of my new art school in Waimanalo.  To be ready for the summer school sculpting, painting, and drawing classes, the buildout must be completed by June 1st, 2021.  I already have one local public school, an all-girls private school and many home school children signed up for these classes.  Art education is essential.  Help me help them.

It will take $9,000 and more to finish the construction.  This money will be used to purchase the materials and pay the construction crews to complete the roof between the 2 buildings the kids will sculpt under, build the raised floor they will work on, and run the electric lines from the main building to the art buildings.  With the remining money I will purchase an electric ceramics kiln and more complex sculpting tools and equipment for the kids.  Many members of the local community have already donated their time to build, clean, paint, and assist me in the move of all the equipment and tools.

I built out my last art studio/school over a period of 7 years. However, this time it is urgent, due to an unplanned business location move.  The school year ends at the end of May.  The students and parents are expecting a sculpture, painting, and drawing facility the first week of June. I am confident the buildings will be completed on time for the children.  These kids will have our help.  I am highly disciplined and organized and that is how I shifted from no art business/art school to a thriving creative art business where I sell my art globally with a steady stream of students all year.   I have the construction crews already scheduled.

It will take $9,000 + to complete the build-out by June 1st, 2021.  

Contribute here, and if this is not the season for you to contribute, would you please pass this out to 3 or more people you know that could.

Thanks so much for your time and attention  ~N

story:
Started by tumblr user @thats-frogs-babey, Anuras is a collaborative work that combines the talents of over 30 authors and artists to celebrate something they all love-- frogs. Amphibians are becoming extinct at a rate that far surpassed any other group in the animal kingdom, but they get little attention. While forces like habitat loss, the fungal infection Chytridomycosis, and global warming fight against frogs, scientists aren't receiving the funding they need to protect our froggy friends. Anuras is a collection of people that want to change that. All proceeds from the zine will go directly to conservation and education efforts, as we do our part to help the amphibians we hold so dear. (The name Anuras comes from the scientific name for the frog family, Anura!)

What We Need & What You Get

What we need?

  • We need money to be able to produce the zine in a physical form, ideally upwards of 150 backers.
  • We need people to fund the purchase of pins, keychains, and prints, ideally around 50 backers for each.
  • Last, but certainly not least, we are raising money for conservation, so as much profit as is possible. 

What you get?

  • It all depends on your tier!
  • Everyone who donates will get a digital copy of the zine, but it doesn't stop there! You have the opportunity to get physical copies of the zine, unique prints by some of our incredible artists, an enamel pin, and an acrylic charm keychain.
  • You also get the confidence of knowing that you're helping to preserve the beauty of our earth and its creatures for the generations of the future.

The Impact

At least a quarter of amphibian species on earth are threatened with extinction, but compared with birds and mammals, our froggy friends receive a severe lack of funding. According to the US Fish and Wildlife service, in 2014, they received a budget of ~83 million dollars. From 2010-2014, amphibians as a whole only received around 1.03 million. If we are assuming the budget of the service stayed relatively constant, at 80 million a year for those four years, wit would indicate that amphibians, the most at risk vertebrates, are only receiving about .003% of the USFWS budget each year. Clearly, the scientists need our help. By funding and supporting Anuras, you're helping fund studies, protect habitats, and save the frogs.

Other Ways You Can Help

Just because you can't afford to support Anuras or frog conservation right now, doesn't mean you can't do anything!

  • Get the word out! Share Anuras information with your friends, family, coworkers, weird old neighbor, whoever will listen to you!
  • Share Anuras information via social media! Check out anuras-afrogzine.tumblr.com!
  • Make others aware of the crisis facing amphibians. Email your lawmakers! Educate yourself and others

story:
The Story

Hi, I'm Justin. I'm a musician. And in the musical world, the word "score" has a certain assumed meaning: the rendering of a piece of music in ink on a piece of paper, using a complicated system of notation where circles and lines indicate parameters such as pitch, rhythm, instrumentation, and more. But there are drawbacks to this system. Often it is not possible to truly represent everything that a piece of music might contain, especially hard to quantify things like emotional expression and tone color. Some composers discovered that the limitations of scores could be something to celebrate, where intentional omission of certain aspects left more of the performance up for interpretation. Eventually this led to variations on conventional Western musical notation but it also continued far beyond it, including text, charts, and graphics.

If the goal of a score is to present a performer with information helpful in the realization of the piece, then surely things other than this standard notation (or indeed, ink on a page at all) could be scores, and in fact, perhaps better than conventional ones in certain situations. Why not an object? Why not a whole entire piece of visual art? This is where SCORE was born.

The Event

At this event, the score will be a large-scale fabric installation created by Val Galstad. Consisting primarily of white tulle and white thread, the piece appears "blank" from afar but close inspection will reveal the intricate details of Val's handiwork. It will cover a wall in the performance space and stretch out into the third dimension, where it will encounter various objects, performers and the audience.

Katherine Evans and Matt Cichon, two Portland-based dancers and choreographers, will collaborate with me to produce a genre-breaking interpretation of the piece that will inspire all of the senses. The performance will take place in, under and around the installation itself. The construction of the fabric piece is ongoing, so while we can plan and rehearse, no one can know exactly what the event will look like, in truth not until the performance itself! This "indeterminacy" is part of the experience for everyone involved.

What We Need

The performance will take place at the lovely Performance Works NW, an awesome dance-centric space in SE Portland that specifically focuses on local experimental performance art, and we think we fit right in! We need to raise at least $700 to cover our production costs, which include venue rental, a whole lot of fabric!, props, costumes, advertising, processing fees, and most importantly, paying all of the artists involved in this highly collaborative project. This fundraising goal makes sure everyone gets paid a nominal fee, but any funds that exceed our goal will go directly to our artists in further appreciation of their dedication to their respective crafts and their commitment to making this event a reality.

This is my third production of 2019 and my second Indiegogo campaign. Check out the campaign page for 2017's thaw where we successfully raised $1300 thanks to donors like you!

The Perks

Looking for even more reasons to donate? We've got some amazing perks for certain donation levels:

$25 - Admission to the event! I like the idea of audience members becoming stakeholders in the event they are attending. In addition, you will get an online thank you, and if you're an artist, I will happily promote your latest project. Let's support each other!

$50 - In addition to attending the event and your online thank yous, you will receive a private dance lesson from Matt Cichon in Portland! Or you can choose to receive a mini text score by Justin Bulava. A score made with ink on a page, but no notes to be found!

$100 - You will receive all of the above perks PLUS a brand new, one-of-a-kind, mini fabric score hand made by Val Galstad! Your own private "SCORE"? Incredible!

Please allow until September for fulfillment of the $50 and $100 perks. You will be contacted after the event with more information.

Featured Artists

Justin Bulava - sound

Matt Cichon - movement

Katherine Evans - movement

Val Galstad - textile

Thank you for your support!

I appreciate your support for checking out the campaign! Even if you can't contribute, please share this page with your friends and family and help us bring this unique event to life.

Thank you!

Justin Bulava

www.justinbulava.com

story:
Everything was so much easier before the Rona – grocery shopping, getting your dog groomed, dropping off a prescription to an elderly parent. Now it all seems stressful. Everything takes longer. People are on edge. We're on edge. You’re on edge.

Gratitude journals and wine haven’t done the trick. Not even chocolate works anymore.

Now, imagine you're on the way home after four hours of running around that should have taken 45 minutes. Stopped at a red light, you glance around and spot these words:

Prepare for battle.

Tedious monotony.

Where has the fun gone?

Clearly, you’re not alone in how you feel. Later, you share words you didn’t realize you’d memorized with someone. It sparks a conversation about all the things you’ve been holding in because you don’t want to sound “negative” or burden anyone with your “feelings.”

But talking about it feels good. It alters your constitution. You laugh. Really laugh at the absurdity of forgetting your mask all the time or how upset you got when the store was out of peanut butter. Eventually the conversation turns to ways you can have more fun. How you can help. Imagine.

Introducing The Haiku Ninja Collective

A group of super cool people who listen to one another vent, kvetch and share about all the chaos caused by the Rona and then turn all of that confusion and frustration into art!                Est. March 2020

The Project

In November 2020, founder staci b was awarded $1000 by Awesome Pittsburgh to place the Haiku Ninja Collective’s COVID-19 related Haiku on outdoor venues in Pittsburgh! This is the next step in fulfilling our mission: share these Haiku with the world to remind people in a tangible way that we are all connected.

The Awesome Pittsburgh award got us off to great start! And now we want to share these 17-syllable word portraits around our COVID-19 experiences on the next level: More bus stop shelters throughout Pittsburgh and other cities in the US.

Raising the full amount for this campaign enables us to do more bus stop shelters - approximately 6-10 depending on what city they're located in - and compensates staci b for project management at $20/hour.

Why should YOU care?

These poetic nuggets help people realize they are not alone. When people nurture the seed planted by the words they read it leads to to a place where more people admit how they feel. When you own how you feel, you purge the toxicity of negative emotions. Then more people feel better. And more kindness and understanding is inevitable.

 

Back Story and Where We’re Headed

The Awesome Pittsburgh award covers 3 bus stop shelters (which will be at Euclid and Centre in Shadyside, 50th and Butler in Lawrenceville and Crane and Banksville Road in Mt. Lebanon) for a month beginning January 5th. Your participation in this campaign helps us to purchase more bus stop shelters and/or transit cards in Pittsburgh and other cities. 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge we face is having the money necessary for production and installation. Not being a 501c3 means no grants and no tax deductions. We operate mean and lean. staci b contributed original art and designed the shelter posters and Tina Andrews, a member of the Collective, designed them in PhotoShop.  

But we can't do it alone. So we're inviting you - lovers of art, poetry aficionados, bringers of community, supporters of connection - to join the collaboration. We can't do it without your help. 

The risks are low. The Collective gathers every two weeks to discuss our experiences around the pandemic and transform them into Haiku, creating a deep pool to draw Haiku from that are appropriate for outdoor venues.

Other Ways You Can Help

We get it. Some of us are experiencing potholes financially, but you can still support our mission by sharing this campaign with your tribe. Send an e-mail. Post on social media - FB, IG, LinkedIn, NextDoor, Twitter.  Indiegogo makes it easy - just click on the icon for your favorite social media. Boom! Done!!

We appreciate each and every effort!

story:
Bird watching through Puerto Rico is a one of a kind artist book that documents my bird watching experiences, as I explored different ecosystems in Puerto Rico. It includes actual sounds and illustrations that intend to capture the true essence of what it feels like to go birding in Puerto Rico. This book originated in 2011 and was the product of the culmination of my studies at the School of Visual Arts of Puerto Rico (EAPD). Through the years, the book has been exhibited in a number of places, including Puerto Rico, New York, Miami, Turkey, Bulgaria and Berlin. 

Thanks to the success of the book, I was invited to be part of an art residency offered by the RISOLAB at the SVA MFA Visual Narrative Department. This is the first time that I will attempt to reproduce the book as a limited edition of risograph exemplars. The book will also be translated to English and it will feature full color illustrations of the endemic birds of Puerto Rico, as well as some of its most frequent visitors and residents. 

The simplest way to contribute is by reserving a copy of the book. For those wanting to provide additional support can opt for different perks such as bookmarks, cards and limited series of prints. 

The real goal is to create a series of 100 books that will be enough to set a collection. For that I need to buy a large quantity of materials and supplies. 

Please share Bird watching through Puerto Rico with friends and family, help make this real!

Thanks you for everything!

Krisia Ayala

------------------------------

 Pajareando por Puerto Rico es un libro único que documenta mis experiencias mientras pajareaba y exploraba diferentes ecosistemas de Puerto Rico. Este libro incluye sonidos e ilustraciones que intentan capturar la verdadera esencia de cómo se siente salir a pajarear en Puerto Rico. El libro se origina en el 2011 y fue el producto de la culminación de mis estudios en la Escuela de Artes Plásticas de Puerto Rico. Durante los años, el libro se ha exhibido en diferentes lugares que incluyen Puerto Rico, Nueva York, Miami, Turquía, Bulgaria y Berlín. 

Gracias al éxito del libro, he sido invitada a ser parte de una residencia de arte en el RISOLAB, una imprenta de risografia que forma parte de el MFA del Departamento de Narrativa Visual de The School of Visual Arts en NYC. Esta va a ser la primera oportunidad para intentar reproducir el libro como una edición limitada de ejemplares risograficos. Además, el libro contendrá varias ediciones como: versión al ingles e ilustraciones full color de las aves endémicas, residentes y visitantes. 

La mejor manera de contribuir es reservando una copia del libro. Las personas que quieran colaborar de otra manera, pueden donar o optar por alternativas como bookmarks o ediciones limitadas de impresiones en risografia. 

La verdadera meta es lograr una edicion de 100 ejemplares para poder incluir en libro en colecciones. Para lograr esta meta, es necesario invertir en una gran cantidad de materiales. 

Por favor, comparte Pajareando por Puerto Rico con tus amistades y ayuda a que este proyecto se vuelva realidad.

Gracias por todo,

Krisia Ayala

It includes actual sounds and illustrations that intend to capture the true essence of what it feels like to go birding in Puerto Rico. This book originated in 2011 and was the product of the culmination of my studies at the School of Visual Arts of Puerto Rico (EAPD). Through the years, the book has been exhibited in a number of places, including Puerto Rico, New York, Miami, Turkey, Bulgaria and Berlin. 
Thanks to the success of the book, I was invited to be part of an art residency offered by the RISOLAB at the SVA MFA Visual Narrative Department. This is the first time that I will attempt to reproduce the book as a limited edition of risograph exemplars. The book will also be translated to English and it will feature full color illustrations of the endemic birds of Puerto Rico, as well as some of its most frequent visitors and residents. 
The simplest way to contribute is by reserving a copy of the book. For those wanting to provide additional support can opt for different perks such as bookmarks, cards and limited series of prints. 
The real goal is to create a series of 100 books that will be enough to set a collection. For that I need to buy a large quantity of materials and supplies. 
Please share Bird watching through Puerto Rico with friends and family, help make this real!
Thanks you for everything!
Krisia Ayala
------------------------------
 Pajareando por Puerto Rico es un libro único que documenta mis experiencias mientras pajareaba y exploraba diferentes ecosistemas de Puerto Rico. Este libro incluye sonidos e ilustraciones que intentan capturar la verdadera esencia de cómo se siente salir a pajarear en Puerto Rico. El libro se origina en el 2011 y fue el producto de la culminación de mis estudios en la Escuela de Artes Plásticas de Puerto Rico. Durante los años, el libro se ha exhibido en diferentes lugares que incluyen Puerto Rico, Nueva York, Miami, Turquía, Bulgaria y Berlín. 
Gracias al éxito del libro, he sido invitada a ser parte de una residencia de arte en el RISOLAB, una imprenta de risografia que forma parte de el MFA del Departamento de Narrativa Visual de The School of Visual Arts en NYC. Esta va a ser la primera oportunidad para intentar reproducir el libro como una edición limitada de ejemplares risograficos. Además, el libro contendrá varias ediciones como: versión al ingles e ilustraciones full color de las aves endémicas, residentes y visitantes. 
La mejor manera de contribuir es reservando una copia del libro. Las personas que quieran colaborar de otra manera, pueden donar o optar por alternativas como bookmarks o ediciones limitadas de impresiones en risografia. 
La verdadera meta es lograr una edicion de 100 ejemplares para poder incluir en libro en colecciones. Para lograr esta meta, es necesario invertir en una gran cantidad de materiales. 
Por favor, comparte Pajareando por Puerto Rico con tus amistades y ayuda a que este proyecto se vuelva realidad.
Gracias por todo,
Krisia Ayala

story:
My Story

     My name is Ryan Crane. I am an artist. I find my love of art finds its way into everything I do including building custom cars to daily activities. I have recently  have decided to chase my dreams while helping others chase theirs as well.   

The Project     

     This is an effort to raise enough capital to open a gallery to show not only my own art but the art of others and provide a place for artists like myself to get their art to the public and sell it. People often find photographers through word of mouth and people can't compare the quality from one to another.  This business takes care of that. This creates a place where a photographer can hang a wedding portrait along with their contact information, or a baby portrait if that is their specialty.  A painter can hang a painting. When a potential customer comes in they can see the exact quality they would be paying for along with a comparison to others within the space. This means that if they contact the artist or photographer they have already likely chosen to do business with that person.  If an artist or photographer is involved with multiple genres or types of art they can create a small display of each type of work so that the customers can see it all and it is not limited to just painters or photographers.  The cost to rent display space would depend on the overall available square footage of the gallery space.

 Another section of the gallery will be designated for use as a studio for photography. Rental of the studio space will be hourly and very affordable.

Imagine a place where artists can get together with each other and share their work with society.  All art within the gallery will be for sale.

The importance of its success

     Have you ever thought about how people come up with ideas to create amazing buildings or movies or how brilliant minds come up with ideas that change the world? They are inspired through art. Art is powerful and can change communities for the better. 

     Art inspires people and the purpose of this gallery and studio is to give artists a place to inspire the surrounding community.  This is important to me because I feel art is an important aspect of society.  There are so many talented people in society but they get overlooked and this is a way for them to be found and recognized for their talents and skills and inspire greatness in each other and others.  Making a contribution to this fundraiser will not help only myself but the entire community. 

 Remember that every Donation helps, please help us reach our goal to make this a reality.

story:
Ever wanted a drawing challenge  but did not know where to start? 

well look no further as here is the ultimate test to your creativity.

Join our Facebook community: 

https://www.facebook.com/The-Book-Of-Scribble-401209733421666/timeline/

Come join our community and get involved!

The project is to start a large (A3) sized scribble book and we will be using local nursery's in Australia to scribble on 20 pages to be published into a large drawing book so that yourself, artists and sketchers can have their imagination tested by creating art out of the scribbles. This will be very challenging and fun for both individuals and groups. Each page will have a unique number so that the parents and other artists are able to find the transformed art through a community based website and see all the creative ideas people have created from the scribble and compare what others see.. Once we have enough pages for the first book we will then proceed with the project to finish and hopefully we all have something amazing to share! It would be amazing to see what yourself and others can see within the scribble. If you are interested in participating or have any further questions please feel free to contact us. 

It would be amazing to see what yourself and others can see within the scribble.  

If you are interested in participating or have any further questions please feel free to contact me.

here are some examples done by Ruth Oosterman:

Ruth Oosterman is a Canadian artist with solo work shown around the world. She spends her time collaborating with her toddler, Eve.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need $5000 dollars in order to get the book fully published and produced. 
  • Everyone that sponsors over a certain amount of money will receive a book. 
  • If we do not reach our goal that is not a problem as we will still continue to making the book but it will take a bit longer for funding.

The Impact

  • This book will really bring out the creative imagination that we all have.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cant afford to donate that's not a problem jump on Facebook, twitter, instagram and spread the word

  • Try to use the Indiegogo share tools!
Thank you so much!

story:
¿Quién?
 Ariadna M. González.
https://www.instagram.com/feather.n.fur/
https://www.facebook.com/arisita.m


¿Dónde?
 He sido aceptada para la sesión de otoño en Lunga School, en Islandia. La misma es una residencia artística que se lleva a cabo durante 3 meses (septiembre-diciembre). 
Aquí el link de la escuela: 
http://lunga.is/school/umsokn/fall-2016/
https://www.instagram.com/lungaschool/

El ser aceptada ha sido un logro muy esperado desde hace más de un año, y el cual me he ido preparando mentalmente.


¿Pero, por qué Islandia?
 Siempre me ha llamado la atención esta peculiar isla, mayormente porque se me ha hablado de ella desde la infancia. El esposo de mi madrina es de Reykjavik y vive hace muchos años en Jayuya, y cada vez que lo visito me cuenta de su cultura, su familia, y me intenta enseñar islandés. Y ahora que finalmente visitaré su país es como un intercambio cultural a través de los años.


Llevo meses ahorrando todo lo posible, y el dinero recaudado en esta campaña será utilizado para completar los gastos de la residencia.

Estaré infinitamente agradecida a todo quien apoye este viaje tan ansiado y al fin se hace realidad. También estaré entregando prints y/o dibujitos a quienes aporten <3

English


 Who?

Ariadna M. González

https://www.instagram.com/feather.n.fur/
https://www.facebook.com/arisita.m

Where?
I have been accepted to the Fall 2016 session in Lunga School, in Iceland. For three months (Sept-Dec) I’ll be in this artistic residency with other people from around the world, experimenting and learning new art mediums. To be accepted into this program is a very much awaited achievement, which I worked for the past year.


 Why Iceland?
I’ve always been captivated by Iceland, considering my godmother’s husband is from Reykjavik, and has been living in Puerto Rico for more than 25 years. I’m enchanted by him and his culture every time I visit. Going into his personal library is like going into another world, for he has maps, curious old artifacts, and Icelandic books. As a child and still as an adult is like going to his mind and his country in a magical way, while staying in my land. Now that I’m finally visiting Iceland is like an intercultural exchange throughout the years
 I’ve been saving up as much as possible for this trip, and the money will be used to complete the cost for this residency. I will be eternally grateful for all of you willing to help me out! <3

story:
Perry Frank, PhD, began documenting the public murals in the nation’s capital in 1997. The contemporary mural cycle came to Washington in the 1970s, inspired by socially conscious art that began in Chicago and soon spread across the country. Over the decades, scores of murals for varied purposes and in a variety of styles have appeared throughout the city, shaping neighborhoods and transmitting diverse histories and traditions.  

For nearly 20 years our team has made DC’s magnificent public art more accessible and meaningful through tours, public programs, and exhibitions. Our large archive ensures the preservation of this aesthetic and social record for future generations. This Crowd Source initiative is dedicated to a special purpose—the publication of a coffee table book that will reproduce our grand and historic public art, tell the stories of its creation, and introduce the artists in their own words. 

Our funding goal is $25,000. The majority of our fundraising campaign will support publication of the book, which will display our most important murals, drawn from all eight wards and many neighborhoods and spanning the nearly 50 years of public murals in DC.  The remainder will contribute to our public programs.  

Of course, all gifts are 100% tax deductible. All contributors will be listed in the book and will be honored at a free public event.

You have been with BNL every step of the way and we humbly thank you! BNL has been hard at work creating the "Next Chapter" and couldn't  imagine  presenting anything short of what we feel is a masterpiece (only the best for our fans). story:
This is a campaign for larger studio space to create mural-size, attention-demanding, thought-provoking paintings.


Why it's important,
and why you might want to support it:

I'm a painter on a mission...

I will convey through my paintings my ideas and views about some of the more pressing issues we face today;
  • social and economic justice
  • global warming
  • the lack of real democracy. 

I want to paint very big and bold (think mural-size) allegorical paintings that demand attention. To do that, I need to expand the space in which I work. I've outgrown my makeshift kitchen counter studio.

So I hope to earn money towards the down payment of the studio space I found, by painting portraits and landscapes and selling the limited edition prints you'll see below. I will paint oil portraits of children, adults, pets and houses.

By helping me secure a space where I can actually work unimpeded, you'll help me pursue my mission and grow into my full potential as an artist, and a communicator. No artist can predict or presume that his/her voice will be even noticed amidst the ruckus of modern life. But just maybe, with your help, I can create works that will in some way help our society find its way in these times.

The Goal:

Unlike other crowdfunding sites, It's not all or nothing. You get to keep anything you raise regardless of whether your goal is met or not. You'll see a goal of $30,000, but I'm not really expecting to raise that much here. Every little bit helps though, so if you see something that interests you below, and make a purchase I would appreciate it very much.

All proceeds will go toward the down payment for the purchase of the property. Once I've secured enough to cover that, I will begin renovations myself and hope to have it complete and to be working in the new space by Fall, 2016.

Perks:

You can choose from greeting cards to small and large limited edition prints, to commissioned portraits or landscapes in oil in three different sizes. I will also send everyone who contributes a photo of the studio when it's finished.

Get Immortalized in
a painting!

Any contributor at any level who wants to be depicted in my first mural-size painting can be! Just send me a photo. The first painting will take on the issues of income inequity in our economic system.

IMPORTANT NOTE:

Forget the $30,000...Whatever funds contributed go to me whether or not I reach the funding goal.


Limited Edition Prints

Choose from these images:
Male Torso

Female Figure 1

Female Figure 2

Female Figure 3

Tree Chooper

Frog Man



Commissioned Portraits

Choose from three sizes.



Other Ways You Can Help

Perhaps you're not interested in the kind of work I do, or you're unable financially to help. That's OK. You can still help by sharing this page with friends, colleagues, or anyone you think may have an interest. Even sharing with someone else who, like you can't participate financially, but WOULD be likely to share with others can be a big help. Remember, you can share to Facebook and Twitter. You can also post the link to Pinterest and use Indiegogo's share tools, as well.

In any case, thank you for your time, and consideration!
