story:
Short Summary

Hello, I am Chip Clawson, a sculptor who uses concrete and ceramics. I began working in ceramics 50 years ago, then launched into architectural-scale public and private art 18 years ago, leading to my current work with fabric-formed concrete. No one else has attempted this kind of work with concrete, it is entirely my vision--and my experimentation--that has led to a place of feeling very confident in my structural techniques.

I recently visited the work of Edward James at Las Pozas, a Surrealist Concrete Sculpture Garden (architectural sculptures up to 4 stories tall) in Xilitla, Mexico.

This place of unending creativity was a joy and an inspiration! I am excited to follow Edward James conceptually and build “Ode to Edward James,” a group of columns and platforms 20 feet tall and encompassing an area 15 feet by 25 feet. This concrete sculptural structure can be viewed as a metaphysical space or a ruins. Please help me achieve this goal by funding this project!




What We Need & What You Get

    I will take no payment for my labor (the majority of the work) but will need at least $10,000 to accomplish the “Ode to Edward James." The money will be used primarily to pay for materials, but also for a structural engineer, some labor, and equipment rental. I have already received pro bono architectural services from Gretchen Krumm at Mosaic Architecture. I will take this project as far as possible with the money raised and expand it further for greater impact if the funding allows.



    Let's face it, your financial contributions
    are vital to the success of this project!

    So, please, contribute money at any level --
    because this will be the Coolest Thing You Do All Week!

    A financial commitment of $5 or more is just one way to help!
    Be part of my team by sharing, posting, liking, volunteering to help and asking other folks to join in the campaign.



The Impact

This project pushes at the edge of what can be created with fabric-formed concrete. I’m also opening new ways to use architectural forms as sculpture, creating an indoor-outdoor metaphysical space that visually nudges you to imagine more, to see what once was--inviting you to picture the now-missing floor and stairways.
I have been building architectural-scale sculptures for nearly 20 years. Dimensionally, this will be my largest project--both literally and figuratively--a culmination of the other complex, multi-year projects I have completed. This is a big challenge that will provide my community decades of joy and satisfaction.

Risks & Challenges


I intend to build these sculptures in the city of Helena, Montana; I already have the help of Gretchen Krumm and Phil Bachofner in working with the city building department, which is supportive of the project.

I have the cooperation and support of my neighbors in building a large art project in the neighborhood. John and Janet Andrew are allowing me access across their property several times with concrete conveyor trucks. I will use my creative energies to solve the inevitable challenges that crop up.

I have a history of successfully taking on out-of-the-box projects and am excited to begin this new exploration of urban art. I will need volunteer help and have a large community of friends to call on.

Other Ways You Can Help

I need financial support, but I also need help in other ways as well. Physical tasks include moving forms and scaffolding, helping with pouring concrete and other manual labor.

I'm also looking for people with special skills that you think can help me, for example,  video, shipping perks, communications, computer support, and organizing volunteers.

One of the most important ways you can support this project is to spread the word and share the excitement. Please use all the social media tools to help me.

I will take
no payment for my labor (the majority of the work) but will need at least
$10,000 to accomplish the “Ode to Edward James." The money will be used
primarily to pay for materials, but also for a structural engineer, some labor,
and equipment rental. I have already received pro bono architectural services
from Gretchen Krumm at Mosaic Architecture. I will take this project as far as
possible with the money raised and expand it further for greater impact if the funding
allows.




Let's face it, your financial
contributions 
are vital to the success of this project! 

So, please, contribute money at any level -- 
because this will be the Coolest Thing You Do All Week!
A financial commitment of $5 or more is just one way to help! 
Be part of my team by sharing, posting, liking, volunteering to help and asking
other folks to join in the campaign.

    The ImpactThis project pushes at
the edge of what can be created with fabric-formed concrete. I’m also opening
new ways to use architectural forms as sculpture, creating an indoor-outdoor metaphysical space that visually nudges you to imagine more, to see what once was--inviting you to picture the now-missing floor and stairways.I have been building architectural-scale sculptures for nearly 20 years. Dimensionally, this will be my largest project--both literally and figuratively--a culmination of the other complex, multi-year projects I have completed. This is a big challenge that will
provide my community decades of joy and satisfaction.
    Risks & Challenges
I intend to build these sculptures in the city of Helena, Montana; I already have the help of Gretchen Krumm and Phil Bachofner in working
with the city building department, which is supportive of the project.I have the cooperation and support
of my neighbors in building a large art project in the neighborhood. John and
Janet Andrew are allowing me access across their property several times with
concrete conveyor trucks. I will use my creative energies to solve the inevitable challenges that crop up.I have a history of successfully taking on
out-of-the-box projects and am excited to begin this new exploration of urban art. I will need volunteer help and have
a large community of friends to call on.   Other Ways You Can Help
I need financial support, but I also
need help in other ways as well. Physical tasks include moving forms and scaffolding,
helping with pouring concrete and other manual labor.
I'm also looking for people with special skills that you
think can help me, for example,  video, shipping perks, communications,
computer support, and organizing volunteers. 
One of the most important ways you
can support this project is to spread the word and share the excitement.
Please use all the social media tools to help me.

story:
Short Summary


  • My name is Eltsahfahn Vanterpool aka "Ellustration" I am an artist born and raised in New York City. I draw sketches, I paint anything, I create art, I build and materialize ideas. Art is who I am and who I have always been.
  • You HAVE to help me get to Miami for Art Basel 2015!!! I've been invited to one of the biggest art events of the year. Art Basel is an event that happens every year, known for breaking new artists and being on the cutting edge of new trends in art.
  • This is big!!! Just being invited to Art Basel is an achievement within itself. With your participation, I will be able to showcase my art at a prestigious  event which has always been one of my dreams. Supporting local artists helps the community become more creative and dynamic.You are our primary source of support and no contribution is too small.

What We Need & What You Get


  • I am asking for $2,500 to cover round trip air fare, shipping and storage costs of supplies and artwork, hotel accommodations for 3 days and per diem for the short stay.
  • To show my appreciation for investors, I will have great perks such as Unique T-shirts with exclusive new artwork designed by myself. In addition you will also have an opportunity to receive a unique 30x24 original oil painting on canvas.
  • If I do not reach my goal on time, all accumulated funds will go towards shipping artwork to and from the Art Basel event. Residual funds will go towards the creation of new projects and artwork.

The Impact

Although I have been an artist all my life, I have just recently stepped out into the art world. But after displaying my art and networking at a few events, I met a fellow outstanding artist named "Math" from Brooklyn NY who also appreciated my work and that resulted in an invitation to hang my pieces in Miami at this major art event. Chances like this don't come often, thinking more as an artist should, I have learned to seize moments like this. You can use this as a great chance to help a little known artist from inner-city New York gain exposure, notoriety and help cause a ripple effect that goes far and wide. I will always remember and value all those that helped, loyalty and support are very important to me. Click the link to explore some of my artwork Ellustration.

    Opportunities

    I have less than 2 months to make this a reality but I believe anything is possible.  The greatest opportunity I have here is to connect with people who see the value of art in the world and want to make a positive impact.

      Other Ways You Can Help

      Thank you in advance for your Love and Support! There's is no limit on what you can do to help.You can connect me with anyone in Miami with resources  or spread the word, share this post, blog, tweet, gossip. However you do it! Use the Indiegogo share tools to make it easy!

story:
Let's build a fort! is an interactive sound installation by LAHarrisonMusic, coming February 2016. The installation will be a large blanket fort, made from bed sheets, tarpaulins and blankets. Different sounds will be produced by interacting with different objects in the space, such as pillows and soft toys. Background sound will be created based on where objects are placed within the fort, and how the audience move and play. It will be an immersive art experience, where the audience will have the opportunity to be a child again.

Your contribution will help us to make the fort as accessible as possible, and will ensure that we can create a magical experience free of charge to visitors.

Details

2-13 February 2016

5th Base Gallery

23 Heneage Street

London

E1 5LJ

Perks

For a £10 donation you will receive a personal thank you from the whole team on social media as well as a thank you in the programme.

For a £30 donation you will receive a written thank you, and a handy guide to building your own expert fort.

For a £50 donation you will receive all of the above, as well as the opportunity to feature your own sound in the blanket fort. You will also receive a sound bite of how this sound was used.

For a £100 donation you will receive all of the above as well as a thank you pack which will include posters and programmes from the event.

Artists

Sound designer - Lucy Ann Harrison (laharrisonmusic.co.uk)

Visual designer - Ele Slade (elesladedesign.com)

Twitter and instagram - @LetsBuildAFort_

story:
Hi, my name is Laura. I’m Italian and I’m an immigrant.

I left my home country two days ago. Last night I took a ferry to England and now I’m travelling up to Scotland.

Many women before me took this journey.

Since 1850 a lot of Italian women followed their husbands and followed their dreams to find a better future for their families; they left their home country, facing the unknown, to build a new identity.

I have collected the stories of these women in a play that will open in Scotland at the end of September. The title of the play is A Bench on the Road and will open in Glasgow on 29th September. The voices of these women will finally be heard.

However, the play is only the first step on a journey towards a broader and more ambitious project. There are other stories that I would like to share, other women that I would like to give a voice to: they are the immigrants of today.  

To realise the entire project I would like to create:

An audio-visual exhibition

I will ask female immigrants of today to tell their stories, and to choose an image that they feel  represents their journey as immigrants. 

Visitors will listen to the stories of these women and will view the images, hopefully connecting and engaging with what they hear and see.  My vision is that the exhibition will be able to go into schools, universities, community halls and anywhere else expressing interest as part of a community building initiative.  

A film documentary created by the School of Cinema of Milan

Stefano Teodori and Monica Fenu, students in their final year at the School of Cinema, will come to Scotland to follow the rehearsal process and the tour of the show, creating a link between the immigration of the past and the immigration of the present. They will create a documentary of 50 mins that may be viewed all over Scotland, abroad and by those living in  isolated communities and not able to see the show.

In our history, we are experiencing a time of great confusion, dominated by fear, anger and disillusionment. We are scared to lose our identity and yet, we are not truly sure of who we are.  

I would like the younger generations to know about immigration. I would like them to understand how difficult it is for a person to leave their homeland, how painful to let go of  certainties, how challenging to face the unknown, and yet having little choice in the matter -  because their children are hungry and they want to offer something better to the people they love.

To realise this project, I would like to ask for your support. I am asking you to dig into your past memories and to connect with any experience that entailed leaving something or someone behind. Perhaps it wasn’t a personal experience but one that your parents or grandparents lived through.  Perhaps you moved only from one region to another but nevertheless left your past and faced a new beginning. We all do. We are all immigrants.

Thank you for sharing the vision!

This is the minumum for us to make the project a reality.

The more you contribute the more we can make the exhibition and the documentary travel and reach out.

Audio-visual exhibition:

- 20 headphones - £200

- 20 mp3 player - £200

- 20 prints (photos) - £300

- 20 frames - £400

Film documentary:

Travel expenses for the video crew - £400 (flights) + £ 300 (car hire)

Accommodation expenses for the video crew for 10 days - £700

 

Ciao, mi chiamo Laura, sono italiana e mi trovo in Inghilterra in questo momento: ieri sera ho preso il traghetto che mi ha portato qui,  adesso continuerò il mio viaggio fino in Scozia.

Questo viaggio è stato intrapreso da tantissime donne prima di me: centinaia, migliaia di donne sono arrivate in Inghilterra e poi con il treno, quando potevano permetterselo, oppure a piedi, sono salite a nord fino in Scozia per cercare una vita migliore, per offrire ai loro figli un futuro migliore. Donne emigranti ricche di coraggio pronte a sacrificare tutto per il bene di chi amavano.

Dal 1850 fino ad oggi,  una strada ininterrotta di passi accompagnati dalla speranza, valigie piene di storie e di ricordi che queste donne hanno lasciato e che restano incise nella memoria dei loro figli e dei loro nipoti.  Ho avuto la fortuna di raccogliere queste storie, grazie ad un progetto sostenuto dall'Italo-Scottish Cluster (Università di Edimburgo)
  

Ho raccolto le loro testimonianze e ne ho fatto uno spettacolo, dal titolo A Bench on the Road, che debutterà  a Glasgow il 29 di Settembre: le loro voci prenderanno vita sul palcoscenico di tanti teatri scozzesi e sul quello milanese del Piccolo Teatro di Milano.

Io però ho una visione più grande e più ambiziosa di cui lo spettacolo è solo una parte.

Vorrei far sentire anche altre voci: sono le voci delle donne emigranti di oggi; perchè anche oggi si emigra, si cerca un futuro migliore.  Si spera. La speranza fa nascere il coraggio.

Per realizzare l’intero progetto vorrei creare:

Una mostra audio-visiva

Chiederò alle donne emigranti di oggi di raccontare la loro storia e di scegliere un’immagine che le rappresenti o che rappresenti il loro percorso personale. I visitatori della mostra ascolteranno in cuffia le storie di queste donne e guarderanno le immagini, trovando, io spero, ispirazione, risposte o anche semplicemente una diversa comprensione di questo fenomeno storico che ci riguarda tutti in tutto il mondo.  La mia visione prevede che la mostra entri nelle scuole, nelle università, e raggiunga tutte quelle comunità che esprimono interesse sull’argomento.   

Un documentario realizzato dalla Scuola di Cinema diretta da Maurizio Nichetti

Stefano Teodori e Monica Fenu, studenti dell’ultimo anno della Scuola di Cinema, verranno in Scozia per seguire le prove e la tournèe dello spettacolo A Bench on the Road, intervisteranno gli emigranti di ieri e di oggi e realizzeranno un documentario di 50 minuti come testimonianza storica della migrazione dall’Italia alla Scozia, ieri come oggi. Questo documentario potrà essere visto in tutta la Scozia, all’estero e in tutte quelle comunità isolate presso le quali non sarebbe possibile portare lo spettacolo.  La mia speranza è che possa anche girare l’Italia.

Siamo in un periodo storico di grande confusione, dominato dalla paura, dalla rabbia e dalla disillusione. Abbiamo paura di perdere la nostra identità, ma al tempo stesso, non sappiamo più chi veramente siamo.   

Vorrei che le nuove generazioni sapessero cosa significa essere un emigrante, cosa significa lasciare il proprio paese,  spogliarsi della propria identità per cucirsene addosso un’altra con grande fatica e con non poco dolore; affrontare l’Ignoto perché le cose non vanno, perché si ha fame, perché c’è una guerra, perché i propri figli stanno male.

Per realizzare l’intero progetto, chiedo il vostro aiuto.   Vi chiedo di scavare nei vostri ricordi e di riportare alla memoria il momento in cui avete dovuto lasciare qualcuno o qualcosa di caro alle vostre spalle e andare altrove. Forse non è accaduto direttamente a voi, ma ai vostri genitori o ai vostri nonni.  Forse non siete andati troppo lontano, magari avete semplicemente cambiato città; tuttavia avete comunque lasciato il passato e affrontato un nuovo inizio. Lo facciamo tutti. Siamo tutti emigranti. 

Vi ringrazio per condividere questa visione e di realizzare insieme a me questo grande progetto!

Più donate, più persone possiamo raggiungere, diffondendo sempre più il nostro lavoro!!

Mostra Audio - Visiva:

- 20 cuffie - £200

- 20 mp3 player - £200

- 20 stampe (foto) - £300

- 20 cornici - £400

Documentario:

Spese di viaggio per la troupe - £400 (volo) + £ 300 (noleggio auto)

Alloggio per la troupe per 10 giorni - £700

story:
Soul Expressions: Coloring for Transformation 

Soul Expressions: Coloring for Transformation is designed to bring you a closer connection to your soul, help you experience more peace and joy and energize your creativity. Pre-order your copy here and also receive some additional fun rewards!

MORE INFO ABOUT THE FUN PERKS IS BELOW....KEEP SCROLLING!


This coloring experience is powerfully different. The drawings were created using age-old energy systems like Tai Chi and Qigong, used for both health and relaxation. When I began practicing a Qigong system I learned over 20 years ago, I realized early on that the energy (sometimes called chi) was moving my body, not the other way around. The energy flowed into the artwork I was creating, which resulted in a way of drawing I labeled Energy Art. The energy comes through these pages as you color them, building and strengthening the energy pathways throughout your body the same way Qigong or Tai Chi does. The more you color, the feeling of peace and stillness you feel during the process will continue even after you finish coloring. To increase the benefits of this coloring book, there are also instructions for a simple Qigong movement you can do before you color. Here are a few of the pages from the book:

 

It’s almost as if the drawings are a visual language only the soul knows. As you flip through this intriguing book, you will notice you are drawn to specific pages for no logical reason. This approach to art has a way of reaching us at a deep level, beyond our logical mind. You will enjoy seeing what drawing leaps out at you and seems to be saying “pick me!” for that coloring session. Select it and get busy diving into the experience of what the drawing has to offer you. Let go of any “rules” about coloring and do what you want to with your colors and method of coloring. You may feel motivated to cut your page into pieces with which you can create a collage. It’s up to you! You will be rewarded with more peace, more creativity, more ability to focus and certainly more fun and joy.

The benefits of this experience are long lasting.
After you finish your first coloring page, take a few moments to quietly focus on it. You may find that merely focusing openly will grace you with peaceful feelings. Place it in your work space or somewhere you will see often. Every time you take a break to gaze into it, you will rediscover that feeling. Allow the energy to float to you. After you have completed a number of pages, you will have a selection of images to surround yourself with. Take a few moments and select ones you want to focus on in any given day. They will continue to bring you joy, peace and a feeling of connectedness with your soul.

 

This rich experience of coloring will help you:

  • Unplug from the stress in your life.
  • Dive into a closer connection with your soul.
  • Develop more long-lasting inner peace the more you color.
  • Enhance your creative exploration and inspiration.
  • Focus and relax your mind.
  • Enhance your home or workplace with positive energy.
  • Have more fun in your day!

Soul Expressions Coloring Book is being created with a lot of heart, energy and some practical things, too:

  • Perforated pages for easy removal.
  • Sturdy paper to support heavy coloring with a variety of coloring tools such as colored pencils, gel pens and markers.
  • 76 one-sided images so you don’t have to choose which ones to display or frame.

The finished Book size is 9.5”W x 9”H with 160 perforated, frameable one-sided pages.

 

Timeline:

October 16 - November 18 -- ​Indegogo campaign

November 23 -- Soul Expressions Coloring Book goes to press

Week of December 5 -- Books & most perks shipped (unless another date is specified)

 

Are there any risks?

All 76 drawings are complete, the book is completely laid out and ready for printing at a high quality printer. Production time is projected to be less than 10 days. You will have your book(s) and most perks in time for the holidays! While this is my first Indegogo campaign, as a graphic designer and business owner, I am not new to design for print production, developing and launching new products and very resourceful about how to get things done. The amount of funding pledges received will be directly related to the number of books printed. If funding falls short of the goal, we'll just print fewer books. If the project is delayed for any reason, you can be assured I will let you know and make any adjustments necessary. 

How can you help? (Thank you, very much!)

Of course, pre-purchasing a book (or lots of books!) in this campaign is a great way to help, and if you can spread the word about this energy coloring project with your friends through email and social media, that would be most wonderful, too! Indegogo has some great share tools to use. If you live close to me, invite me to speak at your group meetings. You can also "like" the book's Facebook page: Soul Expressions Coloring Book. To see more energy artwork visit my website: JancyPettit.com. The bigger the Soul Expressions community, the more fun and energetic the project will be. Let's get coloring in energy!

Here are a few more pages just waiting for you to enjoy! There are 76 total images to color in the book. Each is centered on it's own page. 

Perk Details

One personally signed book + personally signed print - #1 below. (Printed on 8.5" x 11" heavy, frameable paper.)

PRINT #1 (below)

2 personally signed books + 2 personally signed prints -- #1 and #2. (Printed on 8.5" x 11" heavy, frameable paper.)

PRINT #2 (below)

 
Three personally signed books + three personally signed prints -- #1, #2 and #3. (Printed on 8.5" x 11" heavy, frameable paper.)
PRINT #3 (below)

Book + Matted archival gicleé print (Shown below). All personally signed! Finished size is 11" x 14". Suitable for framing in a standard sized frame. Gicleé prints are the highest quality digital prints available. They are printed on acid-free art papers with inks that are guaranteed to be colorfast for 99+ years.  They will also be matted with acid-free archival mats which will not yellow over time. This is definitely a prime perk choice!
 

MATTED Gicleé PRINT (below)

Custom Energy Drawing:

This is an example of what a custom drawing might look like. They are always different...and created specifically for each individual to enhance your energy! These drawings will also be matted so they will be easy to frame in your standard sized frame.

Original Painting Example:

Below is an example of what an original painting might look like. Each one is custom and designed for YOUR energy, so it will look different! We will fully discuss the project before I start working on it.

  Space Exploration 36" x 24"

Thank you for your pledge, support and advance book purchases! And, thank you for sharing with your friends, family and business associates. I can't wait to get coloring with you!
Jancy Pettit, Energy Artist
story_txt:
Soul Expressions: Coloring for Transformation 

Soul Expressions: Coloring for Transformation is designed to bring you a closer connection to your soul, help you experience more peace and joy and energize your creativity. Pre-order your copy here and also receive some additional fun rewards!
MORE INFO ABOUT THE FUN PERKS IS BELOW....KEEP SCROLLING!

This coloring experience is powerfully different. The drawings were created using age-old energy systems like Tai Chi and Qigong, used for both health and relaxation. When I began practicing a Qigong system I learned over 20 years ago, I realized early on that the energy (sometimes called chi) was moving my body, not the other way around. The energy flowed into the artwork I was creating, which resulted in a way of drawing I labeled Energy Art. The energy comes through these pages as you color them, building and strengthening the energy pathways throughout your body the same way Qigong or Tai Chi does. The more you color, the feeling of peace and stillness you feel during the process will continue even after you finish coloring. To increase the benefits of this coloring book, there are also instructions for a simple Qigong movement you can do before you color. Here are a few of the pages from the book: 

 It’s almost as if the drawings are a visual language only the soul knows. As you flip through this intriguing book, you will notice you are drawn to specific pages for no logical reason. This approach to art has a way of reaching us at a deep level, beyond our logical mind. You will enjoy seeing what drawing leaps out at you and seems to be saying “pick me!” for that coloring session. Select it and get busy diving into the experience of what the drawing has to offer you. Let go of any “rules” about coloring and do what you want to with your colors and method of coloring. You may feel motivated to cut your page into pieces with which you can create a collage. It’s up to you! You will be rewarded with more peace, more creativity, more ability to focus and certainly more fun and joy.

The benefits of this experience are long lasting. After you finish your first coloring page, take a few moments to quietly focus on it. You may find that merely focusing openly will grace you with peaceful feelings. Place it in your work space or somewhere you will see often. Every time you take a break to gaze into it, you will rediscover that feeling. Allow the energy to float to you. After you have completed a number of pages, you will have a selection of images to surround yourself with. Take a few moments and select ones you want to focus on in any given day. They will continue to bring you joy, peace and a feeling of connectedness with your soul.

 
This rich experience of coloring will help you:

Unplug from the stress in your life.
Dive into a closer connection with your soul.
Develop more long-lasting inner peace the more you color.
Enhance your creative exploration and inspiration.
Focus and relax your mind.
Enhance your home or workplace with positive energy.
Have more fun in your day!

Soul Expressions Coloring Book is being created with a lot of heart, energy and some practical things, too:

Perforated pages for easy removal.
Sturdy paper to support heavy coloring with a variety of coloring tools such as colored pencils, gel pens and markers.
76 one-sided images so you don’t have to choose which ones to display or frame.

The finished Book size is 9.5”W x 9”H with 160 perforated, frameable one-sided pages.
 
Timeline:
October 16 - November 18 -- ​Indegogo campaign
November 23 -- Soul Expressions Coloring Book goes to press
Week of December 5 -- Books & most perks shipped (unless another date is specified)

story:
Howdy!

I'm Joshua McDevitt, a photographer, artist, and recent MFA recipient from The University of Iowa. Since graduating, I have moved to Louisiana to be with my partner and received the wonderful opportunity to present my work at Clamp Light Artist Studios and Gallery in San Antonio, TX during the annual Fotoseptiembre USA international photography festival! This will be my very first solo exhibition outside of the institution, and a huge first step for my career as a contemporary artist. I am absolutely thrilled to share my story with the public, but I need some help. I have already spent well over $1000 out of my own pocket to frame and exhibit this work for my thesis exhibition at Iowa and, especially after making a big move, I need all the help I can to get it up on the wall again. 

This exhibition is so important to me as I intend to create a dialogue that will invoke an understanding and empathy for the LGBTQ community through a personal and relatable narrative - as well as reach out to those who may have or are still struggling. It is such an honor to have an invitation from a gallery in Texas, where the LGBTQ community constantly fights for their equal rights.  


Exhibition Statement

Western societal mores come with expectations such as gender roles, heteronormativity, masculinity in boys, and femininity in girls. The way we think about gender has a long list of deeply embedded microaggressions: “don’t be a girl”, “man up”, “she’s a bitch”, “that’s gay”. The list goes on, including less obvious phrases and actions. What exactly do they mean? And upon reflection, how do they confuse an adolescent trying to define their gender or sexuality?


“But I’m nothing, if I can’t be me. If I can’t be true to myself, they don't mean anything.” - K.W.

http://www.joshuamcdevitt.com/Orientation-Unsure


Where are the funds going?

  • One replacement sheet of plexiglass
  • One replacement frame (for a piece that is in a show at another time)
  • Printing and dry-mount for one photograph
  • Dry-mounting for one photograph
  • Gallery Rental Fee
  • Graphic Design Fee
  • Fuel and Lodging for installation, reception, and take down

What's in it for you?

Each donator of $10* or greater will receive a show card in addition to having their name thanked at the exhibition in San Antonio.

Those who donate $30* will receive an editioned Booger Bear (small) letterpress print! (Limited to 15)

A $60* donation will get you a 8" x 8" digitized drawing "Josh&Troy" depicting my partner and I amidst a big gay kiss. (Limited to 10)

For $100* or greater, donators will receive an 11" x 14" archival inkjet print featuring a documentation photograph of one of the installation pieces. (Limited to 5)

*An estimated shipping cost is added for those who claim perks.
(Images in gallery).

ATTENTION: I believe if you want to collect one of these perks, you must click "Get This Perk" from the sidebar. Those who want to donate their own amount will still be thanked at the exhibition if the contribution exceeds $10. (You can only donate the amount for the chosen perk. However, you can donate again if you wish to contribute more). 

Challenges

Getting to the gallery! The opening reception will be held on September 9th. At least half of the expenses for this exhibition consist of gallery fees and the cost of travel, which in this case is much cheaper than shipping the art! 

This exhibition will happen. Your kind donations help reimburse me so that I can eat and pay my bills, because I am not guaranteed to make any money off of my art.


Other Ways You Can Help

Share! Share! Share!

If you cannot contribute to the fund but care about this exhibition, please share this page!

story:
The Global Legal Action Network (GLAN) was set up to challenge connections to human rights abuses overseas through the creative and innovative use of law.

We are an independent not-for-profit that identifies and pursues legal actions. Established in 2015 by a group of human rights academics, practitioners, and investigative journalists with the common aim of finding innovative legal angles to bring about meaningful and measurable change through concrete action.

Today's globalised world too often allows injustice and abuse to occur transnationally, affecting those who have less power. We believe our world is interconnected and we aim to use these transnational connections to challenge such injustice. We are fighting for people's rights globally, not only because we believe passionately that all individuals should live with freedom, safety and equal opportunity, but also because we want to contribute to a more fair and just international society. Any violations of people's fundamental rights affect all of us.

One of the projects we are working on challenges a business that is drilling for oil off indigenous people's land, without consent or consultation, while they remain in refugee camps. This is an important project that your donation could go directly towards supporting. Another developing project addresses the conditions of detention of refugees and asylum seekers in Australian offshore detention centers, by challenging both the government and corporate investors. A third project challenged the accreditation that the Irish College of Surgeons provided to Bahraini hospitals as education facilities, despite their serious mistreatment of doctors and protestors. 

The small amount of money we're looking to raise may cover the costs of field visits, data collection and interviews. This will enable us to gather vital information to make the legal cases using innovative transnational angles, in order to improve the lives of people affected. 

GLAN is currently run solely by volunteers, so all funds raised will go directly to project costs, and truly making a difference to those who suffer violations of the most basic of human rights. We thank you kindly for your support, and please get in touch if you would like to discuss further.

story:
Short Summary

Ravinzangel was founded in 2016 by artist Amanda Bhikha to sell her artwork in traditional and unique ways. She loves to experiment with new innovative ways to showcase her work. Amanda had never imagined, when she had started Ravinzangel, that having her actual artwork on clothing like leggings would ever be possible, but now it is!

This campaign has been created to help fund the creation of two uniquely designed leggings that showcase Amanda's artwork and help Ravinzangel launch it's apparel. This campaign will help provide funding to not only make these leggings but to send it to those who support the campaign. Ravinzangel hopes to make these leggings go beyond the traditional painting on canvas art, and make Amanda's artwork something you can wear. 

What We Need & What You Get

Ravinzangel will need to fund at least $1,500 to start production of our leggings that will be made in Toronto, Ontario. 

Leggings will be $65.00 each plus shipping, after the campaign is over they will be $75 each. So, order through this campaign to get this awesome deal! Once the campaign is over, the leggings will be ordered, even if we don't reach the full goal, they will still be ordered. 

Leggings are made from an 80/20 poly-elastine blend and have an awesome shine to it. 

Sizes that will be available are from XS-XL. 

Size      Waist           Hip           Inseam

XS         25 - 26           35 - 36        27.5

S            27 - 28           37 - 38         27.5

M           29 - 30           39 - 40        27.5

L            31 - 33             41 - 43        27.5

XL         34 - 36            44 - 46        27.5

The Impact

When you contribute to this campaign, you will fueling the start to an artist's dream of having her artwork on something wearable, that isn't just a typical silk-screened shirt. By contributing you will recieve apparel that is unique and support a local artist. 

Risks & Challenges

Before Ravinzangel, Amanda tried to build her dream art business. It did not work because options like putting artwork on clothing (by an independent artist) was not readily and affordably available. BUT, now it is. Amanda love challenges, and does not give up, as soon as she realized it was now possible to have her artwork on apparel, she has been working to make it available. Even if we do not make our goal, these leggings will be produced somehow, but we hope you can still help us meet our goal, and hopefully more. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you cannot contribute to our campaign, we'd love you forever if you are able to share and get the word out about it. Social media can be such a huge help, share it on your Facebook, Twitter, instagram, etc. 

If you could do this, it would be greatly appreciated!

story:
Do you enjoy sculpture? Are you a fan of the work of Houston artists? Make a donation to bring Sculpture Month Houston to reality!​

Sculpture Month Houston is a citywide celebration scheduled to take place between Saturday, October 15 and Saturday, November 19, 2016. The goal of the month is simple: We want to bring attention to the work, creative energies, diverse expressions and shear talent of Houston sculptors.

Houston last celebrated sculpture 16 years ago with Sculpture 2000. In presenting Sculpture Month Houston, organizers Volker Eisele, Sean Rudolph and Antarctica Black (directors and manager of Rudolph Blume Fine Art / ArtScan Gallery), alongside Tommy Gregory (artist and curator of the City of Houston’s Art Collection at the Houston Airport System), look to provide a current survey of the Houston sculpture scene. For Houston residents and visitors alike, the month will offer the perfect opportunity to explore, experience and celebrate a breadth of sculpture rarely seen in the region.

The month is going to be HUUUGE! We currently have more than 35 participating venues including commercial galleries, nonprofit spaces, educational facilities and museums. While participants coordinate their own programming of three-dimensional art, we're also offering four curated exhibitions to highlight a cross-section of Houston sculpture. Invited venues will be showcasing our city’s talented, emerging young sculptors—as well as established ones—in a wide variety of styles and reflective of our city’s diversity.

How You Can Help
Houston, we need your help to bring the month to life! Your donations will 1) bring sculpture to several participating venues throughout Houston, 2) fund Sculpture Month Houston featured artists and 3) cover installation costs.

We have perks for all levels of support and hope you find one that suits you and your donation abilities!

The Impact
We want to further Houston's reputation as an arts mecca and join a succession of existing festivities: FotoFest, PrintMatters Houston and Houston Art Fair. Besides showcasing the incredible work of local talent, we also hope to provide participating venues and artists a needed, income-generating opportunity.

Other Ways You Can Help
Share our Indiegogo campaign and tell Houston about our awesome new citywide celebration - we’d love your support!

For more information and other sponsorship opportunities with Sculpture Month Houston, email SculptureMonthHouston@gmail.com or visit sculpturemonthhouston.com.

story:
Summary

Boomerang Festival is a global indigenous arts & culture event aimed at Aboriginal access for audiences wishing to engage with a quality, unique, true Indigenous experience.

It encompasses dance, weaving, carving, talks & ideas, workshops, music & authentic cultural exchanges between Aboriginal & non-Aboriginal people.

With full support of and in conjunction with Bluesfest Byron Bay's Festival Director, Peter Noble, produced from an Aboriginal perspective by one of Australia’s most accomplished & respected Artistic Directors,  and proud Bundjalung woman, Rhoda Roberts (Sydney Opera House, The Dreaming Festival,  2000 Sydney Olympic Games Opening Ceremony, Garma Festival), Boomerang Festival is programmed with high-quality performance art, featuring masters of craft & cultural leaders from around the globe. 

Boomerang ran successfully in 2013 in Byron Bay, on the Bluesfest site, to widespread audience and critical acclaim. It was nominated for several major arts and tourism awards, and contributed significantly to the local tourism and economic sectors.

However, both arts and Indigenous funding was cut, and forced the indefinite suspension of what was heralded as new way forward in harmonious relations for all Australians, and imperative national healing.

What We Need & What You Get

Without adequate funding, Boomerang must raise funds to grow into the stand alone festival, and a major contributor to the North NSW cultural landscape, tourism and economy, as well as a landmark event for Australia.

NSW has the largest population of Aboriginal Australians than any other state in the country, and less fiscal support than other regions in the country. Ownership & pro-activeness with art & culture is key to empowerment and inclusion in our diverse society.

In order for Boomerang to run effectively in 2016 we need $30,000.

Additional funds will be placed in trust to go towards the future development of Boomerang into an independent, stand-alone festival.

Each package has different features and benefits, with a focus on local and Indigenous experiences so you get a unique, cultural experience in exchange for your support.

This is thanks to donations from local businesses who see the importance & relevance of this landmark event, including:

-  Bluesfest

-  Harvest Café

-  Arakwal Aborignal Corporation

-  The Farm

-  The Three Blue Ducks

-  Clayton Donavon & The Jaaning Tree

-  Australian Good Food Guide

-  The Music

-  Virgin Australia

-  The Byron @ Byron Resort & Spa

- Common Ground Byron Bay

The Impact

Australia Council for the Arts recently reported that:

  • 92% of Australians agree that Indigenous arts are an important part of Australia’s culture
  • 64% of Australians have a strong or growing interest in Indigenous arts
  • 24% of Australians attended Indigenous arts in the previous year

(Source Australia Council for the Arts, 2015)

Boomerang offers the solution to this discrepancy between people interested in engaging, and not knowing how to access Aboriginal culture.

Bluesfest, as one of the most successful and enduring major events in Australia, and Boomerang’s only non-government partner, invites you to join them as leaders in positive change in our local, state, and national cultural landscape.

We invite you to lead the change we want and need to see in our national narrative.

You can be proud to say you took a stand on Australia's relationship with its Indigenous culture, for the betterment for all Australians.

Risks & Challenges

As a progressive and forward-thinking artistic team, Bluesfest & Boomerang festival recognise that we might be ahead of our time. But the importance of the event, and readiness of the community for it is undeniable.

The volatility of the economy and arts industry will affect us, however, with the expertise of astute and revered festival programmers in Peter Noble and Rhoda Roberts, along with their dedicated and experienced teams, we are confident we can hedge against negative impacts.

Our biggest challenge is garnering the support of the people who will benefit from it the most - the Australian public.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Any support you can offer will be warmly and gratefully received. Some options include:
  • You can put the word out through your social media channels
  • Volunteer at the festival
  • Donate products or services
  • Get in touch and discuss your ideas with us - we love to collaborate with all members of the community, far and wide!

Thank you for taking the time to read, and for any assistance you are able to provide.

Rhoda Roberts and Team Boomerang.

Boomerang Festival is a global indigenous
arts & culture event aimed at Aboriginal access for
audiences wishing
to engage
with a
quality, unique, true Indigenous experience. 
It encompasses dance, weaving, carving,
talks & ideas, workshops, music & authentic cultural
exchanges between Aboriginal & non-Aboriginal people.

With full support of and in conjunction with Bluesfest Byron Bay's Festival Director, Peter Noble, produced from an Aboriginal perspective
by one of Australia’s most accomplished & respected Artistic
Directors,  and proud Bundjalung woman,
Rhoda Roberts (Sydney
Opera House, The Dreaming Festival,  2000
Sydney Olympic Games Opening Ceremony, Garma Festival), Boomerang Festival is programmed with
high-quality performance art, featuring masters of craft & cultural leaders
from around the globe.

story:
What we are passionate about:

Red Path Movement teaches Parkour that goes beyond. Currently has a mobile service traveling throughout the West Kootenays and beyond. 



We desire to settle in and create a Parkour gym in Nelson.


We combine Parkour, aspects of Experiential Education and teachings of the Medicine Wheel, where the relentless curiosity and imagination of the physical nature of Parkour and intrapersonal growth come together on the Red Road. We create a space for movement, integrate it with experiential learning through reflection providing an opportunity for integration and self-growth.  

Mel, one of our assistance mentors at Origins in Vancouver. 

In PARKOUR you will:

  •  Learn to manage risk in a healthy and positive way
  • Learn about your limits
  • Engage in a full body workout
  • Think on your feet
  • Develop a can do-it attitude that leads to greater confidence


Another aspect of Red Path Movement is business and team development. Through experiential learning we help guide your business or team to a better understanding of their potential. With EXPERIENTIAL LEARNING we create:

  • A safe environment for exploration
  • An engaging and supportive environment
  • A structure for reflection
  • A space for feedback throughout the process


Red Path Movement utilizes MEDICINE WHEEL TEACHINGS as a framework. Using this as a framework:

  • It breaks away from linear and conventional thinking
  • It deepens self-understanding
  • It encompasses a number of tangible outcomes
  • It teaches inner power


Our Plan:

  • Our plan is to create an amazing Parkour gym for all ages and to inspire each person that passes the threshold of our door, in Nelson British Columbia
  • To build a unique setting for playing and training with body movement in a specifically, and moveable, designed space
  • To mentor Parkour movement, combining it with aspects of Experiential Education and Medicine Wheel teachings
  • To have our mentors create challenging and fun experiences, based on age and developmental levels, in which the student takes initiative, makes decisions and are accountable for results through analysis, reflection and the opportunity to integrate what they learn
  • To create an environment where relentless curiosity and imagination of the physical nature of Parkour, and interpersonal growth come together on the Red Road
  • We link movement with experiential learning, through reflection, providing an opportunity for integration and self-growth 
  • Another aspect of Red Path Movement is team development. Through experiential learning with teams we help guide your team to a better understanding of their potential. We use a variety challenging elements to draw out talents and skills possessed by team members that improve overall team functioning

Through Your Contribution You Help Create: 

  • A uniquely designed facility that can be adapted to children, youth, adults, seniors or any specialized groups which focuses on the whole person
  • A learning space using movement and reflection with aboriginal cultural teachings
  • Opportunities for learning experiences that are guided by a student's unique understanding of the world
  • A vibrantly active class room 
  • An environment where students engage the creative portions of their brains and seek fulfilling solutions to hands-on-tasks
  • A stimulating setting for a sport/activity developing time to reflect in a group on their experiences and learning 
  • A safe zone where mistakes are okay and seen as a valuable part of the learning process
  • A place for an activity that requires practice, problem-solving and decision-making
  • A setting for students to engage in a process that involves emotions and enhances knowledge and skill
  • A situation allowing for skill development, aptitudes and passions that impact choices
  • A venue allowing students to work individually and in groups on aspects of leadership, critical thinking and risk management 
  • And simply a fun place to be

Who are we:

Mateus Dachwitz - Movement Mentor

  • A young entrepreneur with a vision
  • Started coaching Parkour 5 years ago
  • Trained as an experiential educator
  • I began my adventure as a leader for PK Nakusp while in high school, which provided the opportunity to move towards my dreams - providing young coaches with income; bringing Parkour to other communities in the West Kootenays; and building the first Parkour gym, in Nelson
  • Participated in the Rotary Youth Leadership Awards and then became a Junior staffer providing leadership and mentoring for upcoming youth leaders
  • I love moving and jumping around, constantly seeking challenge in life, dancing to loud music when no one is watching, but if you see me, hopefully you'll join in, long bubble baths, sometimes just being a bit weird and nerdy, and walking my sacred hoop
  • I enjoy family time, playing games with a mental challenge - like chess, and playing video games when I need to chill
  • Some of my goals are: owning and operating a Parkour gym; coaching in as many communities in the Kootenays as possible; visiting every continent; and running in a Tough Mudder

Michael Garvey - Movement Mentor

  • First Nations - Cayuga
  • 27 years as a fitness instructor
  • Competitor for 2 years in National Aerobic Championships in mixed pairs
  • 21 years as a family, youth and addictions counsellor
  • Erickson International trained life coach
  • Trained as an experiential educator
  • Started Parkour in Nakusp off the side of my desk as a youth counsellor with an inspired youth 6 years ago
  • Currently proud to be working for the Circle of Indigenous Nations (COINS) under mental health and additions, the aboriginal family services development program and an amazing group of people
  • Other non-Parkour movement related stuff - trained and worked as a baker for 6 years, ran a windmill at Heritage Park in Calgary Alberta many moons ago, was a cabinet maker on an assembly line and a stationary clerk for Alberta Treasury Branch
  • I love to: play with my 3 labs; all kinds of music; home; movement - Parkour specifically; minds that like to explore the inner world; a passion for people with a passion; work with young people to achieve their dreams; take pictures; and stay active in my own personal development, self-discovery and healing

WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GET

What we need:

  • $35,000 – This goes towards:
  • Rent for the first month or two; insurance; lumber and supplies for building of awesome structures and contractors; gym flooring, foam cubes; set up costs such as front desk and supplies; filing cabinet(s); accounting system; tracking systems for clients, payment methods; telephone; computer; printer/fax; first month or two costs for hydro and other basic expenses

What you get for your donations to this project:

  • Our perks range from doing specific vaults at your request and filming it; to shout outs; private lessons; limited t-shirts for supporters; day passes; month(s) passes; 1-2 year membership; life-time membership
  • We have perks available for those residing outside the Nelson area that can be received when we travel to your community 
  • Check out the details of the perks on the right hand side of this page

What happens if we don’t make our goal:

  • If we do not reach our entire goal, we will carry on in a scaled down version or still have a home base in Nelson and use funding to build equipment, get insurance and continue with our current set up using our cube van

A little more on why our project is valuable and worth your contribution

  • Parkour trains the body and brain to communicate more effectively and have coordinated effort in movement as well as everyday tasks; it is a playground for adults and children in which skills you gain in a facility directly relate to life outside the facility; builds quickness, endurance, balance, flexibility; agility, and explosive strength; cultivates self-knowledge, self-trust and self-confidence; challenges you to push past limitation
  • Our desire is have you be just more than active, we want each person who enters our space to thrive beyond our space
  • Our desire is to have your business or team flourish through our experiential learning process. We recognize that in order to advance, an environment needs to be cultivated for prosperity
  • Experiential learning is an opportunity for: creativity and reflection; mistakes to become valuable lessons; improved attitude towards learning;
  • We also desire to make a difference to aboriginal men, or those claiming aboriginal background or following. We presented our approach on behalf of the Circle of Indigenous Nations at a Aboriginal Men’s Healing Conference. It was received well by participants and the Elders. The conference, due to the difficulty accessing funding thus far, was a one-time deal. Red Path Movement wants to contribute to COINS annually to work to maintain this valuable conference and service to men
  • Not only will your contribution add something that is extraordinary in the exquisitely beautiful setting of Nelson, you will help accomplish a multi-dimensional business that is unique to the West Kootenays
  • What makes Red Path Movement a bit unusual is that we are interested in the development of all aspects, based on the medicine wheel, of each person

Our Parkour Story So Far

Some of our original crew and friends including Mr. Dan Iaboni of the Monkey Vault from Toronto. 

2010 – ran off the side of a desk of a youth worker

2011 – Brought in owners of other Parkour facilities to train us – Toronto, Vancouver and Seattle; youth stepped into leadership roles; as leaders graduate other younger leaders step in; youth being taken to Parkour event in Vancouver – meet and train with many from Canada, and US; numerous demos in the community and helping out a community events

2012 – successfully running classes in Nakusp; other programs beginning to come and experience our offerings; youth go to another Parkour event in Vancouver; continuing with community work; began to use debriefing after each class

2013 – Carrying on as in 2012; some of the leaders finding employment teaching Parkour in larger cities; one youth develops dreams of youth leaders receiving pay for teaching classes;

2014 – One youth returns with a dream of becoming bigger; change name from PK Nakusp to Kootenay Parkour and Development; Cube van allows us to travel the valley; establish working relationship with Selkirk College for teaching Parkour classes; help out with Sufferfest kids training; participate in Parkour Visions Classic in Seattle; began to employ Experiential Education into method of classes; hired by CBT for performance and to do an experiential education piece for them at a workshop; Developed relationship with Circle of Indigenous Nations

2015 – Asked to bring Parkour into Aboriginal Men’s Healing Conference – asked to incorporate the Medicine Wheel into what we do; Classes in Nakusp, New Denver, Kaslo/Meadow Creek, Revelstoke, Nelson, Grand Forks, Slocan City; help out again with Sufferfest kids training; begin to consider and then decided to create business; changed name – Red Path Movement; began to add Medicine Wheel teachings to each class; decide to create a project that will have us build a Parkour facility in Nelson

2016 – Spring camp in Revelstoke; summer camp planned for Nelson through Selkirk College; have taken on an enthusiastic youth to mentor; continue as in previous years running programs in the West Kootenays; and develop an Indiegogo project to create Parkour gym in Nelson to open in fall of 2016. 

Risks & Challenges

  • Our main obstacle is funding. Our plan is to carry on no matter what. We currently run out of Nakusp. If we don’t receive enough funding we will have our home base, with our mobile Parkour run out of Nelson. We will add extra equipment based on funding and storage space.
  • Our second main obstacle is finding a location in Nelson. Patience and Nelson connections can be of great assistance in discovering a location
  • We started off the side of a desk of a youth counselor 6 years ago as a dream of a youth. Then, progressing to where we currently are based on another youth’s dream, who has now just entered adulthood, has provided the experience and attitude for the next step. Red Path Movements young adult mentor is supported by aboriginal partner and mentor with numerous years experience in the counseling field, a fitness instructor, life coach and B&B business owner. 

Who has used our services:

  • Columbia Basin Trust 
  • Selkirk College - Nakusp, New Denver, Nelson
  • School District 8, 10 and 20
  • Village of Nakusp
  • Freedom Quest RADD and Project Connect
  • Doukhobor Heritage Retreat Society
  • Circle of Indigenous Nations - Men's Aboriginal Healing Conference
  • Stoke Youth Network & Revelstoke Secondary School supported through Revelstoke Crime Stoppers 
  • City of Revelstoke - Parks Recreation & Culture
  • Slocan After School Sports Initiative 
  • Kaslo/Meadow Creek

Places or Events We've Visited for Parkour:

  • Origins Parkour - Vancouver
  • Parkour Visions - Seattle
  • Monkey Vault - Toronto
  • Breathe Parkour - Calgary

Other Ways You Can Help

Some of you may not be able to Contribute, but you can help in other ways!

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Like us on Facebook and follow us on Twitter and Instagram.
  • Share our campaign with as many of your friends as possible
Thank you all for supporting Red Path Movement!

story:
ULTIMATE GAME opera project by Anna Mikhailova

Do you BELIEVE in OPERA?

Do you believe in FOOTBALL?

Time to act, JOIN!

I’m Anna Mikhailova, composer and theater director, and I choose for both.

Imagine, 3 FOOTBALL TEAMs, an OPERA, and an audience, all together in one place, creating the performance, and YOU can be part of it!

Featuring 8 organs, 8 saxophones, 8 singers and 1 trombone player, forming 3 football team, 3 referee, 1 goal keeper, 2 ball keepers, 4 commentators, 8 gates and 8 substitute players.

It only takes one drop to start a waterfall:

Dear friends,
How are you?
I am still busy creating my latest project - a combination of opera and football, in one multi-disciplinary performance with:
3 teams, 
1 goalkeeper, 
21 balls, 
9 saxophones,
8 organs,
10 voices,
Mother of Jesus, 
Jeanne D’Arc, 
Margaret Thatcher, 
Lucebert-Lucifer, 
Asger Jorn, 
Guy Debord
and you!

As you can imagine, this is quite an undertaking, and although I do not usually ask for help, in this case, I truly believe that this project is worth it. With this in mind, I started a funding campaign for the first time in my life, but because of the lack of support I had to cancel the première (November 2015). So if you could help by supporting me with even a very very small contribution and spreading my message to the world, the opera can be realised. 

Thank you very much for your time.

It only takes one drop to start a waterfall

And here is the backstage of my project.

Where is the story in football and where is the game in opera

WHAT is it? It has always been an OPERA, holding her BREATH in the corner of our universe. The XXIst century is the time for her to rise, to free her from her shell, and to let her meet an attractive, physical and playful football game.

Of course, my goal is not to make a performance of football players running around while singing Wagner. I am developing the elements of the football and opera to integrate them more deeply, so they will reinforce one another. Opera should learn from football how to inspire the happy intensity of feeling that you are present, as you watch teams playing with the ball. I am curious to see how football ACTIVITY can grow within the RULES OF OPERA.

It is about TRADITION and TRANSFORMATION.

It is about YOUR OWN EXPERIENCE and everyone else.

It is always about UNIVERSAL versus PERSONAL, as we know without a team there is no football, but what is football without a ball and opera without the voice?

WHO is the HERO of opera today?

ULTIMATE GAME is part of a sequence of operas, on which I have worked for the last five years, inspired by the lives and thoughts of the Situationists. Searching for the hero and the story of my NEW OPERA PROJEC five years ago, I came across the art and works of this group of artists and thinkers Situationists International, a movement of the 50s, 60 and 70s, associated with ideas like the New Babylon Project, the Dérive and the Society of the Spectacle.

Through their international approach, through working directly within everyday life and not only with paintings and performances, but through an extensive body of theoretical writing, they have influenced the reality we live in today.

Our WORLD, whether we want it or not, was CREATEd by the generation of our grandfathers and grandmothers. The Situationists International were most known for envisioning a revolutionary new world, beyond the restrictions of everyday life in capitalism, a world in which work would be given to machines and life would be an adventure.

They are of the generation of my grandparents. Real people, with their own life experience, not scientifically proven molecules or elves from a fantasy world, far apart from our reality. No, they were real, they thought and wrote for real, they were trying to work their way through/out of the reality they found themselves in. That is inspiring. My work explores how their thoughts remain fertile for us, today, more than six decades after 1950s. Can we today still think a better world to live in?

I do BELIEVE that opera can be more than a museum and period drama sung bell canto, and with every opera I make, I challenge myself to find new activities and areas for expressing this idea.

In order to renew itself for our society, OPERA needs the SITUATION, which will bring the NEW EXPERIENCE, in which you are not expected to know everything in advance, but free to experience the MOMENT through active PRESENCE.

In my earlier operas of this project, looking for paradigms and new modern heroes and stories, I came across Frankenstein, Spiderman and Prometheus, the power of Advertisement and the Alchemy of the creative process. For that reason every layer of my opera project consists not only of an opera performance, but as well contains additional sound/visual/mind experience with installations, performances, flashmobs, books, new media and other dimensions.

During my research I discovered that one of the members, the artist and philosopher, Asger Jorn came up with the idea of THREE SIDED FOOTBALL

I started to think, what if the OPERA is not based on a STORY, but on a structure, and that structure would be a GAME, and that game would be FOOTBALL, and specifically, football with 3 fields and 3 teams! So now I am exited to SHARE with you my ULTIMATE GAME opera project, where elements of football and opera meet each other.

ABOUT ME

I have been doing music since I was 6 years old and I love to speak this language. After graduating from the Rotterdam University of Arts (Codarts) as a theater director (2013), from Den Haag Royal Conservatory as a composer and sonologist (2011), from Moscow conservatory (2007) as a composer, organ player and koto player, after working with impro, jazz, pop, rock musician, with dancers, after going on expeditions to collect folk songs, after writing music for movies, animations, theater and computer games, after moving from on place to another, after working on several operas, performances, installations, which gave me an amazing experience of the team work and collaboration; playing in different bands, as techno, pop, impro, jazz, rock, industrial, experimental, I found out, that for me is more and more important not only to express myself through music, but to find a new way to show the audience they personal reasons to be, while listening the language of music, experiencing the magic of theatre. I discovered that my roots began to call me back and that my childhood dreams of what is all about raised themselves up again, and I could only follow them. I began to approach music again from zero.

I keep learning it, and during last 10 years, I have been actively researching the possibilities of the human VOICE, the human BODY, creating LANGUAGE and translating it into performance space, merged in the WORLD OF OPERA. I truly believe that LANGUAGE OF the OPERA can speak and live, touch us and expand meaning in 21-century music theatre.

I have had much experience playing football, being young and giving fully myself to the game, following the ball, feeling present, passing it to your partner, achieving the GOAL with your TEAM and right now I am looking forward to find a dynamic point, the power point/ the power ball, which would bring opera to its NEW APPEARANCE.

Following these links you can check out some of my previous opera projects:

Michèle Frankenstein opera

where I explore the world of Guy Debord and place him in the role of presidential candidate, participating in an election, and being cut in half by his wife


The Michele Frankenstein opera's satellite  included a set of installations, inspired by Constant’s New Babylon

Constant Tranzit opera

I present the world of Dutch artist, painter and utopian architect Constant Nieuwenhuys, with the branding of Spider man/ Prometheus


Psychogeography opera 

where I explore the power of the words and how the world is being changed through the weight of advertising 


with the satellite of Psychogeography opera Games of New Babylon, orchestra flashmob, written especially for the Ricciotti ensemble, I used the slogans of XXth century revolutions and explored the role of the words within the space games.

WHAT I NEED

I am looking for the money to support my creative team

Singers:

Steven van Gijls,  Fanny Alofs, Arnout Lems, Ana Naqe, Elisenda Pujals, Merlijn Runia, Michaela Riener

and Performers:

Paolo Yao (dancer), Joost Geevers, Stefan de Wijs, Evgeni Novikov, Michal Grycko, Juan Dominiquez, Renato Ferreira, Ada Rave, Samuel Vriezen, Philipp Ernsting, Johanna Hessenberg, Bera Romairone

Instrument Designers

Nanda and Leon, Paul Beekhuizen, Frank Niessen, Pim Piët, Anna Mikhailova

Costume Designer

Daphne Karstens

I do need your help in SUPPORT of an intense rehearsal and preparation period, which involves production costs, including costs for collecting equipment, finalizing the instruments, made especially for the occasion of this opera and based on the organ and the bagpipe, arranging a fee for performers who are going to study, learn and perform the multiple scores of text, notes and movements for you to feel how football can meet opera.

And since it is going to take place in several locations of Amsterdam, Rotterdam, Utrecht and Rotterdam, I would like to ask you to SHARE my message with everyone you think who BELIEVEs in opera and in my music.

This project is a unique continuation of the tradition of the sound walks or wonder walks of the situationists, and I’d like to invite you to JOIN my journey of discovery. 

OPERA BOOK
 

For contributing to my project, I will share with you a very special and personally made unique art work. (I do not believe in 10 euro for a kiss.[standart perks procedure])

For each of YOU who BELIEVEs in OPERA, in my project and WILLing to SUPPORT it, I am preparing something very SPECIAL and exciting, something what I would like to appear as a part of the opera experience – a NEW MEDIUM – a unique, personal, YOUR OWN experience of the opera, that you TAKE WITH YOU after the show and which will contain part of the opera within it.

I call it an OPERABOOK.

I shared this idea with a few artist friends, whose art I find inspiring and close to the field I am working in and they agree to collaborate with me on it and I am glad to share with you some of their names:

Samuel Vriezen, Arefeh Riahi, Pim Piet, Amy Wu, Cissie Fu

Each OPERABOOK will be a unique work of art in itself, having elements of opera, book, performance, story, situation, sonic experience and made to be a NEW MEDIUM, a KEY to open the world of opera FOR YOU,

LOVE

ANNA

story:
What is Fidgetting? What is a Fidget Toy?

 

Fidgeting, also known as restlessness or wiggling nervously, is the act of moving restlessly. This can be the result of nervousness, agitation, boredom or a combination of these states. Fidgeting may involve playing with your fingers, hair, or clothing items.

 

A common act of restlessness is to bounce a leg repeatedly, as well as to touch a ring, or rotate and rotate along a table incessantly. It is often considered to move continuously as a bad habit, especially in schoolchildren.

 

Fidgeting is generally considered a nervous habit, often related to the lack of discipline and self-control, although a number of underlying benefits have recently been found. People who regularly struggle tend to weigh less than people who do not fret because they burn more calories than those who are still. It has been reported that it also burns about 350 extra calories a day.

 

At the same time, research by Dr. Karen Pine and her colleagues at the University of Hertfordshire found out that children who were allowed to move with their hands performed better in memory and learning tests.

 

That is why, and for a long time, there are toys that are used to channel these seemingly uncontrollable energies. A Fidget Toy is not a mere anti-stress game picked up at a fair or a random object with which you might be fiddling long during a meeting or work session.

 

For the purpose of distraction? To evade responsibility? Not at all. It has been scientifically proven to focus that “restless” part of the mind in a relatively easy task. Simply manipulate an articulated object to help increase overall concentration, which can also be fun.

 

Besides, Fidget Toy is a generally small object (preferably one that fits in the hand), which can be squeezed, pulled or moved in some way. Fidget Toys come in all shapes, sizes and textures for all tastes. Objects such as stress balls, tangled elastics and others can be used as Fidget Toy to promote movement and tactile input that is critical for the learning of some students and many adults.

Fidget Toys are affordable, easily understandable and attractive to all ages and genres. That is why there is the Snake Cube, a Fidget Toy. The same that us, Cuboid Fever, want to help to improve.

Benefits of Fidget Toys

 

However, how can we help each person to control their movements and actually improve their concentration and learning? A Fidget Toy could not be the obvious choice.


Understandably, a Fidget Toy could quickly become a distraction for many so it is important to set clear boundaries regarding the use of these in the classroom or work sessions. But, Fidget Toys have been shown to be useful self-regulating tools that help concentration, attention, calmness and active listening.


Research on Fidget Toys shows that if the person's constant movement can be directed, learning can be improved since movement is essential for learning because it allows the individual to use both left and right hemispheres of the brain.


In addition to other research confirming the importance of movement and sensory input while learning, learning is enhanced when movements are introduced, as documented through case studies and a comprehensive understanding of human cognition and learning of the students.


In a video on Child Development, two boys around the age of 12 were placed in two different classrooms with headphones, listening to a lecture on brain development. One of the boys was told to sit still and just listen to the lecture.

 

The other boy also had to listen to the same lecture, but he was allowed to hold, squeeze and bounce a tennis ball at the same time. In the end, each child was asked to remember some key points of the conference.


Surprisingly, the amount of knowledge the boy allowed to "move" could get from the conference was greater in comparison to the other boy who was told to stay still.


Evidently, there could have been other factors that contributed to the different amounts of information these guys could remember, but it was quite apparent that being able to engage both the mind and the body simultaneously made a big difference.



What is a Snake Cube and what we offer

 

Obviously, the Snake Cube is a Fidget Toy: small, affordable, easily understandable and attractive to all ages and genres. Also known as Hamiltonian Cube, it is an old craft mechanical puzzle, often made of wood. It consist of a chain of 27 little cubes, connected by an elastic band running through them. The little cubes can rotate freely and the aim of the play is to arrange the chain in such a way that they will form 3 x 3 x 3 cube.

 

Traditionally, the Snake Cube is usually made following the same old combination of small cubes. In fact, who already knows the solution will not discover in a regular Snake Cube any new challenge.


That is why Cuboid Fever presents new combinations of the Snake Cube, at a fair price and in an attractive display. That is: new fun challenges that you can afford and take to your home, workplace, holidays or wherever you want.

 

The Rewards

 

 

 

 

US$ 5.00 or more Thank you

We really appreciate your contribution. Many thanks!!!!!

 

 

US$ 13.00 or more Interesting

 

You will get a challenging 3x3x4 cuboid.

US$ 17.00 or more Inspiring

 

You will get a set of two 3x3x3 cubes of different combinations.

 

 

US$ 20.00 or more Fascinating

You will get a set of two 3x3x4 cuboid of different combinations.

 

 

US$ 23.00 or more Captivating

You will get a set of two 3x3x3 cubes and a  3x3x4 cuboid of different combinations.

 

 

 

US$ 27.00 or more Exciting

 

You will get a set of four 3x3x3 cubes of different combinations.

US$ 30.00 or more Puzzling

 

You will get a set of two 3x3x3 cubes and two 3x3x4 cuboids of different combinations.

 

 

US$ 33.00 Amazing

 

You will get a set of four 3x3x3 cubes and a 3x3x4 cuboid of different combinations.

 

 

US$ 37.00 Astonishing

 

You will get a set of six 3x3x3 cubes of different combinations.

 

US$ 40.00 Challenging

 

 

 

You will get a set of four 3x3x3 cubes and two 3x3x4 cuboids of different combinations.

 

US$ 43.00 Wonderful

 

 

You will get a set of four 3x3x3 cubes and two 3x3x4 cuboids of different combinations.

 

 

US$ 47.00 Marvelous

 

 

 

You will get a set of eight 3x3x3 cubes of different combinations.

 

US$ 50.00 Remarkable

 

You will get a set of six 3x3x3 cubes and two 3x3x4 cuboids of different combinations.

 

US$ 53.00 Notable

 

You will get a set of eight 3x3x3 cubes and a 3x3x4 cuboid of different combinations.

US$ 60.00 Incredible

 

You will get a set of eight 3x3x3 cubes and two 3x3x4 cuboids of different combinations.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

The Team

 

 

Luis Felipe: Manager

 

 

 

 

Jean Paul: Mathematician Genius

Luz: Art Designer
