Obviously, the Snake Cube is a Fidget Toy: small, affordable, easily understandable and attractive to all ages and genres. Also known as Hamiltonian Cube, it is an old craft mechanical puzzle, often made of wood. It consist of a chain of 27 little cubes, connected by an elastic band running through them. The little cubes can rotate freely and the aim of the play is to arrange the chain in such a way that they will form 3 x 3 x 3 cube.
 
Traditionally, the Snake Cube is usually made following the same old combination of small cubes. In fact, who already knows the solution will not discover in a regular Snake Cube any new challenge.
That is why Cuboid Fever presents new combinations of the Snake Cube, at a fair price and in an attractive display. That is: new fun challenges that you can afford and take to your home, workplace, holidays or wherever you want.
 
The Rewards
 
 
 
 
US$ 5.00 or more Thank you
We really appreciate your contribution. Many thanks!!!!!
 

 
US$ 13.00 or more Interesting
 
You will get a challenging 3x3x4 cuboid.

US$ 17.00 or more Inspiring
 
You will get a set of two 3x3x3 cubes of different combinations.

 
 
US$ 20.00 or more Fascinating
You will get a set of two 3x3x4 cuboid of different combinations.

 
 
US$ 23.00 or more Captivating
You will get a set of two 3x3x3 cubes and a  3x3x4 cuboid of different combinations.

 
 
 
US$ 27.00 or more Exciting
 
You will get a set of four 3x3x3 cubes of different combinations.

US$ 30.00 or more Puzzling
 
You will get a set of two 3x3x3 cubes and two 3x3x4 cuboids of different combinations.

 
 
US$ 33.00 Amazing
 
You will get a set of four 3x3x3 cubes and a 3x3x4 cuboid of different combinations.

 
 
US$ 37.00 Astonishing
 
You will get a set of six 3x3x3 cubes of different combinations.

 
US$ 40.00 Challenging
 
 
 
You will get a set of four 3x3x3 cubes and two 3x3x4 cuboids of different combinations.

 
US$ 43.00 Wonderful
 
 
You will get a set of four 3x3x3 cubes and two 3x3x4 cuboids of different combinations.

 
 
US$ 47.00 Marvelous
 
 
 
You will get a set of eight 3x3x3 cubes of different combinations.

 
US$ 50.00 Remarkable
 
You will get a set of six 3x3x3 cubes and two 3x3x4 cuboids of different combinations.

 
US$ 53.00 Notable
 
You will get a set of eight 3x3x3 cubes and a 3x3x4 cuboid of different combinations.

US$ 60.00 Incredible
 
You will get a set of eight 3x3x3 cubes and two 3x3x4 cuboids of different combinations.
 
 
   
 
 
The Team
 
 
Luis Felipe: Manager

 
 
 
 
Jean Paul: Mathematician Genius

Luz: Art Designer

story:
Don't forget to check the UPDATES tab for the latest news about our campaign!  

June 25th, 2017.

Just posted, video of the viewer mechanism in action.

 

 

CHECK OUT OUR PRELIMINARY 3D RENDERINGS OF THE PANORAMA AND VIEWERS - GO TO OUR MOST RECENT UPDATE!

    

 

Other recent updates:

- The Puddletown Panorama becomes more accessible to folks with mobility challenges!

 

- New limited, exclusive perk - your name on the Puddletown!

Short Summary

My name is J. Claire Dean and I have been fascinated by stereocards since I was a kid (you know, those funny, curved cards with a pair of apparently identical photographs pasted to them, but when looked at through the right kind of viewer, you can see them in 3d). In 2004 I bought my first vintage stereo-camera and I have been dabbling in the art of created stereo-imagery ever since.  

For some time I have wanted to build a mobile, public exhibit space for stereo- (or 3d) photography. To bring the artwork of photographers, past and present, who shoot in 3d to a greater audience. Eventually I developed the idea of the Puddletown Panorama – a multi-station viewing device, inspired by antique stereoviewers and using the format of the stereocard. 

A general overview of  our scale model of the Puddletown Panorama and its custom tow vehicle, the Puddletown Puller. "Puddletown" is one of Portland, Oregon's many nicknames, and it seemed to suit this project which is being built in  it's namesake city. 

Up to five people at a time will be able to view unique sets of 3d images in the form of stereocards  at each of the stations. The subject matter will vary, depending on venue and the type of event.  I have received overwhelming interest from fellow stereophotographers who have already started sending me their images for inclusion in the Puddletown’s collection of cards. This is not a short term project; I intend to grow this venture into the future as our library of images expands, and word spreads of our willingness to bring stereophotography to your community. Now we just need to get it built and on the road. 

The entire Puddletown Panorama, in a livery of British racing green with cream and gold trim, has the look of an early 20th cent. circus, or carnival, sideshow with Victorian remnants peeking out around the edges. Illuminated by both LED lighting and gas lanterns, the Puddletown Panorama is decorated with fancy metal work, gilding, hand painted artwork and lettering, the entire piece forming an  intimate space, itself a demonstration of art and craftsmanship in the service of a special type of photography.

The drum-like device in the center of the photograph is the multi-station, stereocard viewer, the "Panorama". Behind each pair of eye pieces is a sterocard viewer loaded with its own unique set of  3d cards.  Having viewed one set,  you rotate the drum until  the next pair of eye pieces is in front of you, at which point a whole new set of cards is ready to be explored behind those lenses.

 

This is the Puddletown Puller, our custom tow vehicle designed to move the Panorama and its crew  around within larger events.  When travelling to and from venues, the Puller rides on the main platform - the exhibit space - along with everything else packed around it.  The main platform serves a dual purpose; towed by a pickup truck, it is the main transportation trailer for the project,  and once at an event it transforms into the exhibition space featuring the Panorama. 

 

Our build group comprises a mix of skilled, experienced artists, makers and craftsmen and          -women, as well as  eager newcomers, all volunteering their time and expertise. Most of us have experience building other community projects and take great satisfaction in sharing our skills with others, inspiring them to discover their hidden talents and creativity.  Your support will allow us to not only build something for everyone to enjoy, but to continue sharing our abilities and encouraging others to discover their own.

You can find out much more about the origins of this project and specific details of the Puddletown Panorama through our website at http://www.puddletownpanorama.com/ and our FaceBook page https://www.facebook.com/groups/1141875622600288/   You will also find a much longer video, explaining the physical details of the Panorama in great depth,  at https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vejxbpq7-BA.

 

What We Need & What You Get

This is the first of two planned fundraising campaigns.  Why two?  Well, we would like to get started with our project as soon as possible and so we need seed money for supplies and materials to get us underway.  That is what this first $5,000 campaign aims to accomplish.

Our current budget for building the Puddletown Panorama is $15,000.  With $18,000 we can make the lighting more extensive and sophisticated, and include our custom tow vehicle, (the “Puddletown Puller”) in the overall build.  Right now we are working on reducing our final costs as much as possible by searching for donations of materials and services.  In the meantime we could be starting to build, so we are asking you to help get us off the ground by contributing to this initial campaign.  

To recognize your belief in our project by donating so early, we have created the title “Puddletown Philanthropist”,  which will be gratefully bestowed on anyone who supports this first campaign.  Among this campaign’s rewards (see the list to the right) are exclusive Philianthropist  patches and hoodies that will only be available during this fundraiser. 

We are also reserving this title for our build crew, the photographers who donate their artwork, and donors of materials and services, so you will be joining an extraordinary group of supporters.   On top of that you will receive our endless gratitude. 

Reaching this first goal is important, but any level of funding we achieve will help us get started.

THE PERKS:

  • FOR ALL CONTRIBUTIONS TO THIS CAMPAIGN: Your name added to the list of Puddletown Philanthropists that will be posted on our website and proclaimed at our inaugural outing to Burning Man, 2017.

 

  • FOR $5: Thanks, gratitude and appreciation.  Every penny counts, as they say, and we believe this wholeheartedly.  Every click of the Panorama as it turns, will be a shout out to you.

 

  • FOR $10: The Puddle Town Panorama sticker. A full colour rendition of our logo, printed on a sticker  so that you can proclaim your support anywhere you choose to place it.

The Puddletown Panorama insignia, as it will appear on our stickers.

 

  • FOR $25: A stereo-postcard of the Puddletown Panorama model, complete with instructions on how to “free view” stereo images. Yes, you can view stereopairs without the need for a viewer, so with these instructions, a sample image and a little practice, you too can become an expert freeviewer.

The secrets to free viewing!  Well, you didn't expect us to put the actual text here, did you?  Claim this perk, and all will be revealed.

 

  • FOR $45, EXCLUSIVE TO THIS CAMPAIGN!: The Puddletown Philanthropist embroidered patch. Our exclusive Philanthropist patch, available only to our crew, stereophotographers and donors of materials and services, is being offered to contributors at this level during this campaign only.  This is your chance to obtain one of these gems for your collection.

Our exclusive Philanthropist embroidered patch, sporting its metallic gold highlights that set it apart from the rest of the crowd.

 

  • FOR $75: Enamel camp mug. Carrying the Puddletown Panorama insignia, this smart mug is both practical and eye-catching. (Note: colour of mug and imprint may vary slightly from that shown).

Perfect for that morning cup of tea or coffee!

 

  • FOR $110: Set of three handmade stereocards with folding viewer.  These three cards are of stereophotographs taken by J. Claire Dean, the proprietor of the Puddletown Panorama. They will be part of the permanent Puddletown library and this is a chance for you to get your very own copies, with a viewer - just in case you didn't manage to master the art of free viewing. (Note: views may vary from those shown here.)

 

  • FOR $150, EXCLUSIVE TO THIS CAMPAIGN!: The Puddletown Philanthropist hoodie. This is our exclusive Philanthropist’s black cotton hoodie. It has a full length front zipper and the  back is printed with our special Philanthropist insignia in dark green, dark red, cream and metallic gold. Very smart!

 

Our hoodie is available in a full range of sizes from S - XXXL

  • For $250, limited chance, your name on the Puddletown.  Let your name help light our way!  Your name etched or engraved on the decorated reflector of one of the Puddletown Panorama’s lantern posts. This perk is limited to 8 chances (6 lanterns on the Panorama platform, 2 on the Puddletown Puller). We will send you a photograph of your name on the Puddletown Panorama as a memento (along with a sticker or two) and of course, our endless thanks.

Your name permanently etched or engraved on one of the eight  lantern reflectors. (The exact design may vary from the concept sketch , above)

 

Why support us?

Let’s face it – there will never be enough ways to bring art and creativity to the world.  You will be backing a winner. The crew building the Puddletown Panorama are no strangers to creating unusual and interactive art works.  Helping us build the Puddletown Panorama will be one way you can bring a little more fun and wonder to a broad, public audience, while at the same time supporting numerous artists by providing a new space in which to show their work, all while also enabling us to share our building skills.  This can only result in inspiring creativity in others.  Not a bad return for your donation.

 

Risks & Challenges

Any crowdfunding campaign is a challenge, taxing one’s time and patience alike, however, I have been involved in several successful ones in the past, including two of my own (both Kickstarter campaigns that were funded beyond their goals). I am fully aware of the risks and challenges they pose and I am prepared to guide yet another.

My professional life is within the arts and museum world as a self-employed art conservator, running a small business for over 20 years. Organizing, managing, building and completing exhibitions and similar projects is part of my life.  The Puddletown Panorama is another exhibit space – only this one is particularly close to my heart.

I am surrounded by a crew of like-minded and experienced people and so I feel that our main risk is simply not raising the necessary funds.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute financially, we understand.  Maybe you can help us by donating tools, materials or time (especially if you are in the Portland area), so get in touch.  

Spreading the word about our project, especially through social media, is one of the best ways to lend your support – especially during this campaign.  Please share this project with as many of your friends and family as you can – the Indiegogo share tools make this really easy!  That’s how crowdfunding works. That’s a powerful gift for our project. Thank you.

story:
Short Summary

Hi! My name is Kaden Sinclair and I am representing a whole community of builders, artists, and technical experts. Our group, the Idaho Burners Alliance (a 501c3 nonprofit) is hoping for your support in building something amazing. Donate to this project and we can send you a charitable contribution receipt for your taxes! 

The campaign to help build MesmerElda is the build costs for phase 1 of the project. The first phase will be to build the rings and lighting. The second phase will be to build the viewing platform and stairs. With these funds, we can proceed with hiring a metal bending service to provide us with the materials needed to build the rings.

By helping with this project, you are entering into the community responsible for building it. That means your help combines with others to create the entirety of the project. No one person will build this. It will be built because of community support, like yours.

What We Need & What You Get

The entire project is projected to cost about $58,000 for Phase 1. Don’t wince! There’s good news. With in-kind donations, we have brought the cost down to $27,000. 

With the funds you so generously put forth, we will be buying materials. All rental of the shop, all labor, all consulting (architectural and structural), all programming, soldering, and light design are entirely volunteer driven. The materials we will purchase will be metal, LED’s, computers and power for the LED’s, and various tools and parts and pieces. Because the upper platform will be a separate phase, we are targeting to complete just the rings (upper and lower).

Aside from just the coolness factor of saying you were involved, we also intend to get t-shirts and mugs out to our contributors (with the MesmerElda project image on them).

Large donors ($1000 or more) will receive a 3d print of the original structure for your very own!  

 

The Impact

 

Aside from the amazing spectacle of structure and lights, this project will provide an entire community with a way to create and be proud of their work. The benefits to a community are vast. Depression, feelings of isolation or lack of purpose, and even just wishing to be a part of something outside of the daily norm all come into play. The act of creating is an anodyne. Any person helping to create this art work can pull up an image of it and proudly say “I helped. Because of me and others like me, this project came to life”.

In addition to displaying for the week of Burning Man, with a journey to the playa for multiple years, this project will have a permanent home as public art in Boise Idaho and anyone in the city will see this project and be able to play with the lighting, creating unique patterns. It will also be available on webcam. It is designed to be moved and thus can be present for many years at the burn, along with touring. 

What if you don't get your requested funding?

Easy! We take what you have given us and build part of MesmerElda. If she gets 40% built, we will work toward other campaigns and fundraisers and apply for other grants and build the rest! It seems like a lot to ask to build an art project, but it's really not. When you reach out to thousands of people, the smallest contributions add up fast. Spread the word!

Previous work

To give you an idea of how we actually complete stuff, because hey...it's important to know this will become a reality, you can view our previous projects at the following sites. 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VlaPkz5Tr9k

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=L2zKtHmkaz8

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Just passing the word helps a great deal. 100 people giving $5 means $500. A thousand people means $5000. So get the word out there! Small amounts add up to great things when enough people come together.

We are also a full 501c3 nonprofit. That means we can accept material donations. So, if someone or some business wishes to provide us with metal, plexiglass, LED’s, tools, or computer systems in order to run the lights, then we can give them a receipt for their donation!

Previous work
To give you an idea of how we actually complete stuff, because hey...it's important to know this will become a reality, you can view our previous projects at the following sites. 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VlaPkz5Tr9k
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=L2zKtHmkaz8
 
Other Ways You Can Help
Just passing the word helps a great deal. 100 people giving $5 means $500. A thousand people means $5000. So get the word out there! Small amounts add up to great things when enough people come together.
We are also a full 501c3 nonprofit. That means we can accept material donations. So, if someone or some business wishes to provide us with metal, plexiglass, LED’s, tools, or computer systems in order to run the lights, then we can give them a receipt for their donation!

story:
In 2010, Mark Marku was convicted and sentenced to 18 years imprisonment in Crete along with his younger brother, Andreas, and three other men, for a series of armed robberies and car thefts although he has always maintained his innocence.

For several years, the Irish Innocence Project at Griffith College has been assisting Mark’s defence team and his wife, Julie, in reviewing his case, investigating leads, gathering evidence, and obtaining expert testimony from renowned DNA expert, Dr Greg Hampikian, and an eye-witness identification expert. 

Here is where you can help us!

The Project is hoping to send a delegation of students and staff from the Irish Innocence Project who have worked on Mark’s case to Greece for the appeal to provide support for Mark, as well as his family.

Our crowd funding campaign is hoping to raise €1,000 to underwrite the costs of the trip and support the operational costs of the Irish Innocence Project at Griffith College. Even a small donation can make a great impact to help with our work. We just have two weeks to achieve our goal so we hope you will consider pressing the donate button!

Mark Marku deserves justice.

You can be the key to set an innocent free.

WHO WE ARE

The Irish Innocence Project was founded in 2009 at Griffith College in Dublin by the Dean of Law, David Langwallner. We are a non-profit organisation providing free  services to people who claim to have been wrongfully convicted of crimes.

The first Innocence Project was set up in 1992 by Barry Scheck and Peter Neufield, which has grown into the Innocence Network with 68 recognized members in the United States and around the globe, with the Irish Innocence Project being one of them. We are also one of the two projects that take on both law and journalism students as part of the program.

The Irish Innocence Project and the Italy Innocence Project co-direct the newly launched European Innocence Network, which will validate new, existing, and developing projects.

How does someone get convicted of a crime they did not commit?   

· Faulty or overstated scientific evidence  

· Bad eye-witness identification  

· Poor investigations  

· Police or  prosecutorial misconduct 

· False confessions

· Informant testimony

· Ineffective assistance of counsel

It is also important to bear in mind human error, as, unfortunately, sometimes people make mistakes. Although it is impossible to know for certain, researchers suggest that between 2.3 - 5% of all convictions are of innocent people. If you would like to know more about how wrongful convictions happen, please have a look at our YouTube channel. 

For more information please visit:

Irish Innocence Project Website       Facebook       Twitter    

For our campaign:

Facebook          Twitter          Instagram          YouTube

story:
Previous Campaign

We launched a funding campaign through this platform last year and we only raised $572  through your support, which was remitted to our account promptly by Indiegogo. We received $491.24 after the following deductions: 5% Indiegogo platform fee + 3% Credit Card Charge + $25 Wire Charge

+ $10 In-flow Charge by local bank.

$572

5%+3% = 8% X 572 = 45.76

25+10 = 35

:. 572 - (45.76 +35) = 491.24

We have started construction at the space with the previous fund and individual support. Also, our website is now up and running. We seek your support once more to make this project a reality, not fantasy.

This is our last chance of crowdfunding for this project. We need your support to reach our funding target this time. Be assured that your support will create a new platform for young and endearing artists in Lagos and Nigeria at large.


Design by Jeanne Schultz Design Studio

http://www.jeanneschultz.com/architecture

VERNACULAR ART LABORATORY IS AN INTERDISCIPLINARY ART SPACE FOR CONTEMPORARY ARTISTS IN AFRICA AND INTERNATIONAL ARTISTS

Vernacular Art Laboratory – (VAL, Lagos) is a non-profit artist initiative, founded in 2015 in Lagos as a catalyst art space where artists cohabit to exchange ideas and co-create works with uncommon flair. As a non-commercial art space, the collaboration of contemporary artists with literary artists is our main focus.

Our space is located in one of the biggest slums in Lagos - Onisemo Village, Sogunro community in Iwaya, which shares its border with Makoko Community on the Waterfront that overlooks the 3rd Mainland Bridge. Our educational plans includes art programmes for youths, artist seminars, workshops, and community partnerships with schools as well as collaborations with other arts organisations both in Nigeria and abroad. 

THE SPACE IS A PIECE OF LAND: 30 FEET BY 60 FEET = 9. 144 METERS BY 18.288 METERS

The space is presently being cleared for construction work to begin. We anticipate commencement of projects and programmes hopefully in December 2016, but we can only achieve this with your support.


Your generous contribution will be used to pay for materials and labour to:

Build a storey wooding-structure and storage areas
Build a Standard Gallery Space 
Build an Audio-Visual Studio space (without equipment)
Build conducive rooms for our Artist In Residence projects
Build a moderate Library
Build walls to enclose the working area.
Build our Website
Add soundproofing to work areas.


DO WE STILL EXPECT YOU TO DONATE EVEN AFTER WE REACH OUR $15,000 TARGET?

SURE!  It will help to buy equipment and other materials needed for the centre. The fund we seek here can only see us through the building of Vernacular Art Laboratory. We also have plans for two major digital studios: Sound Studio and Video Studio. We also plan to have an Audio-Visual Library. Sure, any extra support on the top of our campaign will help us a great deal.

Design by Jeanne Schultz Design Studio

http://www.jeanneschultz.com/architecture

Preface:  The Perks

We urge you to choose the most appropriate perk for your support for this interdisciplinary art project space. We acknowledge that it may be a little confusing if you want two rewards in a perk at the same time. Just to let you know, you can choose more than one perk to increase your support and your rewards as well. We thank you in advance for your contribution towards making Vernacular Art Laboratory a reality, not a fantasy.

YOU WANT TO HELP OUR CAUSE BUT ARE NOT FINANCIALLY BUOYANT AND YOU CARE TO HELP?

Please help SPREAD our news!  Post on your Facebook, Tweet about it, or take a picture and post it on your Instagram page. The more individual donors we get, the more likely it is Indiegogo will publicize our campaign...which will lead to a bigger audience and more money-- so even a five dollar donation will help us! Also, you can create a signpost and stand on a street corner and be a sign spinner.  Your support is appreciated!

story:
What is ENIGMA?

My name is Megan Rae and I am a Visual Artist and the founder of OBSCURED Magazine and ENIGMA: An Underground Arts and Culture Event.

I was born and raised in Hamilton, Ontario and received my Arts Education at Sheridan College graduating with an Advanced Diploma in Visual and Creative Arts. I am a surrealist illustrative painter working primarily in Acrylics, but my real passion lies in event planning and curating group exhibitions! Thus OBSCURED Magazine and ENIGMA were born.

Cover Artwork: Bryan Navasero

ENIGMA is an annual underground arts and culture event presented by OBSCURED Magazine. The event features underground visual artists and performers working in all mediums including but not limited to painting, sculpture, mixed media, photography, aerial arts, dance, fashion, music and makeup artistry.

The first event is set to be held October 22, 2016 at Hamilton's Cotton Factory located at 270 Sherman Avenue North on the third floor of the Mill Building.


Where will your Support Go?

With your donations, we will be able to finance the following:

  • Event Venue – Our overhead costs for renting the space for this event including insurance and liquor license. ENIGMA will be held in a beautiful 10,000 square foot event space inside The Cotton Factory located at 270 Sherman Avenue North in Hamilton, ON. 

  • Photo: Digital Nightmare Halloween Event at The Cotton Factory

  • Equipment – Some of our performers, artists and designers will be using special equipment for installations. This will include anything from special lighting, sound and materials we may need to make sure they have everything they need to put on a great show!

  • Advertising and Promotion – We want to make sure that all of our artists, performers, designers and local businesses get ample exposure! This will include anything from digital advertising, flyers, pamphlets, posters, social media etc.

  • Your donations have a lot of great perks!
Some of our Perk Packages include OBSCURED and ENIGMA swag, original artwork and even issues of OBSCURED Magazine!

Impact

Before we became a magazine, we had three very successful group exhibitions in 2015, highlighting over 20 local underground, surrealist, lowbrow artists in and around Hamilton. Visit our gallery to view photos from these events!
I am very passionate about providing a platform for artists to showcase their work, especially in a highly competitive field. With the ever growing art community in Hamilton, I want to continue to bring light to these artists, designers, performers and musicians.
We are planning to accommodate over 40 artists, performers, vendors and designers at ENIGMA!


Risks & Challenges

With an event of this magnitude, planning and organizing are always a challenge when you are working with so many people. As well as creating enough visibility so that the event is a success. We are confident we can pull together a great community artists, volunteers and supporters to make this event a success!


Other Ways You Can Help

Can't make a donation but still want to help? Make some noise about our campaign and share it on social media and support the arts!

story:
A Struggling Designer!

 

I'm Rana Hamandi, I am a design addict with 10 years of experience. I am the founder of 'iltdesign'. A design studio that offers a blend of creative fields from branding and print designs, to web and digital designs.

 

Throughout my career, I have been stuck with a handful of creative ideas but not knowing how to actually get them done. This struggle was due to the lack of executers' exposure in the design industry in Lebanon.

Upon experience, I have noticed a big number of creatives reaching out through Social Media platforms to find executers for their projects. Unfortunately with no results.

 

/////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////

 

 

DERECIPE was born thereafter: from a design struggle to simply a passion. A passion to track sources to connect them with designers.

 

What is Derecipe?

Derecipe, is a one of a kind search engine specific to the design industry needs. It Allows designers and creatives to find all sources needed to transform their ideas into reality without hassle and with high time efficiency.  

Derecipe allows them to perform their search within the smallest detail needed throughout their project execution, encompassing materials, techniques, products or even simply skills. They will notice that searching for such information and contacts, has never been easier or more accurate, which makes Derecipe the first of its kind in the field.

Designers will be able to narrow their search by selecting a specific interest such as printing services, executers, and suppliers. 

No fee is required to search or being listed on Derecipe.

 

 

 

 

 

A Passion Strike!

 

As I researched this project further, I found out a different world that I have never been familiar with. A world of talents exploitment.

When I began to wander the streets to track big companies, factories, small stores up to talented individuals. I got introduced to the hard living condition of many talented individuals and craftsmen. They are literally hidden treasures that no one promote due to their own personal profits.

Witnessing their hard living condition and the bad experiences of exploitment they went through, made me even more passionate to help them by exposing them online, and giving them an opportunity to stand out where they have no presence.

Hoping Derecipe will make a small difference in their lives.

 

 

Arpi, is a very talented lady, that touched me deeply with her story. Wishing Derecipe will make a small positive impact in her life.

 

 

Time to get some help!

My passion for this initiative has kept me going for four years. 

Through bigger multiple tasks and the amount of work, I am now in a stage where I have responsibility towards designers, executers, craftsmen and others.

Here's a structure of what we are doing:

 

First Phase

1- Intensive Online Search

2- Field Trips

3- Execution Photoshoot

4- Derecipe Platform Design

5- Platform Developement

 

6- Social Media Campaigns

7- Marketing Collaterals Design

8- Collecting Content 

9- Integrating Content 

10- Meetings

11- Attending Exhibitions, and workshops

 

Future Plans

1- Platform Updates (more advanced features)

2- Mobile App 

3- Workshops (introducing designers to execution techniques)

4- Exhibitions (boost craftsmen work)

5- Private Consultancy

We need your contribution to help us prosper this project and build a team that will make Derecipe reachout the design industry in Lebanon. If, we didn’t reach the needed fund goal, we will use the collected funds for the most essential stages, and start our journey.

 

This is not a one year project, this is a lifetime project.
 
 

 

 

Reactions From Creatives!

 

//////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////

 

 

 

 

 

//////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////

This what makes me more addicted and more responsible towards these designers. When I launched my idea through social media, I became more confident that Derecipe is truly a solution for a real problem among Lebanese designers.

 

 

Share Derecipe!

If you can't fund my project, share my

 

STORY!

 

 

 
- Working on Derecipe since 2012 -
LAUNCHED 14.10.2016
 
hello@derecipe.com
www.instagram.com/derecipe
www.facebook.com/derecipelb
www.derecipe.com

story:
Hello All!


My name is Lee Phillips and I am a 18 year old writer and photographer from Washington D.C.

I am currently working on a interactive journal zine. In short, this is a journal combining the words of young people all around the world with space to write and draw in. I'm sending out notebooks to teens in places like Pakistan, France, Spain and many others along with manila envelopes to put things in such as pressed flowers, a sticker anything that they liked or that made an impression on them. 

The young people write in the journal for one month (anything from grocery lists to intense poetry) and then send it back to me! I pick out pieces of the journals sent back, collage them and arrange and leave space for the reader to write in their own thoughts (hence the journal aspect). What I expect to receive back in these journals are a wide range of words that express the diversity of young minds across the world.

Soo what exactly am I doing? In a pinch, curing the teen world of that lonely feeling and angst. Just kidding- but really...

So many times we feel like we are alone in how we feel. I remember as a kid feeling like no one understood what I was feeling. If I knew then that everyone suffered and laughed and thought and lived just like I did, I don't think I would have felt half as lonely. By collecting all of our voices and personalities in one single journal, we are not just creating a journal, but a act of solidarity. The goal is to emphasis how universal our emotions are while at the same time, interacting with the reader by leaving places to add their own voice and journal their own thoughts in response to (or independently) the content already on the page. 

Growing up, all the journals I had were blank pages. The blank page always intimidated me. To me-it implies that once my thoughts are on the paper they are alone. Why does the page have to be blank?  We are not alone in our thoughts and we shouldn't have to feel like we are. In this day and age of technology and communication I still don't feel closer to the world- maybe even farther. Because of this every piece of genuine connection and solidarity must be cherished.  Looking at a page full of the thoughts, hopes and dreams of teens all around the world not only inspires original thought but creates a atmosphere of belonging. 

So far over 50 young people from all over the world have reached out to me wanted to participate. Now all I need is you to help me get the project in motion.

My goal is 800 dollars. Printing and Binding the journals will cost about 500 dollars. The other 300 dollars is needed to commission artists, marketing and promotion and throwing an amazing release party celebrating this project. I also hope to have money left over so that I can give away some of the journals for free to kids who cannot afford it. 

I have been dreaming of executing this project for a while now, but I really do need your help. Those who donate will receive exclusive photo prints by me, a copy of the completed journal as well as other perks.

If you cannot donate in support of this project, I thank you for all of your time and support anyway. There are other ways to help out. If you would like to get involved email me at iamweartdc@gmail.com. 
Thank you!

What I expect to receive back in these journals are a wide range of words that express the diversity of young minds across the world.

Soo what exactly am I doing? In a pinch, curing the teen world of that lonely feeling and angst. Just kidding- but really...
So many times we feel like we are alone in how we feel. I remember as a kid feeling like no one understood what I was feeling. If I knew then that everyone suffered and laughed and thought and lived just like I did, I don't think I would have felt half as lonely. By collecting all of our voices and personalities in one single journal, we are not just creating a journal, but a act of solidarity. The goal is to emphasis how universal our emotions are while at the same time, interacting with the reader by leaving places to add their own voice and journal their own thoughts in response to (or independently) the content already on the page. 
Growing up, all the journals I had were blank pages. The blank page always intimidated me. To me-it implies that once my thoughts are on the paper they are alone. Why does the page have to be blank?  We are not alone in our thoughts and we shouldn't have to feel like we are. In this day and age of technology and communication I still don't feel closer to the world- maybe even farther. Because of this every piece of genuine connection and solidarity must be cherished.  Looking at a page full of the thoughts, hopes and dreams of teens all around the world not only inspires original thought but creates a atmosphere of belonging. 
So far over 50 young people from all over the world have reached out to me wanted to participate. Now all I need is you to help me get the project in motion.
My goal is 800 dollars. Printing and Binding the journals will cost about 500 dollars. The other 300 dollars is needed to commission artists, marketing and promotion and throwing an amazing release party celebrating this project. I also hope to have money left over so that I can give away some of the journals for free to kids who cannot afford it. 
I have been dreaming of executing this project for a while now, but I really do need your help. Those who donate will receive exclusive photo prints by me, a copy of the completed journal as well as other perks.
If you cannot donate in support of this project, I thank you for all of your time and support anyway. There are other ways to help out. If you would like to get involved email me at iamweartdc@gmail.com. Thank you!

story:
Short Summary

Studio Current was founded in 2004 by Vanessa DeWolf as a place for process, practice, and radical autonomy. For 13 years we've been right in the heart of the Pike/Pine corridor supporting artists, activists, and our community. We've welcomed the under represented folks, outsiders, insiders, names and shapes big and small and been a safe space for those that really need one.  It's been magical, and it might be more important now than ever. WE HAVE A UNIQUE AND EXCITING OPPORTUNITY TO GROW AND EXTEND OUR OUTREACH!! Who would have thought that'd be the case in this odd and off-putting political climate? But it's true, and we need your help to do it.

We've moved kitty corner to The Wild Rose, Under Annex Theater, underground with Salon Dewi, and right next to Vermillion Bar and Gallery - and we couldn't be happier about our neighbors! We're still in the heart of the corridor, still welcoming and being the queer, and still supporting and valuing the complexity and diversity of what goes on in lives and culture shaped by creativity and communication. Upsizing has many great advantages. We can host your dance and music performances, your installations, rehearsals, workshops, and classes. And that's just getting started. Of course upsizing our space also means that our operating costs - namely our rent - has also risen. But check it out - it's less than doubled. We have 2 movement studios now, a community room, a full on kitchen, and a storage/muti-media room. It's a small miracle that our rent went up as little as it did with all these new assets. A huge thank you is due to our fantastic landlady Anne Michelson, who adores Studio Current and is a brilliant supporter of the arts and community that is capitol hill. So, for us to grow, we have to raise money.

Now for many years Studio Current had been able to exist under the radar and incredibly nourished because Vanessa DeWolf personally sponsored the space and charged artists very minimally and sometimes not at all to rehearse or take part in seasons of residencies. Some monetary support was provided by these artists, a few fabulous patrons (we love you!), and most of the responsibility fell on Vanessa. She lovingly and characteristically gave everything, including time, energy, creativity, and lots of hugs, as well as the rent each month. But it couldn't last forever like that, so we're evolving. We've panicked, we've rested, and we're not giving up. Good fortune has followed us through rocky times, and we know if we keep at it she will continue to buoy our travels.

A little over a year ago Vanessa handed off the Artistic Directorship to me. I've been a working artist for 20 years and have spent over a decade teaching and plying my craft here in the Capitol Hill neighborhood as well as around the world. I love this place, but i recognize that creative culture needs support - much more support than it is given in our country in general. I'm just learning how to do this job, on the fly, and like Vanessa so far I've been supporting it personally. This fundraiser is a huge turning point for Studio Current, and meeting our goal would mean that we have a little time to get a few more stable support systems in place. It would mean that Studio Current can support art, artists, and our community more and better. And plain and simple, meeting this goal means that Studio Current can continue to exist.

What We Need & What You Get

 

  • We're hoping to raise $30,000 - about half of our annual operating costs. This covers our rent and while that may not sound exciting, it's huge for us! It means that costs don't get passed down to artists who can't afford it, and it means that SC remains accessible to so many more people. It also means that we can allocate other resources to other much needed things like:

 

  • - $3000: new Marley covering for our brand new sprung floor in 2nd movement studio
    - $2000: update, repair, and install lighting and sound systems and projectors
    - $3000: covers moving costs including deposits, insurance on the spaces for a year, and the moving van and labor fee.
    - $1000: update and upgrade storage system so our resources are readily available to the community and resident artists have storage space
    - $1000: update website, cover costs for promotional materials like a sign for our new location and event supplies like programs and fliers

 

  • That's the kind of difference you can make by helping us get to just 1/3 of our goal - $10,000! Why? We want to offer more to our community, and we can, but we need a bridge of support while we work toward sustainability. 
  • We're still run by volunteers, and that's not changing yet. Nobody gets paid money for the work they put into running this space, it's already a labor of love, and we're willing to keep at it! But we need your help!
  • We've got some super unique perks for you. Check 'em out. Special thanks for special support!
  • We're going to give this our best shot, but if we don't make it all the way we won't give up. We're doing everything we can to become sustainable, but much like the standard model, we rely on about 1/3 of our funding from donations in fundraisers like this.

The Impact

We're so close to being able to do more amazing things for artists and our community, we just need some support to help us get our footing along the way. Right now our artists and community organizers need support. Studio Current has long been a safe space, a hub of culture and creativity, and right now we are growing and need your support to do so. Creative culture, local artists, and community gatherings need support. Our goal is to continue to nourish and find new and better ways to support creative culture, autonomy, and community. We want to bring you more art enjoying, more art making, more viewpoints, and more opportunities to do the kinds of things you want to do. This is your world! Studio Current is safe space and is here for you.

Right now there are 10 artists in residence for a 9 month long season of art making. There are 7 artists working as directors also in creative process for the season. That's 17 local artists that you'll be directly supporting with your gift! That's amazing, but that's not all. Every day Studio Current hosts rehearsals for artists that aren't in residence here, but need a space to work. We host photography and filming sessions, dance, theater, and music practice and performances, workshops, classes, potlucks, fundraisers, and birthday parties. 

We're moving as fast as we can toward sustainability and everyone in the organization is doing a great job, but it's just not fast enough to pay the bills yet. All rental fees go to rent, as well as the artist fee from our residency program. This leaves us with about $2000-$3000 each month that we need help to cover. Over the next 4 months (if we can keep running!) this ratio will shift. We're writing grants but not wishing too hard on that star. We're starting a new series called Studio Current Sessions that will feature a variety of local artists and in a show every month. Proceeds from this series go to Studio Current and will help us cover costs.  We're also introducing some special classes and events to help fill the gap. They'll be low priced, but as we've said before, every little bit helps!

 In the meantime we're running this campaign to try to save our placement in all 3 studios in the new location. You can make a huge difference right now for the local artistic community by supporting Studio Current. You can absolutely help shape the culture you want to be a part of! 

 

(We're very lucky to have a fantastic landlord that supports us and our vision. Even so, the neighborhood has and is shifting so rapidly and drastically. The MAD team is made of magic, we have massive opportunities for growth and support in creating culture that manifests creative solutions to real problems. Help grow our culture!)

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help us spread the word! Every little bit truly makes a difference and we appreciate it from the bottom of our wild wild hearts. The more folks hear about this the better. We'd love everyone to come in and be a part of SC. Oh, and donations help too. $5 or $50 or $5000 - it all goes directly to the same place and it absolutely all makes a difference! Please share our links, tell our story, come take a class or put on a show, host a discussion or craft night, have a rehearsal or just roll around on our floors - we want you and thank you!

  • And that's all there is to it.

story:
SHOUT-OUT!

Thank you so much Malin Sjödin, Melissa Kaercher, Malin Borén, Dave André, Grave Robbert, Jackie, Amadine Ferrari for your contributions!


Introduction:

I'm Ingela Lordsdotter. Designer and artist from Sweden. I've been drawing, painting, sewing, sculpting, and much more since I was a child. And for the last 11,5 years I've been running my fashion band Veil of Visions (www.veilofvisions.com) and it has been an explosion of designs during the years!

Me:

My campain:

This campaign is for a intensive course for photorealistic airbrushing. It will allow me to bring Veil of Visions designs to the next level with realistic textures on garments like biomechanical parts, rust, fire optical illusions and much more.

And for this I need funds for the course.

The course will take place only this spring of 2017, so I'm both excited and eager to attend this very rare opportunity! It will be a great investment to develop Veil of Visions designs further.

My previous work:

What I Need & What You Get

For these classes I will need £1300. And the remaining £200 will pay for my flight from Sweden to London, UK where the course will take place. For accommodation I will rely on friends to stay with and I will pay for food and public transport myself.

I will post about the campaign and the progress here and on Facebook.

What I will learn from these classes:

Every little will help towards the goal and the more you will give the more I wish to thank you with gifts! See my list of perks!

If it would turn out that I won't reach the full amount in time I would still do my all to reach the funds and if I still would be successful the funds would go towards more airbrushing equipment and materials like paint, a heat press and more.

For any additional fund I get above the target goal of £1500 will be used for more materials and equipment.

For those that already knows my work and who has worked with me in the past knows that I always brings my visions and ideas to a reality. And if I am ever given a chance I grab it without hesitation.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute but still would like to help me, please spread the word to others so they might help! Feel free to use the Indiegogo sharing tools!

Thank you for helping!

story:
My name is Beck Metzbower, current MFA candidate at Wilson College and full-time visual artist.

As part of the MFA program, specifically the Thesis requirement of facilitating and hosting an exhibit, degree candidates are required to identify, locate, and engage funding for the Thesis show exhibit on their own through grant-seeking and community backing. Being of the program’s inaugural year, the program structure was not identified in a timely manner that would coincide effectively with grant-seeking. Personally, as an artist, I actually prefer inviting the community to become a part of the exhibit by supporting and investing in it individually. The investment becomes much more than one of a monetary nature, but rather an investment in their community and all it offers its members. I honor and respect communities that come together and support the arts & culture by fostering and cultivating an environment in which it can survive and thrive.

The act of holding an exhibit requires many overlooked details. Insurance for the event must be purchased, the space must be identified and reserved/rented, the interior of the space usually has to be painted white and lighting installed (this is the challenge of bringing the arts to rural areas- the spaces are usually not prepared and require adjustments), occupancy permits and other government-related permits are required, inspections are also required, the facility must have handicap access, the event must be marketed and promoted, and so forth.

This specific community funding supports the Spring 2016 Thesis Exhibit in part. I say in part because I am funding over 50% of the exhibit myself, in the form of canvases and over 300lbs of oil paint (and counting). I would not ask others to fund what I am not funding myself.

The exhibit is taking place in a rural, Pennsylvania community that is surrounded by other small, rural communities. These communities have limited accessibility to arts & culture, minimal exposure to the arts at the public education level, and limited access to art opportunities (galleries, exhibits, museums, orchestras, etc.) The community is currently using its resources to introduce arts & culture to the area, specifically Downtown Chambersburg. It is the exhibit's intention to foster this cultivation by hosting the exhibit here, where it is needed most.

The exhibit is dedicated to current social justice issues and 100% of the profit from paintings sold go directly to the artist’s hand-picked, high-impact charities. All of it. Every painting sold. This is the artist’s way of giving back to the community and world.

A very deep and sincere thank you for your time and support. I hope to see you at the exhibit.

story:
Who is this guy?

Hi folks.  I'm Vincent, I'm a dad of six, living in San Jose. I am a maker.  I am passionate about Leather craft, Armoring and working with Brass and Silver. 

  • Leatherwork is what I am passionate about, leather kind of speaks to me.
  • I'm also passionate about making Medieval Armor and working Brass
  • Other make interests include IoT, automation, finding what costs me most from the electricity company.

The family finances are steady, we're safe and secure. This is not an 'ask' for an emergency or tragedy.  If your donation is between me, or someone who needs real help, forget me and my sewing machine.  If you're looking to fill a quota of donating to worthy causes, my wrists could be it. I see a doctor about the RSI/Tendonitus, do stretches, wear braces.  I'm very fortunate to be covered medically.

What We Need & What You Get

The Details:

  • The machine costs 1500.00  Here it is if you're curious
  • Once I have the machine, I can create faster - so making you something as a token of appreciation is completely doable
  • All funds will go towards tools. I'll of course post images of them in action
  • I plan to start creating How-To videos. Much of what I make is medieval recreations, or at least based off of them. I am by no means a professional, but it is my hope it can help someone. 

The Impact

Currently, I complete 2-4 projects a month. Only one project in the last 4 years has been for monetary gain:

  • Many projects are given to others in the Society for Creative Anachronism
  • The How-To videos will be freely accessible
  • Images below show some of my previous work.

Other Ways You Can Help

I get it, you can't chip in. No problem, Share far and Wide!

story:
How Blossom Blast Was Born and Why It Is Important　
ブロッサム・ブラスト（通称BB）が発足した経緯とその重要性​

＊和文は英文に続きます。

My name is Miki Saito and I am a Japanese female artist who grew up both in Japan and abroad. I am passionate about art as a form of self-expression and as a vehicle for change. In 2016, while working with the TokyoDex, we came up with the concept for “Blossom Blast,” an all-female exhibition that would both showcase the amazing talent pool of female artists in Japan while helping raise awareness for gender inequality, an important issue that is under-discussed in Japan.

女性アーティストの1人として“Blossom Blast/ブロッサム・ブラスト”の企画に携わっています、サイトウ ミキといいます。幼いころから日本と海外を行き来して育ち、アートをこよなく愛しています。アートは私にとって自己表現であり、「変化」のためのツールでもあります。

TokyoDex と一緒にアートのお仕事していた2016年、私たちはBBを企画しました。展示作品を女性の手によるものに限定し、日本で活躍する女性アーティストを紹介するとともに、この国では議論が進んでいない男女の格差問題について関心を高めること、そして女性活躍促進の応援をすることが、この展示会のねらいでした。

Our friends at UltraSuperNew Gallery loved the idea, and despite having less than a month to pull the whole thing together, the response from both the female artists we reached out to and the support from the general public we received was incredible. Over 750 people came out to the 2-week exhibition and Google searches for “IWD2016 Japan” puts Blossom Blast 2016 at the top of the list. It was so clear we were serving an under-served community and we had to continue.

昨年は展示会の発案から実行までの期間は1か月を切っていましたが、UltraSuperNewギャラリーから企画への賛同と出展した女性アーティスト達からの協力もあり、 展示会は大盛況に終わりました。2週間の開催期間中に来場者は750人を超え、「IWD2016 Japan」（＊IWD：「国際女性の日」の略）というキーワードでGoogle検索のトップに表示されるほどの注目を集めました。アーティスト達にとっても来場者にとってもこのような大変意義のある展示であった事は明らかであり、今後もこの活動を続けていく必要があると強く感じています。

By continuing BB, we are providing a voice for women in a country where the stark reality of gender equity in Japan remains stagnant. In a recent survey by the World Economic Forum, Japan was ranked 111th among 145 nations on the Equality Index despite enjoying the third largest economy in the world. Studies show that increased diversity in the workplace leads to better productivity for all workers, and with a rapidly ageing population, it is certain that the empowerment of Japanese women in society is pivotal to Japan’s future prosperity.

今年もまたBBを開催することで、男女格差が縮まらない厳しい現実を、アート業界から日本社会へ訴えるのと同時に、女性たちに発言の場を提供していきたいのです。世界経済フォーラムの最近の調査によると、日本は世界第3位の経済大国であるにも関わらず、男女平等ランキングでは145ヶ国中 111位となっています。職場の多様性が高まると、そこで働く全員の生産性が向上するという調査結果もあります。急速に高齢化が進む日本では、女性の社会的地位の向上が、日本の将来のためにも極めて重要といわれています。

As women march across the globe to reassert the importance of their inalienable rights, there has never been a more important time for the artists to partake in this cause through creativity. Please support our cause and join the movement to keep this going!

現在、Women’s March (女性たちの行進)というデモが世界中で繰り広げられ、女性の格差や権利について考える機会を設ける動向があります。このようなときだからこそ、アーティストたちは表現という形で社会と共鳴しながら、影響を与える事ができるのではないかと考えています。BBの趣旨へのご賛同、ご支援をよろしくお願いいたします。一緒にこのムーブメントを盛り上げましょう。

＿＿＿＿＿＿＿＿＿＿＿＿＿＿＿＿＿＿＿＿＿＿

Why We Need Your Help
ご支援いただきたい内容

BB is a non-for profit exhibition, and everyone on our team as well as our speakers have volunteered their time towards this project. However, we have some hard costs to cover including shipping, gallery space, printing costs, et al. The bottom line for us is $5,000 to support out-of-pocket costs, but we have set our goal at $10,000 for the following reasons:

*Supporting female artists is paramount to our cause and we are insisting on paying the artists for their contribution to the campaign. A portion of your donation will go directly to the artists who are also volunteering towards BB.

* To cover gallery and staffing costs, which is essential to sustainability of this project. We also plan to make a video documentary that includes artist interviews and coverage of the events that take place in the gallery. 

BBチームはこの企画をボランティアで運営しています。しかし、作品の運搬費やギャラリー運営費などの経費は発生してしまいます。今回の最低目標額は必要経費の5,000ドルですが、できれば1万ドルを集めたいと思っています。5,000ドルを超える皆さまの寄付の一部は、以下のように使われます。

  • ギャラリーの施設利用費と人件費に使用。また、アーティストへのインタビューやギャラリー内で行われるイベントを撮影して、ドキュメンタリー映像を制作したいと思っています。インターネットを通して、東京から世界へこの活動の記録画像や映像を発信していく事は、今後の日本社会を変えていく大きな一歩になるのではないかと考えています。そして、どんな活動においても、継続していくということが最重要だと思っています。この予算は今年だけではなく、未来のBBの活動をも支える上で大きな意味を持ちます。

We understand that there are many causes in need of funding, especially during these difficult times worldwide. If it is difficult for you to help us with a donation, we hope you will consider sharing our campaign with others who may be able to help. And if you are in Tokyo, we hope you could come support us by visiting the exhibition March 1 through 18 at UltraSuperNew Gallery.

世界中で問題が絶えない昨今、資金援助を必要としている団体やプロジェクトはBBの他にもたくさんあります。BBへの寄付が難しい場合、この募金活動をまわりの方にシェアして下さると幸いです。東京にいらっしゃる方は是非BB期間中にご来場ください。UltraSuperNewギャラリーで3月1日から18日まで開催しています。

Sincerely,
Miki Saito & The Blossom Blast Team
Miki Saito とBBチーム一同　より

 

展示情報 (Exhibition Info)  :  https://goo.gl/rqVlFl

Blossom Blast 2017
展示期間：2017年3月1日（水）〜　3月18日（土）
営業時間 : 10:00 – 19:00 (期間中無休）
場所：UltraSuperNew Gallery 〒150-0001 東京都渋谷区神宮前1 - 1 - 3

story:
Hi I'm Gawie, a 28-year old South African artist raising money for an international residency.

(Above: That's me)

For those who don't know me, in 2013 I quit my full time job as an illustrator to pursue my passion as a full-time artist and I've worked my ass off every day since. I've exhibited nationally and internationally and I'm busy working on my second solo exhibition. 

My work (usually in ink or charcoal) is an exploration my own identity and my understanding of myself in relation to nature and memory. I draw inspiration from my natural surroundings and

I was selected as one of 6 international artists to attend the prestigious Budapest art factory residency in Hungary. I'll also be the first South African artist to attend. How cool is that?

Budapest Art Factory is a registered NGO. Unfortunately they don't cover any of the costs and I will miss out on this immense growing and learning opportunity, unless I can secure sponsorship from those who support the arts, like yourself.

Working from my tiny apartment, I have always been restricted by size but this residency will be the first time I will have my own space. I will be given a studio space of 60m2, which means I will have an unrestricted work environment where I can create larger scale artworks and finally experiment and develop my knowledge of sculpture and large scale drawings.

I'm also extremely excited to see how the surroundings in Budapest will affect my work. I also plan to further my connection to nature by creating my own inks from surrounding flora. 

(Above: The tiny studio space in my lounge)

 

 

Wondering where your money will be going to? Here's a budget breakdown.

 

Your support will allow me to go on this artist residency where I will create a new body of work in preparation of my second solo exhibition at Rust-enVrede Gallery opening on the 14th of November 2017 .

 

Here is what you will receive in exchange for some art.

$20 Exhibition Acknowledgement

$25 Hand written thank you note

$40  Original tiny drawing 

Seedling  series 1-100

Ink on Fabriano paper

10cm x 12.5cm 

2017

 

$70 

Breathe

Silkscreen (Colours may vary. Each one will be unique)

Ink on Fabriano paper

21cm x 30cm

2017

 

$100  (Original drawing) 

Untitled Seedlings 1-30

Ink on Fabriano paper

20cm x 12.5cm

2016-2017

 

$350 

"Plume revised"  

Cyanotype on Fabriano paper

50cm x 70cm 

Edition: /5 

2016

$500 

"Limbo"

Ink on Fabriano paper ​

47cm x 30cm

2016

 

Whether I barely meet my goal, or get twice as much, I hope that you'll come to realise that I am highly appreciative to anyone and everyone who has taken the time out of their day to browse this page. If you are financially unable to give, or just want to help me achieve my goal, please help spread the word.

Thank you!

Gawie Joubert

story:
Hello, I'm Teodoro and I'm a five years old Italian boy. I love pirates , rock music, playing in the mud , and most of all I love painting with my dad . When I Grow up I want to become an artist .

My dad is writing for me this story, because I do not know how to write.

Since I was 2 years old, it was very clear to me that in the future I'll be an artist.
I love to draw, paint, make collages, art installations and little sculptures. I'm a good dancer & I love cooking as well.

This is my project
At the moment I sell my works in order to achieve my goal: save a little amount of money in my piggy-bank to study art around the world.
The school where I would go is the Central Saint Martins school of art, in London UK.
These are a couple of pictures from there, isn't beautiful?!

Here you can find some pictures of me drawing, painting, discovering art or climbing mountains!

Here I'm drawing


Here I'm discovering Caravaggio, the Italian Master


Here I'm climbing mountains

These are some of my latest collages. Enjoy!

"DeerHeadGirl". 2015 Teodoro

"Matte". 2015 Teodoro

"Cyclops" 2015 Teodoro

The Impact

I can become an artist and continue to play with colors, paper, scissors, brushes, materials & painting. I can contribuite to create some beautiful things in in the world!

Risks & Challenges

No risk at all, I will make a little draw or a more complex canvas for each donators.

Other Ways You Can Help

No other ways! I want to sell my art to achieve my goal!
